loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María, de 37 años de edad, está soltera, vive con su madre y sus 2 hijos, ella se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable con sus compromisos y servicio a los demás.

María, tiene 8 años de experiencia en realizar trabajos de corte y confección, de esta manera gana dinero para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar; su madre también le ayuda a realizar los trabajos de confección, para cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen.  

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar tela, hilo y para comprar una nueva máquina de coser, porque tiene muchos encargos y necesita abastecer su dispensario de insumos, para poder cumplir sus compromisos y tener un mejor ingreso para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

María, sueña con tener un negocio grande de venta de ropa y productos de cosmetología, para genere las ganancias suficientes para satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old. She is single and lives with her mother and her two children. She is a very responsible person with her commitments and her service to others.

María has 8 years experience in cutting and sewing. In this way she makes money to satisfy the needs of her household. Her mother also helps her with the sewing work to fill the orders they have.

María needs the loan to buy fabric and thread and to buy a new sewing machine. She has many orders and needs to stock her shop with supplies to be able to fulfill her commitments and have greater income to satisfy the needs of her family.

María dreams of having a large business selling clothing and beauty products to generate sufficient profits to satisfy the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread and to buy a new sewing machine as she has many orders and needs to stock up with supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Daisy

texts.es:
A sus 50 años de edad, Gloria, es una mujer alegre y optimista. Desde hace 12 años abrió las puertas de su pulpería para solventar sus gastos y los de su hija a la que ha criado como madre soltera; sin embargo sus ingresos no son suficientes para mejorar por completo su condición de vida, en especial el estado arquitectónico de su casa,poco a poco ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida.
Actualmente Gloria ha solicitado a kiva un préstamo, para mejorar sus condiciones higiénicas con la construcción de un servicio sanitario y así lograr reconstruir su casa poco a poco con ayuda de su hija. 
Después de terminar el préstamo esta madre abnegada tiene planteados otros proyectos, enfocados en la mejora de su casa de habitación para lograr vivir dignamente junto a su hija.
texts.en:
At 50 years of age Gloria is a happy and optimistic woman. It has been 12 years since she opened the doors to her grocery store to pay the bills for herself and her daughter who she raised as a single mother. However, her income is not enough to completely improve her living conditions, particularly the architectural state of her house, but bit by bit she has made improvements.

Gloria is applying to Kiva for a loan to improve her hygiene by building a toilet so that she can rebuild her house bit by bit with the help of her daughter.

After this loan ends this self-sacrificing mother already has other projects planned which will focus on improving her home so that she and her daughter will be able to live with dignity.

loans.use: to improve her hygiene by building a toilet.

loans.name: Unión Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNION Y PROGRESO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Guadalupe es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de DVD, venta de café, venta de verduras, servicio de transporte, venta de productos de limpieza, venta de jugos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Guadalupe es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos de limpieza; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de detergentes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The not for profit association 'Union y Progreso' (Union and Progress) will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Pan American Regional Hub. The group is made up of eleven members and is led by an executive board of which Guadalupe is president. The members of the community association run a variety of businesses including selling food, DVDs, coffee, vegetables, providing a transport service, selling cleaning products and juices.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro-business owners, one of whom is Guadalupe. She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, having been invited to join by a friend who is a client of the institution. At the moment Guadalupe runs a business selling cleaning products which she says she learnt from her mother many years ago.

This loan will be used for working capital (to purchase detergent in bulk) which Guadalupe will buy from the vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell in her market place. This form of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family financially as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Guadalupe replied that she likes the health service that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy detergent in bulk

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
Dramane  est le client qui tient en mains le bélier.
Agé de quarante-trois ans (43 ans), Dramane est un  embouche malien des mouton. Marié, père de sept (07) enfants dont un écolier niveau fondamental. Il rêve dans l’avenir de construire une maison dans une ville pour ses enfants. Dramane n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais il se défend beaucoup dans son embouche. Dramane a fait recourt au RMCR pour  soutenir et renforcer son activité. Avec son prêt, il achète des béliers et les aliments bétails dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Il engraisse ses béliers et les revend dans les mêmes foires hebdomadaires de sa zone mais si les ventes coïncident avec la tabaski il part vendre à l’étranger. Dramane fait un bénéfice de 15 000 FCFA environ par mois. Dramane fait l’embouche depuis plus de 15 ans mais il a bénéficié le soutien du RMCR il y a plus de deux (02) ans de cela. Grâce au soutien  du RMCR, son activité marche bien. Ce qui lui plaît beaucoup dans son activité (embouche ovine) en est qu’elle génère assez de profits ainsi qu’elle procure de la fumée organique pour ses champs. Dramane n’a pas de difficulté majeure par rapport au déroulement de son activité.
texts.en:
Dramane is the one holding a sheep in the photo. Dramane is 43 years old, lives in Mali and raises sheep. He is married and has seven children, one of whom attends primary school. Dramane's dream for the future is to build a house in town for his children. Dramane did not have an opportunity to go to school, but he manages his livestock business well. He has reached out to RMCR to bolster and develop his business. Thanks to his loan, he buys sheep and feed at the weekly markets in his region. He fattens up his sheep and resells them at the same weekly markets; however, when his sales overlap with the Tabaski festival [as the Islamic celebration of Eid al-Adha is known in Senegal) he sells abroad. 

Dramane earns about 15,000 West African francs per month. He has been raising livestock for over 15 years, but has had the financial support from RMCR only for the last two years. Thanks to RMCR's support his business is going well. What he likes  about raising sheep is that it brings him sufficient profit as well as provides organic fertilizer for his land. Dramane does not  experience major challenges in his business development.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Ronza

texts.en:
Ronza is a 21-year-old single lady who has been working a part-time job as a sales person and as a tutor to cover her college tuition fees and make her living.

She is a hardworking lady who is looking forward to graduating this year, but her acquired income is barely enough to cover her daily living needs. Unfortunately, she can not cover the unexpected increase in education costs. 

For this reason, Ronza is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmou  to pay for her marketing graduation scholastic year tuition fees. She is looking forward to graduating and finding a suitable job.

loans.use: to pay for her marketing graduation scholastic year tuition fees.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a 22-year-old single man from Ramallah city. He lives with his family in an old, small house. He is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support. 

Muhannad has a dry cleaning business in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict. Muhannad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his auto repair workshop. 

He hopes that this new tool will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to open a second branch.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is 38 years old and supports six people in her family.

She sells clothes and hand bags, a business she has been doing for the past eight years. She earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES.

Claris has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more hand bags for selling. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hand bags for selling.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is a 22-year-old single man living with his family in Ajloun, a city in northern Jordan. 

Bahaa goes to a private university. His major is in religion science, and he is in his second year of studies now. Bahaa also works after school selling clothes in shop, which helps him to ‎afford university. He also helps his family in their household financial matters. 

Now he is applying for an ‎education loan to help him cover his next semester fees.

loans.use: to cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Guerlouse

texts.fr: Guerlouse a 24 ans. Elle vit en union libre. Pour générer un peu de revenus, elle revend des boissons gazeuses. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock. A l’avenir, elle souhaite vendre d’autres produits alimentaires aussi.
texts.en: Guerlouse is 24 years old. She lives together with her partner. In order to earn a bit of income, she resells soft beverages. Guerlouse has been in this business for five years. She needs a loan in order to increase her stock. In the future, she would like to start selling other food items as well.

loans.use: to stock up on soft drinks.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is maize farmer from Hayin Allahuwa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Musa is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as buying food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Musa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Gloria Asunción

texts.es:
Gloria, de 67 años de edad, está casada y tiene solo un hijo de 46 años de edad. 

Gloria, es una señora que a su edad se encarga de preparar queso y crema para la venta, es muy responsable y muy honrada; junto a su esposo mantienen 23 vacas y 30 cerdos incluyendo los pequeños, su hijo es quien se encarga del cuidado de estos animales.

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para reparar un establo y su porqueriza, de esta manera pretende mejorar estas infraestructuras, para el cuidado del ganado y de los cerdos.

Gloria, sueña con construir una vivienda más grande y con mayores comodidades para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 67 years old. She is married and has only one son who is 46 years old.

Gloria is a woman who at her age takes charge of preparing the cheese and cream for sale. She is very responsible and honest. Together with her husband they keep 23 cows and 30 pigs including the little ones. Her son is in charge of the care of these animals

Gloria needs the loan to repair a stable and a pigpen and in this way hopes to improve these structures to care for the cows and pigs.

Gloria dreams of constructing a bigger house with more conveniences for her and her husband.

loans.use: to repair a stable and a pigpen.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар уроженец Шахритуского района. Он очень трудолюбивый и ответственный человек.  Ему 63 года, но, не смотря на свой возраст, он занимается сельским хозяйством. На своем земельном участке он выращивает пшеницу.  У Мунаввар 5 детей, которые помогают ему в его деле. Однако в этом году из-за кризиса Мунаввар не смог вовремя закупить семена пшеницы и соответствующие минеральные удобрения.  Мунаввар боится, что в следующем году он не сможет получить хороший урожай. И поэтому он обратился за кредитом в надежде, что Вы сможете ему помочь в этом деле.
texts.en: Munnavar was born in the Shahrituz region. He is a very hard-working and responsible person. He is 63 years old, but in spite of his age, he still does farmwork. He grows wheat on his field. Munavvar has five children, who help him in his business. However, because of the financial crisis this year Munnavar was unable to buy wheat seeds and the necessary mineral fertilizers in time. He is worried that he will not be able to obtain a good harvest next year. This is why he has applied for a loan, hoping that you will help him out.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a thirty nine year old woman with four children living in Masindi-Uganda. She deals in second hand clothes but also deals in crop production. She works hard to sustain her family's needs and has a responsibility of  educating her children and providing basic needs of the family. She hopes to educate her children and improve her household income.  She requests for a loan to buy clothes for sale before the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes inventory for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en:
Yazan is 23 years old and lives in the southern part of Jordan, in Tafileh. He is studying at a university, majoring special education.

Recently, his family faced some financial problems. Yazan had to help them and give them his semester fees due to his sense ‎of responsibility towards his family. Because of that, he had to apply for an education loan to be able to pay university fees and complete his semester.‎

loans.use: to be able to pay for ‎university fees and complete his semester.‎.

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime, de 56 años de edad, es albañil de profesión, pero también cultiva la tierra, es muy trabajador y su trabajo es reconocido en el área de construcción, porque en la zona ha construido varias viviendas muy bonitas y con estilo americano, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad.

Jaime, se dedica a la agricultura y a la construcción de viviendas, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos y con ello lleva el sustento a su familia.

Jaime, necesita el préstamo para comprar equipo para la albañilería y pagar mozos para cortar la cosecha, porque se aproxima y necesita el apoyo.

Jaime, sueña con hacerle algunas mejoras a su humilde vivienda y que sus hijos puedan aprender un buen oficio y estudien.
texts.en:
Jaime is 56 years old. He is a bricklayer by profession but he is also a farmer. He is very hard-working and his work is known in the construction sector as he has built a number of very beautiful houses in the American style. He is in a relationship and has two children aged 13 and 15 years old.

Jaime works in farming and constructing houses. This activity is his main source of income and he provides sustenance for his family with it.

Jaime needs the loan to buy equipment for bricklaying and pay labor to harvest his crops as harvest is approaching and he needs the help.

Jaime dreams of making some improvements to his humble house and having his children learn a good profession and study.

loans.use: to buy equipment for bricklaying and pay labor to bring in his crops as harvest is approaching and he needs the help.

loans.name: Razan

texts.en:
Razan is a married woman with one child. She is 21 years old and lives in Ajloun.

Because of Razan's marriage, she is delayed in ‎university because she postponed her education for two years. Her child is one year old, so now she can complete her ‎education. Her husband cannot cover her education fees, but that does not prevent her for achieving her dreams.

Therefore, she applied for an education loan to cover her university fees and to achieve her dreams to become a productive ‎woman and find a good job to help her husband with household expenses. ‎

loans.use: to cover her university fees

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Mwaswalehe is a married woman and a mother of four children. Two of her children are in school and the rest are done with their studies. She is a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She owns a food cafe which she has operated for ten years, selling from home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from others in the same business and her aspirations are to expand her business in the near future.

Mwaswalehe is borrowing this loan to buy food for her cafe during this festive season. She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting, that will help her very much. She joined Yehu to have access to loans which will help in expanding her business.

loans.use: buy food stuff for her cafe during this festive season.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a capable man, was born in the southern part of Jordan 1993. Single and living with his parents, he is a university ‎student majoring in geography. He is well known among friends and students.

Ahmad lacks sufficient funds to pay his tuition ‎fees, but he is an ambitious and energetic guy, so he did not want to stand there without doing ‎anything.

Therefore, he requested a loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams. He hopes to be ‎supported.‎

loans.use: to pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Shafiu

texts.en:
Shafiu is a maize farmer from Dantani village. As a Babban Gona member, Shafiu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Shafiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Shafiu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest/

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Shafiu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Shafiu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Vic View School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Yoasi. He is the Head Teacher of Vic View School, a mixed school in the urban area of Bugembe in Jinja with 650 students. Vic View School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Vic View School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Yoasi ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for students.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en: Hatem is a 29-year-old single male from the Gaza Strip in Palestine. He chose to take a loan from ACAD, to buy a car to use as a taxi, because he is currently unemployed. The taxi will help him increase his income and help his family so he can pay their rent and bills. Hatem hopes to expand his business so that he can buy a decent car in the future. The main two challenges that Hatem faces are the increasing gas prices in the Gaza Strip, and the high competition. Hatem would like to thank ACAD and KIVA for letting him share his story.

loans.use: to buy a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar, who is a 60-year-old married man, is from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He lives with his housekeeper wife and child.

Nowadays, the family has no source of income and lives in poverty. Nodar and his wife are temporarily unemployed. Previously, he had a business selling ice cream and has experience in the trading field. Now, he needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital to re-start his trading business and generate some income.

Until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo, Nodar couldn’t receive a loan from local financial institutions because of their requirements to have stable revenue or business income. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Nodar plans to purchase a stock of frozen products and start selling locally at good prices. He owns several refrigerators from the past business he had and will use them now for frozen fast food products.

The loan will be great help to Nodar, as he will become the only breadwinner in the family and will tackle financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of frozen products and have money for working capital.

loans.name: Estrellas De Vilaque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE VILAQUE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosaura es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de manta, venta de ganado vacuno, venta de leche. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosaura es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que se realizó en su comunidad. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de manta; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas de Vilaque" [Vilaque Stars] comunal bank communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro Woman] as part of the Pan-American Regional Office. The bank is comprised of eight members and is managed by a Board of Directors, of which Rosaura is president. The businesses that the members run are varied and include selling the following: cheese, blankets, beef cattle, and milk.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises including Rosaura's. She says that this is the first time she has been involved in Pro Mujer and that she joined because of a promotion the institution did in her area. She currently runs a business selling blankets. She says she started this business through her own initiative several years ago.

The loan that she will now take out will be used to increase capital (through the purchase of blankets in bulk) that she will acquire from wholesale vendors from El Alto and later commercialize in her retail space. This kind of work allows her to generate an income to support her family economically, since she lives in a civil union and has two children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale blankets.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
Yadira es una madre admirable, que sueña con adquirir junto a su compañero una casa propia que se convierta en un patrimonio para sus 3 hijos, ya que actualmente habita en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 16 años Yadira emprendió como comerciante estableciendo una pulpería y una venta de fritanga, actualmente tiene 33 años de edad y sus sueños no caducan.  
En esta temporada en la que circula el dinero con mayor facilidad, Yadira no dudo en acudir a MiCrédito y Kiva para gestionar el desembolse de un préstamo, el dinero recibido lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y granos básicos para su fritanga.
Gracias a MiCrédito y Kiva mejorara su condición de vida, porque va a invertir el dinero en esta excelente temporada y luego de cancelar el préstamo piensa continuar con su negocio para poder comprar su terreno.
texts.en:
Yadira is an admirable mother who dreams of having her own home with her partner. The home will become an inheritance for their three children, since they are currently renting a house. For 16 years Yadira has been an entrepreneur who setup a grocery store and a fried food stall. She is currently 33 years old and her dreams have not ceased.

This is the season in which money is circulating with the most ease. Because of this, she didn't hesitate to reach out to MiCrédito and Kiva to initiate the disbursement of a loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks and basic grains for her fried food shop.

Thanks to MiCrédito and Kiva, her quality of life will improve because she will invest the money during this excellent season. After repaying the loan, she thinks of continuing her business to be able to purchase her land.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and basic grains for her fried food shop.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Bihembe Group

texts.en:
Venantie is a 58-year-old, married mother with four children. She has operated a small business of charcoal for the past one year. She works every day from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Venantie is committed to her business so that her children may be able to go to school and have health care.

She is the president of the Tuzamurane Rane Bihembe group, and she is the one who has a book in her hands.

Venantie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more charcoal to sell. With this loan, she will earn more profits, which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, as well as pay her children's school fees, to pay medical insurance and to buy new clothes for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sulochana's Group

texts.en:
Sulochana, standing to the left-hand side in the photograph, has a family size of three. She hails from a small village of Banarpal, Odisha, India. Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The family, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, she, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan of 40,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes in it. Your loan will help her family get access to basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

Sulochana is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting the same.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes in it

loans.name: Yudesi P. Kalerwe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Nelson. He is the Director of Yudesi School Kalerwe, a mixed school in the urban area of Kampala in Kalerwe with 900 students. Yudesi School Kalerwe has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Yudesi School Kalerwe will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Nelson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, and will increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hannafi

texts.en:
Hannafi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hannafi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hannafi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Hannafi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hannafi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Hannafi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a fifty-year-old married man with seven children living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop that sells general merchandise like sugar, soap, rice, and other products. He is a hard working man, getting his capital from farming, and he has the responsibility of educating his children. He has a dream of completing his commercial house. Patrick requests a loan to pay tuition for his children.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his children.

loans.name: Nyenga Secondary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Nelson. He is the Head Teacher of Nyenga Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Bukiwe with 980 students. Nyenga Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining UV water and Tulip filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase UV and Tulip filtration water treatment systems with a 450 litre tank and five sets of 20-litre buckets, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Nyenga Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Nelson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, and will increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Crane Preparatory School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Keith. He is the head teacher of Crane Preparatory School, a mixed school in the rural area in Bundibugyo with 350 students.

Crane Preparatory School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Crane Preparatory School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Keith ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well, as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mwanaiki

texts.en:
Mwanaiki is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaiki operates a water supply business, selling from home to the neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase water pipes and other installation items in order to be able to increase the geographic area of water supply to more customers. She also sells juice to earn a living.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and other installation items

loans.name: Faithfulness Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her late 20's, is married to a driver and has three children who are still in school. She has been selling curtain material at her shop for 10 years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Grace's second loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of curtains, and has managed to repay her loan successfully. Grace is so thankful for the loan and appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting their group. She and her husband use their profits to pay school fees for their children, renovate their house, repay the loan, and cover household expenses.

Grace will use this loan to buy up-to-date curtains to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of opening another shop to sell fashion clothes.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group Faithfulness, whose members will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date curtains to meet customer requirements.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling different products like foodstuffs and clothes from home to the neighbours. She faces a major challenge of competition from business people in the same business. She also sells water for a living. She dreams of opening another business in the future.

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes, cooking oil, rice, etc. for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes, cooking oil, rice, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Meles

texts.fr: Meles a 38 ans, il vit en union libre et il a deux enfants. Tailleur réputé dans son quartier, Meles est un entrepreneur infatigable et il souhaite améliorer ses conditions de vie grâce à son petit atelier de couture. Il a embauché deux autres couturiers pour l’aider quotidiennement à exécuter les commandes de ses clients. Grâce à cette activité, il peut subvenir à l'éducation de ses enfants et nourrir la famille. Il demande un microcrédit pour acheter du tissu.
texts.en: Meles is 38 years old. He lives in a de facto union he and has two children. A well-known tailor in his neighbourhood, Meles is a relentless businessman and he wishes to improve his living conditions through his small sewing shop. He hired two other dressmakers to help him daily to complete his clients' orders. Thanks to this activity, he can support the education of his children and feed his family. He asks for a microcredit in order to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy a mass of fabric.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz, 39 years old, is from Bolnisi. He has a wife and little daughter and son. The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activity. They own a plot of agricultural land and four pigs and the income is too insignificant for a four-member family. Malkhaz needs financial assistance to be involved in another stable business and tackle the financial difficulties.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Malkhaz has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. With the loan amount, Malkhaz will purchase a second-hand car and will start serving local people as a taxi driver.
The loan will greatly assist Malkhaz and his family members. He will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start serving people as a taxi driver

loans.name: Marc-Elie

texts.fr: Marc-Elie, 33 ans, est marié et père de deux enfants. Il vend  des produits  alimentaires au grand marché public de son quartier. Cela fait déjà six ans qu’il est dans cette activité. Il y trouve de quoi pour prendre soin de sa famille et pour épargner un peu d’argent. Il sollicite du crédit pour éviter des ruptures de stock.
texts.en: Marc-Elie, 33 years old, is married and father of two children. He sells food products at the large public market in his neighbourhood. It has been more than six years that he is in this business. Here he finds enough to take care of his family and to save up some money. He asks for the credit in order to avoid shortages of stock.

loans.use: to increase his stock.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is 33 years and married with a child. She is a hardworking woman who has operated a retail shop for 10 years now. Through  that, she is able to meet her family's needs. She is doing well, but would do better if not for the limitation of capital. Oliver would like to construct a house for her family, but lacks some materials on site. She is requesting money to buy materials like sand, bricks and timber to start her construction project.

loans.use: to buy materials like sand, bricks and timber to start up her construction project

loans.name: Tujeneza Acb Group

texts.en: Petronille, 50, is a group leader. She is married with nine children between 6 and 30 years old. The group is called TUJENEZA, which means “WE CAME NICELY” in English. They sell different Items and they wish to expand their businesses in order to have a better future. She sells cement and has been running this business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cement to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to renovate her house

loans.use: To buy more cement to sell.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Twegerane Acb Sub Grp A Group

texts.en: Valentine, 43, is a group leader. She is married with six children aged 7 to 22 years old They all go to school. The group is called TWEGERANE, which means “squeezed” in English. They sell different items and they wish to expand their businesses for a better future. Valentine is a farmer who sells foodstuffs and has been doing it as a business for the past eight years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice, beans and maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Turikumwe Cb Group

texts.en: Thacienne is a group leader; aged 32.She is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 11 years. The group is called TURIKUMWE which means “We are together” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells charcoal and has been running this business for the past 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal for sale.And with the profits from the business she would like to pay for  medical insurance.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Turismo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TURISMO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delfina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras (faldas para mujer), venta de chamarras, venta de chompas, venta de peluches, venta de abrigos, tienda de barrio, venta de chocolates. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delfina es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de polleras (faldas para mujer); da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su hermana hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de tela e hilo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Turismo" communal bank is beginning its seventh loan cycle through Pro Mujer's Panamericana office. The group has eight members and has a board of directors where Delfina is president. The members have different trades, including: selling skirts, selling jackets, selling coats, a grocery shop, and selling chocolates.

This loan will be benefit small-time entrepreneurs in Delfina's group. Delfina herself says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago following an invitation from a friend who was already a borrower at the organisation. Delfina currently has a business producing and selling skirts. She says that she started this business with the help of her sister a few years ago.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying thread and material in bulk in the city of El Alto. These goods will then be used to produce items that Delfina will sell. This work allows Delfina to support her family financially. She is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health education offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy wool and thread in bulk.

loans.name: Flor De Causaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE CAUSAYA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Andrea es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son: venta de queso y venta de leche. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Andrea es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que se realizó en su comunidad. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de leche por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Causaya" communal bank is beginning its second loan cycle through Pro Mujer's Copacabana office. The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors that has Andrea as its president. The members have different trades, including selling cheese and selling milk.

This loan will benefit small-time entrepreneurs in Andrea's group. Andrea herself says that she joined Pro Mujer eight months ago following an invitation during a promotional campaign run by Pro Mujer in her community. Andrea currently has a business selling milk. She says she started this business under her own initiative a few years ago.

This loan will be used to buy milk in bulk from vendors in her community. She will then sell the milk at the markets in the city of El Alto. This work allows Andrea to provide financial support to her family; she has a partner and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies by saying that she likes the training offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy milk in bulk.

loans.name: Yancy Marisol

texts.es:
Yancy, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, vive junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando su nivel básico, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 6 años, mientras ella se encarga de vender el pescado que su esposo sustrae de la laguna.

Yancy, es vendedora de pescado desde hace 8 años y lo aprendió de una amiga, quien le apoyo a conocer el negocio y luego se independizo para realizarlo con el apoyo de su esposo, pero también se dedican a la producción de granos básicos. 

Yancy, necesita el préstamo para comprar redes de pesca para el mejoramiento de su equipo de pesca artesanal. 

Yancy, sueña con que sus hijos tengan una estabilidad familiar y estudien para el desarrollo de cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Yancy is 32 years old and completed high school. She lives with her two children, ages ten and seven years old. Both children attend primary school. Yancy is married; her husband has been a fisherman for six years while she herself sells the fish that her husband brings home from the lake.

Yancy has been selling fish for eight years. She learned the trade from a friend and later started to work on her own with the support of her husband. The couple also works producing basic grains.


Yancy needs this loan in order to buy fishing nets to improve fishing equipment.

Yancy dreams of her children having stability, and of the studying so that they may develop well.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets to improve fishing equipment.

loans.name: Rosy Beatriz

texts.es:
Rosy, de 24 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, está soltera, tiene un hijo y vive con su madre.

Rosy, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y también joyería, posee este negocio desde hace un par de años y fue su madre quien le enseño a trabajar de esta manera; ahora vende todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes.

Rosy, necesita el préstamo para comprar nuevos productos, porque sus clientes están demandando más productos y ella considera que si compra más mercadería e incrementar sus ventas.

Rosy, sueña con comprar una vivienda más grande para vivir con su pequeña hija y también tener un local para instalar su puesto de venta de joyería y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Rosy, 24 years old, is a hard-working young single woman who has one child and lives with her mother. Rosy earns a living selling cosmetics and jewellery and has run this business for a couple of years. It was her mother who taught her this job and now she works in the mornings and evenings daily.

Rosy needs the loan to buy new products because her customers are demanding more products and she believes that if she buys more merchandise she will increase sales. Rosy dreams of buying a bigger home in order to live with her young daughter and she also wants a place to set up her market stall in order to sell jewellery and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy new jewellery and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Norma Estela

texts.es:
Norma, de 25 años de edad, es una joven que está casada, vive con su esposo, su hijo y sus suegros.

Norma, se dedica a la venta de joyería desde hace un año aproximadamente, ella comenzó ese negocio gracias a la motivación de sus amigas; ahora ella sale a vender casa por casa todos los días por las tardes y por las mañanas.

Norma, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para la venta como: pulseras, anillos, aritos y cadenas, porque dispone de poco inventario para vender. 

Norma, sueña con tener su propio bazar y también sueña con tener otro hijo.
texts.en:
Norma is 25 years old. She is young and is married. She lives with her husband, her child and her parents-in-law.

Norma has earned a living selling jewellery for approximately one year. She started this business thanks to the motivation from her friends. Now, she goes out selling door-to-door in the mornings and afternoons.

Norma needs a loan to buy more products to sell such as bracelets, rings, earrings and chains as she does not have many products to sell.

Norma dreams of having her own shop and also of having another child.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as bracelets, rings, earrings and chains as she does not have many products to sell.

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es:
Nohemy, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura.

Nohemy, trabaja vendiendo ropa casa por casa desde hace 4 años, este trabaja lo aprendió gracias a una vecina que también se dedica a la venta de ropa; pero aparte de eso también se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, las ventas las realizas en las comunidades cercanas de donde ella vive. 

Nohemy, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa y nuevos estilos, porque se acerca la época navideña y las ventas incrementan. 

Nohemy, sueña con tener su propio negocio de ropa en el mercado, para tener un lugar más estable donde sus clientes le puedan comprar.
texts.en:
Nohemy is 54 years old. She studied up to 3rd grade. She is in a relationship and has three children. Her partner works in farming.



Nohemy has worked selling clothes door-to-door for 4 years. She learned this work from a neighbour who also earns a living selling clothes. Apart from this she also tends to her home. She sells clothes in the nearby communities around where she lives.



Nohemy needs a loan to buy more clothes and new styles as the Christmas period is coming and sales are increasing.


Nohemy dreams of having her own clothes business at the market so as to have a more fixed place where her customers can buy from her.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and new styles.

loans.name: Ingenzi Group

texts.en:
Berthe, age 61, is a group leader. She is married with four children between the ages of 24 and 32. The group is called Ingenzi, which means “important” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses and make more profits for them to have a better future.

Berthe owns a retail shop in which she sells foodstuffs and has been running this business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, maize flour, and sorghum to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to improve her welfare and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more rice, maize flour, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Haguruka Cb Sub Grp A Group

texts.en: HAGURUKA is a group led by Liberatha who is 42 years old. The group's name means “STAND UP” in English. She has four children between the ages of 7 and 18; they all attend school. She owns a shop, and has been running in this business for past three years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, soap, biscuits, and lotions to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, biscuits, and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Flores De Colquencha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORES DE COLQUENCHA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, venta de verduras, venta de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de queso, venta de leche.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución y las reuniones de pago de su Banca Comunal.

En la foto aparecen nueve integrantes porque la señorita con chompa de color azul pastel es la hija de doña Feliza, quien vino a acompañar a su mamá al desembolso.
texts.en:
The communal bank "FLORES DE COLQUENCHA" will begin it seventh cycle of loans with Pro Mujer at the Senkata regional office. The group has eight members and is managed by a Board of Directors, of which Susana is the President. The communal bank members conduct various businesses, including the sale of potatoes, the sale of vegetables, the sale of blankets, the sale of fruit, the sale of cheese, and the sale of milk.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small micro-enterprises. One of the members is Susana, who says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling potatoes. She says that she learned this business from her sister several years ago.

The loan she is taking out now will increase her capital so that she can buy potatoes at wholesale from the sellers in her community and sell them later in the markets of the city of El Alto. This work allows her to generate income to support her family economically; she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Susana responds that she likes the training that the institution offers and also the repayment meetings of her communal bank.

Nine women appear in the photo because the young lady in the blue jacket is Feliza's daughter, who came to accompany her mother to the meeting.

loans.use: to buy potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Haguruka Cb Sub Grp B Group

texts.en:
Sabina, age 36, is a group leader. She is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 8. They all go to school. The group is called HAGURUKA which means “stand up” in English. They sell different items and they wish to expand their businesses and have more capital in the future.

Sabina sells charcoal and has been doing this business for the past seven years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to renovate her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Marina

texts.es:
María, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y vive con sus dos hijas de 14 y 12 años de edad y su esposo que se dedica a la albañilería.  

María, se dedica al comercio de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños; ella vende desde hace varios años y está a sido su principal fuente de ingresos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.

María, sueña con que sus hijos obtengan una buena educación y se desarrollen académicamente.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old. She studied up to her baccalaureate. She is married and lives with her two children who are 14 and 12 years old. Her husband earns a living bricklaying.



María earns a living selling clothes for women, men and children. She has been doing this for several years and this has been her main source of income.


She needs a loan to buy more clothes for women, men and children.



She dreams of her children having a good education and progressing academically.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 42 years old and married with two children. She has been operating a bar for seven years now. Through that, she is able to pay her children's school fees. She is a hardworking woman. She has a challenge of little capital to purchase enough stock for Christmas. Regina is requesting a loan to buy more sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Saratu Ibrahim

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate needs such as food and clothing. But now thanks to Babban Gona’s support, she can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer from Sarki Kuya village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet his immediate needs such as food and clothing. But now as a Babban Gona member, he can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price, up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nuhu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare, Nuhu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fátima es una madre soltera, quien a sus 23 años emprendió con un negocio en el que se dedica a comercializar ropa usada, su capacidad de negociar y el amor a su trabajo motivada por su hijo dan un gran aporte para la mejora de su economía.
Actualmente tiene 25 años y se siente muy agradecida, ya que a pesar de su joven edad ha logrado invertir en la compra de una paca de ropa usada para niños y una de adultos.
Su negocio está creciendo firmemente y debido a la alta demanda necesita abastecerse, por eso gestionó un préstamo el que piensa invertir en la compra de más ropa de segunda mano para adultos y niños. Fátima sabe que cuenta con una mano amiga para su crecimiento económico en Kiva y Mi crédito.
Sus nuevas metas al finalizar el préstamo son seguir de la mano con Kiva y Mi Crédito para solicitar un tercer préstamo que le permita  comprar estantes de madera en donde pueda exhibir su mercadería.
texts.en:
Fátima is a single mother. When she was 23 she started her business where she sells used clothing. Her ability to negotiate and her love for her work, which is motivated by her son, contribute greatly to improving her economic situation.

She is now 25 and feels very grateful as, despite her young age, she has managed to invest in buying a bundle of used clothes for children and another for adults.

Her business is growing steadily and due to the high demand, she needs to stock up. This is why she needs a loan to buy more second hand clothes for adults and children. She knows that she has a friendly helping hand to grow financially with Kiva and Mi crédito.

Her new aims when she pays off the loan are to continue with the help of kiva and Mi crédito to apply for a third loan which will allow her to buy wooden shelves where she can display her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes for adults and children.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Shehu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shehu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Shehu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Iliya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Iliya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Iliya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Iliya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alh. Sagiru

texts.en:
Alh. Sagiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alh. Sagiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Sagiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Sagiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Sagiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alh. Sagiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, de 31 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta octavo grado, no continuó sus estudios porque sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos, porque decidió trabajar en el campo para ayudar a su familia, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela y su  pareja es ama de casa.

Carlos, se ha dedicado desde la edad de 20 años de edad a la agricultura y la ganadería, su padre fue el ejemplo a seguir, gracias a él aprendió estos trabajos para ganarse el sustento diario y siembra 16 hectáreas de maíz, el cultivo lo tiene a un kilómetro de su hogar, camina a pie todas las mañanas para estar pendiente del cultivo y que sea prospero, también le gusta comercializar ganado de repasto, actualmente tiene una vaca lechera y tres novillos de repasto.

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, para poder sembrar maíz y hortalizas como tomate, chile.

Carlos, sueña con obtener buen cultivo para cancelar a tiempo el préstamo, también seguir luchando para mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Carlos is 31 years old and is a farmer. He studied up to 8th grade. He did not continue his studies because his parents have low financial resources. So he decided to work in farming to help his family. He is in a relationship and has two children who go to school and his partner is a housewife.



Carlos has worked in farming and animal breeding since he was 20 years old. He followed his father's example. Thanks to him he learned these jobs in order to earn enough to sustain himself and to plant 16 hectares of corn. He farms what he has 1 km from his home. He walks there by foot every morning to keep an eye on his crops so that they prosper. He also like to sell cattle livestock. He currently has a dairy cow and three young cows.



Carlos needs a loan to buy farming supplies to be able to plant corn and vegetables like tomatoes and chillies.



Carlos dreams of having good crops in order to pay off his loan on time and he also dreams of continuing to fight to improve his home and fight so that his family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to be able to plant corn and vegetables like tomatoes and chillies.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Saidu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Saidu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Saidu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Saidu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is pursuing a four-year program in public relations at the Ghana Institute of Journalism. He is asking for the loan to help pay his tuition fees. There was a period when he had to stay out of school because his uncle stopped supporting him.

The completion of his studies would afford him the opportunity to earn an income and be less dependent on his family and also increase the literacy rate in the community. He sees himself as an entrepreneur in 5 or 10 years. This education would enable him to acquire more skills in his profession to help him give back to the community. Ace journalist Anas Aremeyaw Anas inspires him toward his goals through the skills with which he exposes outlaws in Ghana and the impact his work has had on the nation.

His education would be adversely affected if he is denied this loan, which would mean dropping out of school. He believes Ghanaians are enthusiastic about education, and funding from investors would help a huge number of youth go back to school and realize their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Alhaji Usaini

texts.en:
Alhaji Usaini is a maize farmer from Danju village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Usaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet his immediate needs such as food and clothing. But as a Babban Gona member, he can store his maize and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price, up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Usaini no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare, he hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy a motorbike and to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is 45 years old and married with children. She has been selling fresh foods in a local market for five years now. She is a very hardworking woman who manages to cater for her family's needs. Justine faces the challenge of competition, but tries to manage it by selling fresh and quality foods. She is requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
La señora Ana es una agricultora muy habilidosa con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un cultivo de café que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente vive con su esposo y su hijo por el cual ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlo adelante.

Ella desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como pesticidas, abonos y semillas de café, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarle a su hijo un buen futuro!
texts.en:
Ana is a very skilled farmer with experience in several fields of agriculture. She has an inherent talent to work as part of a team and an enterprising mind.

She has coffee crops that she tends to every day since very early in the morning.

She currently lives with her husband and her son. She always works hard to help her son get ahead in life.

She wants to boost her crops and generate better income, that is why she is asking for financial aid to invest in farming supplies such as pesticide, fertilizer and coffee beans. With this loan she will be able to improve the quality of her product.

Her biggest dream is to own a house and to provide her son with a good future.

loans.use: invest in farming supplies such as pesticide, fertilizer and coffee beans.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, de 28 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta sexto grado, debido a la pobreza de sus padres no continuó estudiando, está casado, aún no tiene hijos, su  esposa es ama de casa y es ella quien le apoya con el cultivo agrícola.

José, se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura y la ganadería, estos trabajos se los enseñaron sus padres para que tuviera ingresos; actualmente siembra maíz a una distancia de medio kilómetro de su hogar, su esposa le apoya en el cultivo y ambos se levantan muy temprano para ir al campo a trabajar en la agricultura y regresan a casa a las 3 de la tarde aproximadamente.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y pesticidas para la plaga.

José, sueña con comprar un terreno para construir una casa y poder darles un mejor bienestar a su esposa y a los hijos que vendrán.
texts.en:
Jose is a 28 years old farmer. He went to school up to sixth grade and was not able to continue studying due to his parents' financial situation. He is married without children. His wife is a home maker and also helps him with his crops.

Since very early in life, Jose has been a farmer and a stockbreeder, jobs he learned from his parents to generate income. He currently grows corn in a field located half a kilometer from his home. His wife helps him with the farming and they both get up early in the morning to work in the field and return home at about 3 in the afternoon.

Jose needs the loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide for plagues.

Jose dreams of buying some land to build a house to give more comfort to his wife and his future children.

loans.use: buy farming supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide for plagues.

loans.name: Rosas De Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE NUEVA ESPERANZA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eugenia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, entre ellos existen: venta de manta, venta de flores, venta de fundas para sillones, venta de edredones, venta de detergentes, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando  por la invitación de una vecina que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando como vendedora y decide implementar su propio negocio hace tres años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.
