Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Rosas De Nueva Esperanza will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center. This group is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors where Eugenia is the secretary. The members are involved in various businesses, including the sale of blankets, flowers, armchair covers, quilts, detergents and clothing.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small owners of microenterprises, such as Eugenia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a neighbor who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling blankets. She learned this business working as a saleswoman, and decided to start her own business three years ago.

The loan she is taking out now will increase her capital through the wholesale purchase of blankets that she will get from the sellers in the city of El Alto. She will then sell them from her sales location. This work allows her to generate income to support her family financially. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Eugenia answers that she likes the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy blankets at wholesale.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer from Bakin Kasuwa village. As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Nuhu can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nuhu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Nuhu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Musa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Musa can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Musa has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Musa is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to provide healthcare for his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: God First Group

texts.en:
Comfort, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children; who are in school. She has been running a business of fish selling for 12 years now. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 6:45 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Comfort's 3rd loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loans to increase her business stock of smoked fish and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She is doing great with her loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is also doing great with their loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, bought a plot of land, reinvested in her business, bought a TV set and a radio and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase her stocks by buying more fish for sell. She dreams of owning another shop for the same business.

Comfort will share this loan with her loan group, 'God First', which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stocks by buying more fish for resale.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alh. Magaji

texts.en:
Alh. Magaji is maize farmer from Chidau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alh. Magaji is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Magaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Magaji can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alh. Magaji is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Matwopig Group

texts.en:
Revocate, whose hand is raised up in a group photograph, is a fifty year old woman with two children living in Masindi-Uganda. She has a retail shop that sells cold drinks, sugar, soap and other shop items. She has been in this business for eight years and has a dream of expanding her business from retail to whole sale business. According to the Hofokam policy group members don't offer security when obtaining a loan but they save and guarantee their fellow members to get a loan.

Revocate under the Matwopig group requests a loan to buy cold drinks, sugar and more shop items for selling.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is an ambitious married woman, aged thirty-seven, living in Fort Portal,Uganda. After realizing that her husband’s meager income could hardly meet her family basic needs, she decided to venture into clothing sales and has been in business for ten years. With the proceeds she has been able to support her husband to build a residential house, pay school fees for her children and support her aging parents. The seasonality nature of the business is her greatest challenge, while her dream is to own at least four boutiques in major towns. Florence is optimistic that she will make enough sales as the Christmas season is fast approaching. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kids' clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer from Tudu village. As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Kabiru can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Kabiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Kabiru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es: Don Héctor hace diez años comenzó a dedicarse a la actividad de ganadería, razón por la cual posee amplia experiencia. Con el propósito de continuar en esta dirección y aprovechar tanto sus recursos como su experiencia, solicita un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (₡ 500 000), para la compra de terneros que le permitan incrementar su producción y los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Héctor began his livestock business ten years ago. Therefore, he has vast experience.

In order to continue in this direction and to take advantage of his resources like his experience, he is requesting a loan for 500,000 colones (₡ 500 000). He will use the loan to buy calves that will allow him to increase his production and the income that comes from this business activity.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Piedad Del Socorro

texts.en:
Piedad is 48 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Berrio. She has 2 children, a girl and a boy, whom she has raised by her own, like a strong and committed woman. Life hasn’t been easy for her, but she has found the way to come through, because she’s a fighter who loves her children. She decided to start her own business, a fruit and vegetables place, where she sells these products with great quality.

She’s aware that starting a new business is a complete challenge, but she’s going to work hard so it can be successful. She hopes the business will have great sales that allow her to provide for her family giving them a good quality of life. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy fruits and vegetables to stock up and a showcase to show all her products.

Piedad lives in a rented house with her children. Her biggest dream is to buy a house where they all can live better and can save money. She also hopes that her business improves and one day she can have her own place for it. She has many dreams that you can help to accomplish with this loan she’s asking for, support her, loan now.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to stock up and a showcase to show all her products

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for nine years. She is known in Pagadian City for her farming business which is financially and technically supported by the cooperateive. She is glad because the coop has been supporting her on whatever financial needs, whether it is for business or for personal use. This time she needs an amount to pay for hospital bills and she asks for a loan from the coop.

loans.use: to pay for hospital bills

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Yulitza Maryori

texts.en:
Maryori is just 18 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Berrio. Since she was a little girl she knew that one she was going to accomplish great things, because she has an entrepreneurial mind and a positive attitude that help her a lot. Her family is going through some economic issues and now is the opportunity of accomplish her dream and help her family. She’s going to start a selling clothes business.

She has big expectations with her business, but the most important thing is that she’s ready to work hard to make it successful and recognized in her location. She hopes she makes a lot of sales that let her have a lot of clients. She’s asking for a loan so she can start her sales business by buying clothes, shoes and beautiful accessories.

Maryori wants to give back to her family the things they have done for her, and she knows that her mother has always dreamed with having a house where they all can live together and have an amazing life. You can be part of this story, help a young woman to make a success of her business and let her accomplish her dreams, loan now.

loans.use: to start her sales business by buying clothes, shoes and beautiful accessories.

loans.name: Andres Abelino

texts.es:
Andrés, de 56 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta primer grado, sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y por esa razón no pudieron mandarlo a estudiar, cuando creció decidió casarse, su esposa es ama de casa y tienen 4 hijos pero son mayores de edad y le ayudan con el trabajo agrícola.

Andrés, se dedica desde la edad de 15 años a la agricultura y la ganadería, sus padres le enseñaron estos trabajos para que tuviera ingresos y pudiera ayudar en las necesidades del hogar, sus cultivos de maíz están un poco cerca de su vivienda.

Andrés, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla para criarla, engordarla y venderla.

El sueño de Andrés, es obtener buenos resultados en su cosecha para cancelar a tiempo el préstamo y de la ganancia obtenida cubrir algunas necesidades básicas en el hogar.
texts.en:
Andrés, age 56, is a farmer. He went to school through the first grade. His parents had scarce financial resources, which is why they were not able to keep him in school. When he grew up he decided to get married. His wife is a housewife, and they have four children. The children are grown, and they help him with the farm work.

Ever since he was 15 years old Andrés has worked in agriculture and with livestock. His father taught him this work so that he would have earnings and so that he would be able to help with the household necessities. His corn crops are a little ways from his house.

Andrés needs the loan to buy a heifer to raise, fatten, and sell.

His dream is to get good results from his harvest in order to repay the loan on time and to cover some of the basic household necessities with the earnings that he gets.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to raise, fatten, and sell.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.en:
Ramon is a happily married man who lives in the municipality of Momil. He’s 40 years old and has 2 beautiful daughters that have made him happy for all his life, and has also motivated him to accomplish great things; one of those is his pig raising business, something he started 15 years ago and has let him provide for his family.

This business was inherited from his family, so he feels a big responsibility to make them proud by working hard in it so it can become successful. The business has been working for many years, and he expects that it will last many more. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy more pigs and food and vitamins for them, taking advantage of this Christmas season.

Ramon feels very proud of everything he has accomplished in his life, but his family is what makes him feel more proud than anything. That why he wants to improve his house in order to give them what they deserve, a place where they can live safe and comfortable. Help Ramon to keep doing great things for his business and, specially, for his family; loan now.

loans.use: buy more pigs and food and vitamins for them.

loans.name: Astrid Yohana

texts.en:
Astrid is 30 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. She is an entrepreneur who has an amazing talent in the kitchen, she’s a great cook who to professionalize her knowledge took some classes so she could start her own business. Now, she’s been managing a restaurant since 2006, something that makes her feel happy and proud.

She’s always thinking in ways to improve her business, to offer a better service and to be recognized for the business quality. She expects that she can improve the sales by increasing the clients, and in that order, the profits too. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some cookware to improve her kitchen and can prepare more food.

Astrid has held two dreams since she was a little girl: one of them was be the owner of her own restaurant, something she’s accomplished, the other one is buy a house where she and her family can have a great life. Help Astrid to accomplish all her dreams, loan now.

loans.use: to buy some cookware to improve her kitchen and prepare more food.

loans.name: Sarawi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARAWI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jacinta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de papa frita, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jacinta es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez  que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace más de diez años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la atención en salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “SARAWI” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Santiago II focal center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, of which Jacinta is the president. The business the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are: selling clothes, selling potato chips, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Jacinta. She indicates that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, and she joined at the invitation of a promotion that was being don e in her area. Now she has a business selling clothes. She says that she learned about this business from her sister and she decided to start her own business more than ten years ago.

The loan they will take out now will be to increase capital by buying clothes wholesale. She will acquire it from seller in the city of La Paz and later sell it from her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married and has nine children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings and the health care that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Cesareo

texts.es:
Cesareo, de 46 años de edad, debido a los escasos recursos económicos, unicamente estudiar hasta tercer grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también se dedica a la venta de productos helados como minutas (hielo con sabores).

Cesareo, actualmente se dedica a la pesca desde hace mucho tiempo y lo hace para generar ingresos y poder abastecer las necesidades de su familia, este oficio lo tiene a una distancia de 6 kilómetro de su casa.

Cesareo, necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para la pesca y también para los gastos agrícolas.

Cesareo, sueña con comercializar en grande su negocio de venta de helados (minutas) y así mismo poder fortalecer la venta del pescado.
texts.en:
Cesareo, age 46, only went to school through the third grade due to scarce financial resources. His is married. His wife devotes herself to the household chores and to selling ice cream like 'minutas' (flavored ice). Cesareo has now been fishing for a long time. He does it to generate income and to be able to provide the necessities for his family. His work is six kilometers from his house.

Cesareo needs the loan to buy tools for fishing and to pay the agricultural expenses.

Cesareo dreams of expanding his business of selling ice cream (minutas) and being able to strengthen his fish sales.

loans.use: to buy tools for fishing and to also pay for agricultural expenses.

loans.name: No Jesus No Life Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 34 years old and married with two children. He lives in Agege district, an urban town in Chorkor province. His family is a low-income household in the town, moreover the market need is low in this region.

Emmanuel has been in the welding business for 15 years. The main hardship that he faces is lack of capital. He is requesting a loan to purchase a cylinder and gas to perform welding services for his customers. He joined ID-Ghana Institution in 2014 to improve his business and has successfully repaid three loans.

Emmanuel is the group leader of the No Jesus No Life Group, which consists of two members. With his business profit, he hopes to build a new house, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a cylinder and gas to perform welding services for his customers.

loans.name: Kory Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY INTI” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Deysi es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapa, venta de colchas, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de chamarras, venta de celulares, venta de papel higiénico, venta de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Deysi es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura y venta de prendas de vestir; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace diez años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “KORY INTI” communal bank will begin its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center. It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors. Deysi is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and include selling 'salchipapas' [hot dogs with french fries], selling quilts, making clothes, selling jackets, selling cell phones, and selling toilet paper.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Deysi is a member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years. She joined by invitation from an adviser with the institution. She currently has a business making and selling clothes. She says that she learned this business from her parents ten years ago.

The loan that she will now take out will be to increase capital (to buy fabric wholesale). She will get the fabric from the vendors in the city of La Paz. After making the clothes, she will sell them at her sales stand. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially because she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that the like the health services and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: May Lani

texts.en:
May Lani is 32 years old and married with two school-aged children. She operates an internet café and pushes her abilities by venturing into business to gain sufficient income for her family. May Lani never gets tired of attending her business and responding to her duties as parent and wife. Her hard work has paid off for she has successfully gained income from her business and has been able to open another internet café in a nearby area with the assistance of Paglaum MPC.

May Lani is requesting a loan through Paglaum MPC to buy an additional computer for her internet café. She wishes to be more successful so that she can provide jobs for her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her internet cafe

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Yunila

texts.en:
Yunila is 32 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are now of school age. Yunila earns a living from the sales in her little general (sari-sari) store. She's been in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month. Yunila has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years.

Yunila is requesting a loan to purchase four sacks of feed and additional groceries to sell.  In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari business.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of feed and groceries

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo es un señor que posee su propia tienda en la cual vende a los clientes diversidad de artículos, entre estos, artículos de limpieza y comestibles. Solicita un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (₡ 500 000),  para la compra de artículos que le permitirán incrementar su nivel de inventario y generar mayores ingresos provenientes de esta actividad familiar.
texts.en: Hugo is a man who has his own store where he sells to the customers a variety of articles, among these, cleaning articles and edibles. He is applying for a loan for five hundred thousand colones (₡ 500,000) for the purchase of articles that will permit him to increase is inventory level and generate better income coming from this family activity.

loans.use: to buy cleaning and edible products to sell.

loans.name: Shidaa Aha Yehowa Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two successful women.

It is coordinated by Lydia, 23, who is married and has two children. She works as a tailor and sells new clothing such as material, blouses and jeans. She started this business thanks to the support of her husband. She needs this loan to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, blouses, material, etc.

The other member is Jemimah, 28, who works selling provisions, shoes, and sewing services in order to make an honest living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, blouses, material, etc.

loans.name: Senkata 5 Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SENKATA 5 ESTRELLAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isabel es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de hierbas medicinales, venta de comida, venta de jugo de frutas, venta de productos de limpieza, venta de comida, venta de papa.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isabel es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y  posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association “SENKATA 5 ESTRELLAS” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal Villa Exaltación. There are eight members in the group, and it is managed by a Board of Officers in which Señora Isabel is the Secretary. The members of the community association work in a variety of businesses such as a neighborhood store, herbal medicine sales, food sales, fruit juice sales, cleaning products sales, and potato sales.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs including Señora Isabel. She says she joined Pro Mujer one year ago by way of an invitation from a promoter of the institute. Currently, she has a business selling food, and she says that she learned how to run this business through her own initiative several years ago.

The credit she is requesting now will be used to increase her capital (to buy groceries at wholesale). She will buy from the wholesale salespeople in the city of El Alto, and after production, she will sell her products at her business. This work enables her to earn income to financially support her family. She is married with eight children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies by saying she likes the health care that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Unión Rivero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN RIVERO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celestina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de ropa, venta de helados, tienda de barrio, venta de lana de vicuña, venta de comida, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celestina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
A.C. “UNIÓN RIVERO” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal Villa Exaltación. It comprises eight members and is managed by a board of directors where Ms. Celestina is the President. The businesses that the members of the association carry out are varied. Among them are: meat sales, clothing sales, ice cream sales, a neighborhood store, sales of vicuña wool, food sales, and blanket sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises where Ms. Celestina is a member. She said that it is the first time she joined Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a promoter who is part of the institution. Today she has a business selling blankets; she wants it to be known that she learned this business of her own initiative over the course of many years.

The loan that she will now take out will be used to augment the capital (the purchase of blankets in bulk) that she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and she will later commercialize at fairs in the city of El Alto. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single and has seven children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and health options offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase blankets wholesale

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 39 years old. She is known in the Pagadian City area for her farming business. Richel is actively participating in the various programs and services that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) offers. 

Richel is requesting a loan to purchase rice seeds to have a good harvest with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters to Richel that she has priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what Richel is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to have healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, aged 39, is married to a farmer and they're blessed with five children. She has been selling vegetables in their village for almost one year and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her net income was usually spent on the school allowances of their children.

Due to inadequate capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase string beans, eggplants, petchay, squash and bitter gourd to sell.

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase string beans, eggplants, petchay, squash and bitter gourd to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is managing her eatery business in Pagadian City. She has mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accepts catering for added income.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be very happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marissa works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Marissa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store, farms sugarcane and has other businesses in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Delia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora works hard to support herself. She is single and has a home product retail business in the Philippines.

Aurora requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more home products to offer for sale.

She has been in this business for eleven years.

In the future, Aurora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more home products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Nicalosa

texts.en:
Nicalosa is 63 years old; she is married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Nicalosa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 33 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nicalosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy an additional stock of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evangeline dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elbia

texts.es:
Elbia, de 57 años de edad, no logro ir a la escuela, está soltera, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales solo 5 se encuentran en la casa.

Elbia, se ha sacrificado en los trabajos de la agricultura y la crianza de especies menores, es decir gallinas y cerdos, todo para solventar muchos gastos de su hogar.

Elbia, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos y poder darles el cuidado necesario, para poder venderlos y así mismo obtener ganancia.

Su principal sueño, es poder tener su negocio más fortalecido con más cerdos y más gallinas.
texts.en:
Elbia, 57 years old, did not manage to go to school, is single, and has seven children, of whom only five are found at home.

Elbia has sacrificed herself in her work in agriculture and raising small animals, namely chickens and pigs, to resolve the many costs of her home. 

Elbia needs the loan to buy pigs and be able to give them the care that is necessary, to be able to sell them and in this way obtain gains in her income. 

Her main dream is to be able to have her business strengthened through more pigs and more chickens.

loans.use: to buy pigs and be able to give them the care that is necessary, to be able to sell them and in this way obtain gains in income

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
Juan, estudio hasta noveno grado de educación básica esta casado, su pareja trabaja oficios domesticos. Tiene dos hijos que viven en casa con ella y que uno estudia y el otro aun no nadie mas vive con el solamente tres personas dependen de el.

Juna, tiene un negocio de carpinteria lo a hecho por mas de seis años y lo aprendio de sus primos y decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso que le permita sostener a su familia tambien tiene una pequeña tienda antes solo era empleado en una carpinteria la distancia esta como a 1 km.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprara materia prima para la carpinteria la mejorara mucho porque le permitira obetener mayores ganancias y asi le podra ofrecer mejor calidad de vida  asu familia se siente satisfecho porque con el prestamo puede comprarlo necesario para seguir luchando en la vida.

Juan, sueña son seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda y desea tener una carpinteria bien equipada el prestamo le ayudara a lograr sus sueños y con las ganancias ira comprando material sosteniendo  asu familia y pagando el prestamo porque desea responder muy bien que la sigan prestando par alograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Juan went to school up to the ninth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. He has two children who lives with them, one in school and one who isn't old enough yet. Nobody else lives with him, just these three people who depend on him.

Juan has a carpentry business. He has done this for more than six years and he learned it from his cousins and decided to do it to seek income that would allow him to support his family. He also has a small store. Previously he was only an employee at a carpentry shop about a kilometer away.

Juan needs the loan to buy raw materials for the carpentry business. It will improve it a lot because it will allow him to obtain more income and he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life. He is satisfied because with the loan he can buy what he needs to keep fighting in life.

Juan's dream is to continue working as best he can and to have a well equipped carpentry. The loan will help him to achieve his dreams and with the earnings he will buy materials to support his family and pay off the loan. He wants to pay it off on time so that they will continue lending to him so that he can achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Piquiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PIQUIÑANI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elvira es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ganado, venta de mantas, venta de  queso, venta de alimento balanceado, venta de comida, venta de frutas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elvira es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su mamá que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de alimento balanceado para animales; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al apoyar a su hermana en su negocio, posteriormente decide implementar el mismo de forma independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de alimento balanceado para animales por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en la localidad de Patacamaya. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el micro seguro  que ofrece la institución.

En la foto aparecen diez integrantes ya que el señor de chamarra deportiva de color plomo oscuro es el papá de la señora Elisa y la señora de sombrero rosado es la mamá de la señora Fabiana, ambas personas vinieron a acompañar a sus hijas al desembolso.
texts.en:
The “PIQUIÑANI” communal bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Senkata Focal Center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, of which Elvira is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied, among them are selling livestock, selling blankets, selling cheese, selling balanced feed. selling food and selling fruit.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business woman, including Elvira, She indicates that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of her mother, who is a client of the institution. She has a business selling balanced feed for animals. She reports that she started this business several years ago to help her sister in her business. Later she decided to go off on her own.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital buy buying balanced feed for animals wholesale. She will acquire it from sellers in her community and later she will sell it in Patacamaya. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she in single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the micro-insurance the institution offers.

In the photo there are ten members because the man in the dark gray athletic jacket is the father of Elisa, and the woman wit the pink hat is Fabiana's mother. Both people came to accompany their daughters at the disbursement.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed in bulk.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita operates and manages a convenience store in Pagadian City. She is always enthusiastic about retail and her work yields good earnings. 

Rosita is requesting a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and consumables. Her loan will ensure that she has enough goods available to sell. Rosita knows that she has to get things right improve her income.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and consumable items

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 66 years old and married. She is a microfinance member of PMPC and runs a snack vending business in Pagadian City. This is how Genoveva supports her family and she earns a meager income of 5,000 PHP each month. 

Genoveva is requesting a loan to purchase wood, nails, galvanized iron sheets, cement, sand, and gravel to renovate her house. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, iron sheets, cement, sand, and gravel

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Claud Berenice

texts.en:
Claudia is 28 years old, single, and has two children, ages 10 and 6 years old. She lives with her children in a place they rent. Claudia is very proud of herself for providing for both of her children despite being a single mother. She provides for her home and helps her mother whenever she is able.

To make a living, Claudia has been preparing and selling food for the last five years. Two years ago she began managing a local high school cafeteria. Although it is not a big cafeteria and there is no real possibility of making it bigger, she is very happy with it because it allows her to support her family.

Claudia wants to offer a vast variety of products to sell after Christmas vacation. To accomplish this challenge she is requesting a 10,000 MXN loan, which would allow her to buy food periodically and try preparing new items to offer.

loans.use: to restock her cafeteria.

loans.name: Maria Mirian

texts.es: María, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en el Municipio de San Francisco, Ocotepeque cerca a Lempira. Hace 5 años que doña María decidió poner su propio negocio para obtener ingresos y darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Ofrece productos como mangos verdes con salsa y especies, chicharros, popcorn ciruelas y tamales, los cuales vende de forma ambulante en puntos estratégicos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para poder comprar y surtir su negocio con más productos como frutas, maíz de popcorn y tamales para revender y así tendrá mayor venta y ganancia. Su plan es trabajar para crecer como microempresaria y darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 49 years of age, is a single mother, and has three children with whom she lives in the Municipality of San Francisco, Ocotepeque, close to Lempira. 

It has been five years since Ms. María decided to start her own business to obtain an income and give the necessities to her children. She offers products such as green mangoes with salsa and spices, peas, popcorn, plums, and tamales, which she sells on rounds at strategic points. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 lempiras to be able to buy and stock her business with more products such as fruit, popcorn maize, and tamales to re-sell and have greater sales and earnings. Her plan is to work to grow as a micro-enterprise and give a quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit, popcorn maize, and tamales to re-sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 51 years old, married with seven children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Diana requested a 19,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger vehicle.

Diana has been in this business for ten years. In the future, She would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger vehicle.

loans.name: Segundo Guiner

texts.en:
Segundo is 37 years old and Afro-Ecuadorian. He’s married and has three sons. He lives in a rural town called Lita, located in northern Ecuador. He works selling “cocadas”, a regional candy made of coconut.

This activity is the only income for all of the family. His wife and his children work in the evenings making the candies. His wife works selling cocadas too, but she works in buses. His oldest son is 18 years old and works every day with his father. The other kids are 8 and 12 respectively; both of them go to school.

Segundo needs this loan to buy supplies for his product and increase his stock. He knows that the loan is necessary to support all his family and appreciates your help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his product and increase his stock.

loans.name: Sameth Group

texts.en:
Sameth is a 43-year-old married rice farmer with two children in her care who lives in a Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has been a rice farmer since 1990, and her 44-year-old husband is a rice farmer as well. Together, they can make approximately 6.5 USD. Sameth is pictured first from the right in this photo.

Sameth is the leader of a four-member loan group. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Sameth will use her loan to gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving her family’s finances. In the future, she plans to save money to buy more farmland and build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Florecitas De G.b. Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORECITAS DE G.B.” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Erminia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de frutas, venta de muebles, venta de chompas, venta de calzas, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Erminia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años ya que vio que en la zona donde vive no había ninguna tienda; en la actualidad quienes  le ayudan en la atención de la tienda son sus hijas. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de leche, sardina, y refrescos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En la foto también aparece la asesora de Banca Comunal que es la señora con chaleco de color verde.
texts.en:
The "Florecitas de GB" community association started its first cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the German Busch regional hub, it is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors where Erminia is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association carry forth are varied, among them are: neighborhood store, sale of fruit, sale of furniture, sale of sweaters, sale of shoes, sale of food. The loan that they will take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Erminia is a member. She indicates that this is the first time that she integrates with Pro Mujer, entering by the invitation of an assessor who is part of the institution.

Currently she has a neighborhood store, it's worth knowing that she opened this business by her own initiative several years ago since she saw that in the zone where she lives there wasn't a store. Currently, her daughters are the ones who help her tend to the store. The loan she will take out now will be to increase capital (to buy milk, sardines, and sodas in bulk) that she will acquire from the bulk sellers in the city of El Alto and later she will sell them in her sales stall. This form of work permits her to generate resources in order to support her family economically, since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers. In the photo also appears the community association assessor, who is the woman with a green colored vest.

loans.use: to buy milk, sardines and soda in bulk.

loans.name: Bessy Celina

texts.es:
Bessy, estudio hasta noveno grado de eduacación basica, es madre soltera tiene una hija que vive con ella y que aun no estudia convive con sus padres solamente una niña depende de ella,

Bessy, trabaja con ganado de repasto lo a hecho por un año motivada por sus padres y lo ha hecho por buscar un ingreso economico que le permita criar a su hija tambien trabja haciendo golosinas para vender antes eran empleada domestica la distancia esta como a un km de su casa.

Bessy, comprara ganado de repasto le mejorara mucho ya que  tendra ganado y le permitira obtener ganancia y lo que busca es poder dasle mayor calidad de vida a su hija y se siente satisfecha porque con este prestamo puede comprar lo que necesita para seguir trabajando.

Bessy, sueña con poder tener una sostenibilidad economica que le permita darle un mejor futuro a su hija y con calidad el prestamo le ayudara a lograr sus sueños y con las ganancias va ir comprando mas y pagando el prestamo porque tambien es muy responsable y quiere responderle muy bien a la finaciera que a confiado en ella en darle prestamo.
texts.en:
Bessy has a grade 9 education. She is a single mother of a daughter who lives with her. She doesn't go to school yet. Bessy lives with her parents, and her daughter is her only dependent.

Bessy earns her living raising cattle, a job she's been doing for a year with the encouragement of her parents. The job allows her to look after her daughter at the same time. She also makes candy to sell. Before that she was a maid at a house about a kilometre from her home.

She plans to buy cattle with her loan. The purchase will help her a great deal, and she will be able to earn money and provide her daughter with a better standard of living. She is happy with this plan as the loan will allow her to buy what she needs to carry on with her job.

Bessy's dream is to have a stable financial situation so that she can provide her daughter with a better future. The loan will help her fulfil her dreams. With the money she earns she will buy more cattle as well as pay off the loan as she is a very responsible person. She wishes to repay the trust that the lenders have in her.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 56 years old. She’s married and has seven children. Her oldest son is 36 years old, is married and has a baby. Her last son is 18 years old and is finishing high school.

Recently she has finished building her small house located in Ibarra, capital of the province. She lives there with all her children.

Manuela is a street vendor of products like toothbrushes, toothpaste, nail clippers, soap, clothing accessories, among others. All of her children work as street vendors too.

Manuela works with her husband. From Monday to Sunday she runs through the city of Ibarra and in the neighboring cities. She never went to school but she is a hard worker, despite difficult weather conditions, days with plenty of sunshine, or rain. She has continued to struggle to raise her family.

This loan will be used to buy clothes and shoes because this month there are demands for these items.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Marie Nadia

texts.fr: Nadia a 39 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite boutique de produits alimentaires située tout près de son domicile. Elle y vend du lait, du sucre, du riz, de la farine, du maïs moulu et d’autres produits. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de farine et des épices.
texts.en: Nadia is 39 years old. She is single and hasn't got any children yet. She owns a little grocery store situated near her home. She sells milk, sugar, rice, flour, cornmeal, and other products. She is asking for this loan to buy some sacks of flour and spices.

loans.use: to buy some sacks of flour and some spices.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines and supplements her income with rice farming.

Diana is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Karla Gissell

texts.es:
El fogón de doña Karla está siempre encendido y su casa inundada de olores característicos de los diferentes platillos que prepara con ayuda de su esposo para los clientes que se alimentan en su negocio.
El negocio de doña Karla tiene dos años de existir y gracias a su buena sazón siempre ha sido prospero, con el sacó adelante a sus tres hijos, a sus 33 años de edad, es una experta en cocina y en atención al cliente.
doña Karla se siente agradecida ya que nada de esto hubiese sido posible sin MiCrédito y Kiva, pues desde que inicio en este negocio, han sido sus aliados, este es su segundo préstamo con kiva, pero a la vez es el número 6 con MiCrédito y estos préstamos la han ayudado a mantener su negocio estable.
Su primer préstamo con Kiva, lo utilizó para mejoras en el área en que atiende a sus clientes, el préstamo actual lo piensa invertir en la compra de otra cocina y utensilios tales como ollas, platos, cucharones, etc.
Doña Karla afirma que kiva cambio su vida porque solo así ha podido tener un menú surtido y eso influye en que venda todo lo que prepara en el día.
Como toda buena comerciante, tiene constantes planes uno de ellos después de pagar el préstamo es  poner unas cacetas y mesas para que sus clientes puedan comer en el local, afirma que a pesar de que es un negocio muy bueno, nunca hay que dejar de invertirle.
texts.en:
The stove of Doña Karla is always on, and her house is filled with the smell of the various dishes that she prepares with the help of her husband for the customers who eat at her business. Doña Karla has had her business for two years, and thanks to the good flavor of her food, it has always been prosperous, and she has been able to support her three children.

At 33 years old, she is an expert in the kitchen and at customer service. Doña Karla is grateful since none of this would have been possible without MiCrédito and Kiva because both have been partners with her since she started this business. This is her second loan with Kiva, but at the same time it's her sixth loan with MiCrédito. These loans have helped her to maintain the stability of her business.

Her first loan with Kiva was used for improvements in the area where she serves her customers. She is thinking of using this loan to buy another kitchen as well as kitchen utensils such as pots, pans, plates, ladles, etc. Doña Karla says that Kiva has changed her life since only with its support has she been able to have an assortment of items on her menu, and that influences whether she sells all that prepares each day.

Like all good merchants, she constantly has plans. After paying off her loan, one plan she has is to put booths and tables in her business so that customers can eat there. She says that despite it being a very good business, one should never stop investing in it.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils such as pots, pans, plates, ladles, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
Sandra, estudio hasta sexto grado de educacion basica esta casada su pareja es pensionado y tiene dos hijos que viven co nella en casa pero uno estudia y el otro trabaja nadie mas vive con ella solamente dos personas dependen de ella.

Sandra, tiene un negocio de tienda lo a hecho por mas dieciocho años lo aprendio por iniciativa de la mama y decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso economico para su familia tambien tiene un molino de nixtamal y tambien recibe remesas de la usa antes solo oficios domesticos los negocios tien en su casa y viaja en carro cuando va a la ciudad a comprar productos para su negocio le apoya su esposo y los hijos su horario es de 6.00 am a 6.30 pm de lunes a domingo.

Sandra, comprara productos para la tenda le mejorara su negocio porque tendra mas productos y diferentes para ofrecerles  a sus clientes y esto le generara mayores ganaderos y es por eso que busca mejor calidad de vida se siente satisfecha porque con el prestamo puede seguir trabajando y aun mas satisfecha porque gracias a un prestamo ella pudo hacerse de su tienda y tambien a comprado ganado bovino esto quiere decir que hoy esta mejor.

Sandra, sueña con seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda para poder tener un mejor futuro y el prestamo le ayudara mucho para lograr sus sueños y con las ganacias va comprando mas producto y va pagando el prestamo porque su objetivo es responder muy bien con la obligacion del prestamo para que le sigan prestando.
texts.en:
Sandra studied through the sixth grade of basic education. She is married, her partner is pensioned and has two children who live with her in her home but one studies and the other works. No one else lives with her, only two people dependent on her.

Sandra has a store. She has worked on it for more than 18 years. She acquired it by her mother's initiative and decided to do it to seek an income for her family. She also has a corn mill and receives remittances for its use. Before, she only did domestic work. She has the business in her house and travels by car when she goes to the city to buy products for her business. Her husband and children help her. Her schedule is 6:00 am to 6:30 pm from Monday to Sunday.

Sandra will buy products for the store. This will improve her business because she will have more and varied products to offer to her clients and this will create more earnings. She does this to seek a better quality of life. She feels satisfied because with the loan she can continue to work and be even more satisfied because thanks to a loan she could make her store and also has purchased cows. This means that today things are better.

Sandra's dream is to keep working the best she can to be able to have a better future and the loan will help her a lot to achieve her dreams. With the earnings she will keep buying more product and keep paying back the loan because her objective is to respond well to the obligation of the loan so that they keep lending to her.

loans.use: to buy products for the store

loans.name: Wislene

texts.fr: Wislene, 38 ans, est mariée. Elle vit avec son mari et leurs quatre enfants. Pour prendre soin de la famille, elle revend des produits alimentaires dans une boutique à domicile. Elle a déjà bénéficié de microcrédits qui lui on permis de développer son activité. Avec les crédits, elle augmente son stock progressivement.
texts.en: Wislene, 38, is married. She lives with her husband and their four children. To be able to take care of her family, Wislene sells foodstuffs in a little shop in her house. She has already taken out small loans that permitted her to develop her business. With the loans, she expands her stock little by little.

loans.use: to buy some gallons of oil.

loans.name: Carlaine Joseph

texts.fr: Carlaine  a 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle tient une petite boutique de produits alimentaires. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle arrive à gagner de quoi pour prendre soin de sa famille. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock de spaghetti.
texts.en: Carlaine  is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. She runs a little grocery store. Thanks to this business she is able to earn income to care for her family. She is asking for a loan to expand her stock of spaghetti.

loans.use: to add to her stock of spaghetti.

loans.name: Sovorn

texts.en:
Sovorn is a 19-year-old single staff person; she is working for a company in the province. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has worked in the company since 2014, making an income of USD 4 per day.

Currently Sovorn is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree majoring in Finance and Banking in her first year at university. She is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for her first year. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and earn a Bachelor’s degree. As for her dreams, Sovorn wants to find a better job with a reasonable salary so she will be able to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for her first year.

loans.name: Kim Group

texts.en:
Kim is a 27-year-old married rice farmer with a dependent child, and she resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Her child is a construction worker. Kim is pictured 1st from the right. She has been cultivating rice since 2000. Her husband is 35 years old, and he is a rice farmer as well. Her family can earn approximately $5 per day.

Kim, a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of a group of four members, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for farming. This loan will help her to increase her income as well as her family's standard of living. In the future, Kim hopes that she can do farming both in the dry and rainy seasons -- more than two times per year -- and save money to build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Generación 2010 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERACIÓN 2010” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ines es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de protector de pantalla para celular,  tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de bolsas nailon, venta de artesanía en miniatura, venta de  ropa para bebé. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ines es integrante, ella indica que un año que integra a Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su mamá que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para bebé; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace diez años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa para bebé por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, el área de salud que ofrece la institución y las reuniones de pago en su Banca Comunal.
texts.en:
The Generación 2010 community association started its tenth cycle in Pro Mujer. As part of the German Busch regional hub, it is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors where Ines is the president. The businesses that the community associations carry forth are varied; among them are: sale of cellphone screen protectors, neighborhood store, sale of food, sale of nylon, sale of miniature handcrafts, sale of clothing for babies.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microentrepreneurs where Ines is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, entering by the invitation of her mother, who is a client of the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling clothing for babies; it's worth knowing that she learned this business by her own initiative ten years ago. The loan that she will take out now will be to increase capital (to buy clothing for babies in bulk) that she will acquire from the bulk sellers in the city of El Alto and later she will sell it in her sales stall. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has seven children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training, the health area that the institution offers and the payment meetings in her village bank.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Las Rosas Y U Clavel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS Y UN CLAVEL” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de helado, venta de ropa, venta de electrodomésticos, venta de muebles, carpintería, tienda de barrio, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su esposo y su hija hace dos años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group Las Rosas y un Clavel will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata community bank. There are eight members in the group led by a board of directors with Sra. Julia as president. The members have a variety of businesses: selling ice cream, clothing, appliances, furniture, as a carpenter, store keeper, and transportation services.

The loan they are seeking will benefit small business owners such as Julia. She joined Pro Mujer six months ago at the invitation of a friend who was already a client. Now she runs a store in the community which she started with help from her husband and daughter two years ago.

The loan that Julia is seeking will be used to buy canned food at wholesale prices from merchants in the town of El Alto. Then she will resell the goods in her store. This will allow her to generate an income to support her family financially. She lives with her husband and they have a daughter. Julia most enjoys the training and health information provided by Pro Mujer.

loans.use: buy canned goods at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sri Mulyani

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sri, who is a 30-year-old married woman. Sri is a housewife and her husband has been an employee for eight years. Sri has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

Sri's family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Sri will be able to repay the loan received. She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
This 26-year-old married woman, Nat, has two dependent children to take care of, one of whom is in school while the other is too young to attend school. She resides in Kampong Cham province where she has been growing cassava and rubber trees for eight years to earn a living. She earns about USD 10 per day.

Nat decided to ask for a loan from VisionFund to purchase organic fertilizer and organic pesticide and to pay labor fees. She hopes to earn more income to expand their farmland and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to increase productivity of her crops.

loans.name: Flores De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORES DE SENKATA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de golosinas, venta de pantalones, venta de comida, servicio de transporte, venta de juguetes, venta de ropa.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer ingresando por la invitación de un promotor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.  

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association “FLORES DE SENKATA” will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal Villa Exaltación. There are eight members in the group, and it's managed by a Board of Officers in which Señora Adela is the President. The members of the association work in various businesses including a transportation service and other businesses selling products such as vegetables, sweets, pants, food, toys, and clothing.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs including Señora Adela. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago by way of an invitation from a promoter of the institute. Currently, she has a business selling vegetables, and she says that she learned how to run this type of business through her own initiative several years ago. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase capital (to buy vegetables at wholesale). She will purchase from salespeople in the city of El Alto, and then later re-sell them at her business. This work has enabled her to earn income to financially support her family. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about the Pro Mujer, she replies by saying that she likes the healthcare that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Oeun Group

texts.en:
Oeun is a 56-year-old married rice farmer with three children. He resides in a village in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Oeun is pictured 1st from the right. He has cultivated rice since 1997. Two of his children are employed, one as a construction worker and another as a factory worker. His wife is a 59 years old and a rice farmer as well. Together, they can make approximately US $11 per day.

Oeun, a group leader, would like to request a loan with his group of four members. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for rice farming. With this loan, Oeun will be able to produce better rice crops to sell, thereby improving the family’s finances. In the future, he is going to save money to buy more farmland to cultivate rice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Herlie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Herlie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Herlie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Herlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 62 years old, married with seven children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Judith has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from cooked food vending.

Judith aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Surmanah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Surmanah, who is a 55-year-old married woman. Surmanah has been selling food and her husband has been employed as a builder for twenty years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a sanitation system at their home to improve access to sanitation and water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and secure water sources, but Surmanah will be able to repay the loan received.

Surmanah and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to sanitation and water for her family.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Roberto, de 33 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta tercer grado, no continuó sus estudios debido a que sus padres eran de bajos recursos económicos, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tiene 2 hijos. 

Roberto, desde la edad de 12 años se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo fue el que le infundieron sus padres, para que fuera hombre de bien y pudiera tener ingresos para ayudar en los gastos del hogar, ahora él agradece ese esfuerzo, porque debido a eso aprendió muy bien el trabajo y puede sembrar maíz; sus cultivos están a una distancia de medio kilómetro de su hogar y se traslada en bicicleta para llegar más rápido y se levanta a las 5 de la mañana y regresa a casa a la 1:00 de la tarde.

Roberto, necesita el préstamo para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas, para preparar la tierra y pagará la mano de obra.

Roberto, sueña con obtener buenos resultados en su cosecha.
texts.en:
33-year old Roberto is a farmer with a grade three education. He couldn't continue at school as his parents were poor. He is married, and his wife looks after the household. They have two children.

Since he was 12 years old, Roberto has worked on the land. His parents inspired him to take on this work so that he would be an upstanding man with an income to pay household expenses. Now he is grateful for this effort as he learned the work very well and knows how to grow maize. His fields are half a kilometre from his home, and he travels there by bicycle in order to arrive more quickly. He gets up at 5am and returns home at 1pm.

Roberto needs a loan to buy maize seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for his land and to hire labourers. His dream is to have a very good harvest.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for his land and to hire labourers

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
