Shahnoza is a married woman. She is very kind and capable woman who works as a dressmaker. She is also the caring mother of two children who are not yet adults.

Shahnoza sews traditional clothes and curtains. Her husband is a master at repairing cars. She wants to buy fabrics for sewing curtains and clothes, and she also wants to sew a new style of clothes and curtains for the next season. Shahnoza is skilled at sewing curtains and clothes, and she dreams of earning a good profit with her handcraft. She has been in business for two years. She is asking for a 3000 Somoni loan to buy fabrics. She awaits your mercy and hopes for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her sewing business.

loans.name: Gladis Maribel

texts.es:
Gladis, de 38 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y procrearon 3 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven en su casa.

Gladis, se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de comida rápida, específicamente a la elaboración de ricas pupusas, este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia y ayudar con los gastos de educación de sus hijos.

Gladis, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para el negocio, como harina, aceite y bebidas y poder generar buenos ingresos para abastecer sus necesidades de su hogar.

Gladis, sueña con comercializar en grande y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gladis is 38 years old, and she didn't go to school. She is in a relationship, and her partner makes a living in agriculture. They have 3 children, only 2 of which live with them.

Gladis makes a living selling food; specifically she makes delicious pupusas. She started this business because she needed to earn income to take care of her family's needs and help pay for the education of her children.

Gladis needs a loan to buy supplies for her business such as flour, oil, and drinks. This will enable her to earn a good income to take care of her family's needs. Gladis dreams of marketing her business on a larger scale and helping her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business such as flour, oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 22 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Vanessa works in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Vanessa has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vanessa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support herself. Nenita is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like sardines, noodles, sugar and other groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from a cafeteria.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like sardines, noodles, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Maghdaleen

texts.en:
Maghdaleen is 43 years old and mother of three. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been running a general store, selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages the household expenses from his store as well, and relatives and neighbors purchase from the store.

He speaks with in a humble manner that is impressive and easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationship with them. His general store is very famous in the town, which is the reason his business is running well.

Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. That is why Maghdaleen requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, chickpeans, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

Maghdaleen hopes that her son will utilize the loan in positive way. This amount will help him to cope with the needs of her family. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her son's general store.

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maribel, de 44 años de edad, no estudio, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos pero solo uno estudia.

Maribel, se dedica a la compra de cerdos para poder comercializar la carne, de esta manera genera ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, en esta actividad le ayuda su madre y su hija.

Maribel, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos para su negocio y de esta manera poder distribuir la carne y sus derivados.

Maribel, sueña con apoyar a sus hijos económicamente y también sueña con tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Maribel is 44 years old, and she didn't go to school. She is a single mother with 2 children, but only one studies in school.

Maribel makes a living buying pigs to sell the meat. This is the way she earns income to support her family. Her mother and her daughter also help her with this work.

Maribel needs a loan to buy pigs for her business, and in doing so, she will be able to sell the meat and other derivatives. Maribel dreams of financially supporting her children and also having a larger business.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business, and in doing so, she will be able to sell the meat and other derivatives.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira, who is 28 years of age and is in the country of Pakistan, lives together with her husband and two children in the district of Multan in the province of Punjab. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband has many good references, both professional and personal, from the inhabitants of the area. The majority of the inhabitants of this locality make a living from agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Her husband makes a living from the sale of fish, with 10 years of experience in this field. Sumaira requests a loan to buy fish for her husband’s shop to be able to offer her husband’s clients a greater variety. In this way, it will enable her husband to keep working and gain his own income.

Sumaira’s husband has credit experience, and Sumaira is an ongoing member of Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Sumaira and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lender and to field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's fish business.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabela is 46 years old, married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Isabela has a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

In the future, Ma. Isabela would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like canned good, sugar, noodles, and personal care products to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Crisanta dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, sugar, noodles, and personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
Julinda is 64 years old, married with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Julinda has been in the food vending business in the Philippines for nine years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients.

In the future, Julinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Amada dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 54 years old, married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Annabelle has a general store in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like shampoo, sugar, school supplies and other groceries to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, sugar, school supplies and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Illeish

texts.en:
Illeish is from Beregovo. Due to the previous Kiva loan, he changed his business. Illeish worked as a handyman installing flooring. Recently he bought a bus. Now Illeish does passenger transportation and rents rooms for tourists. His income has grown.

Illeish is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to install two windows, put in a floor and paint the walls in the house. The loan will help him save energy during the winter heating season, as well as improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to remodel his house and start saving energy

loans.name: Ugulkhon

texts.en:
Ugulkhon is a woman who began her business eight years ago and reached success. Now she has her own business buying and selling clothes, blankets, towels because she needs to earn money.

For eight years she is in the sphere of business. She is widowed. Her young bride helps her in her business. She works well with customers. Using her communication skills, she gains status among women.

She wants to buy new goods for the new season and renew her assortment of goods. She is asking for a loan of 11,000 Somoni with this goal in mind. She hopes that with your help she can grow her business. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing for the new season.

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.en:
Hikoyat is a very kind and responsible woman. She is successfully working in a business sphere. Hikoyat 16 years ago started buying and selling shoes.

Her daughters are married. Her husband is working in the agriculture sphere.

She wants to buy shoes for a new season. She wants to enlarge her business. Periodically, she renews the assortment of her goods. Hikoyat buys shoes in bulk and retails them in a local market where she has a selling place.

She is asking for 7,000 somoni with this aim. She hopes with your help and mercy she will get success.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the new season.

loans.name: Princesita

texts.en:
For the last five years, Princesita has earned a living by the raising and selling of hogs. She is married and has five children, of whom one is still attending school. Her husband has an income that could help support the needs of her family.

She works hard to support the needs of her children. Aside from hog raising, she caters food to the locals in her place. She cooks dishes like sauteed vegetables, fish soup and fried chicken.

She has requested a loan to buy piglets and feed, and have additional capital for food vending. It could boost her income and enable her to settle her obligation, and thus, support her family and provide better living conditions.

Princesita is hoping that someday, she will be productive in her chosen field.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed, and have additional capital for food vending.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for the children.

For five years now, she has operated a lessos (African cloth) selling business, selling from home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more stock of lessos for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of lessos (African cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 57-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home.

Her husband provides services as a shuttering carpenter and helps during building construction. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering services. That way, he can generate more income and financially support his family. Shehnaz is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to the Kiva team and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's shuttering business.

loans.name: Hojita De Coca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HOJITA DE COCA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal  German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betty es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, venta de golosinas, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de sombrero, servicio de internet, venta de tostados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betty es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de coca por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio  de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Hojita de Coca" is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  They meet in the German Busch central office.  The group has 9 members and is led by a board of directors of which Betty is the President.  The members of this group are developing a variety businesses, including: fruit sales, snack sales, food sales, cosmetics sales, hat sales, internet services, and tostada sales.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesswomen in this group.  Betty states that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined the group at the invitation of one of the loan officers from the institution who works in her area.  Betty now has a business selling coca leaves.  She got to know this business because she learned it from her mother a number of years ago.

This loan will help Betty to increase her capital (to buy coca leaves at wholesale).  She will purchase this inventory from the wholesale suppliers in the city of La Paz, and she will later sell this product from her sales stall.  By working in this way, Betty can generate resources to support her family financially, as she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Betty responded that she likes the training and health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy coca leaves in bulk

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María, estudio hasta sexto grado de esducacion basica esta acompañada su pareja trabaja la agricultura y con ganado tiene dos hijos que viven en casa con ella pero que solo uno depende de ella y la otra esta acompañada tambien trabaja asi mismo viven dos nietos con ella pero no depende de ella solamente dos dependen de ella.

María, trabaja vendiendo ropa por catalogo y cosmiticos lo a hecho por mas de tres años lo aprendio de una hermana y decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso economico que le permitiera aydar  asu hijos tambien reciben remesas de usa y el apoyo economico de ser compañero de vida ademas tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa; antes tambien hacia pupusas para vender la distancia no se puede medir porque se desplaya a diferentes lugares y lo hace en autobus o en carro particular le apoya su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos sus horario tampoco se puede medir porque aveces los clientes le hablan por telefono para que les lleve productos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar cosmeticos y ropa para la venta le mejorara muchos su negocios ya que podra ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes asi mismo padra comprar por mayores y es asi como le dejara mayoes ganacias y pdra tener mayor calidad de vida y se siente satisfecho porque con el prestamo podra comprar lo que los clientes le piden a la vez se siente satisfecha con los paistamos anteriores porque le han aydado a mejorar su negocios ya que con el prestamo tiene producto en su casa para cumplimiento al cliente en el momento que lo necesita.

María, sueña con seguir cumpliendo en negocio y poder darles trabajo a personas que deseen hacerlo en cuanto a sus hijos desea que se propongan metas y las puedan complir y ella les ayudara para que puedan aspirar a un mejor futuro en lo personal el prestamo le ayudara a lograr sus sueños ya que con las ganancias va comprando mas productos sus gastos personales y va pagando el prestamo porque es prioridad responder muy bien con el prestamo.
texts.en:
Maria, who studied up to the seventh grade in basic education, is married. Her life's partner works in agriculture and cares for cattle. She has two children living with her but just one is still dependent, while the other is married and also works. Two grandchildren also live with Maria but are not dependent upon her. So, just her two children depend on her.

Maria works selling clothing by catalog and cosmetics. She has done this for over three years. Maria learned from a sister and decided to do this to seek an income that would permit her to help her children. Also, she receives remittances from the USA and her companion also helps her. She has a small store in her house. Maria used to make "pupusas" (popular snacks) to sell in the streets. It's difficult to say how far she traveled doing this in different places because she did so by bus or traveled in a car belonging to a friend when customers called in their orders for products to be delivered.

Maria needs the loan to purchase cosmetics and clothing to improve her sales greatly. She will offer a variety of products to her customers. Also, she wishes to buy at wholesale and improve her earnings, leading to a better quality of life. Maria feels satisfaction because with the loan, she will be able to purchase what her customers are requesting. At the same time, she has felt satisfaction with her previous loans, which have helped improve business. With this new loan, she will have the products in her home to satisfy her customers at the time they need them.

Maria dreams of continuing to advance in business while being able to offer work to people who desire it. Concerning her children, she wants them to propose goals and achieve them. She will help them so that they can aspire to a better personal future. The loan will help Maria and her family achieve their dreams, since the earnings will allow her to buy more products and cover her personal expenses.

Maria will pay off the loan because it is a priority of hers to respond very well to her loans.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 47 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Denia works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

Denia has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She does business selling peanuts in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more peanuts to resell.

Rea has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts to resell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 37-year-old married woman with five children, all five of whom are enrolled in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

Mary Joy has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Erma is borrowing through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito runs a carenderia, or eatery. She sells native dishes like stewed vegetables, fish soup, fried chicken and pork stew to the locals and nearby residents in her locality. She lives in the town of Barili together with her three young dependents and her partner in life.

Running an eatery is a very lucrative business in her place. She needs enough funds to cater to its demands in order to improve her daily earnings.

Charito would like to invest in meat, vegetables, seasonings and food for the family. With the availability of the resources, she will have to prepare a variety of dishes and be able to cope with demand. Slowly, she would be able to provide her family with good food and better shelter to live in.

With the additional capital, Charito would be grateful to handle her business properly to be able to support the needs of her growing children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to invest in meat, vegetables, seasonings and food for the family

loans.name: Judema

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Judema works hard to support her family.

Judema has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 43-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and three children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap recycling shop and deals with the recycling of scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling the goods to the recycling factories.

Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have an amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money. Therefore, Salma requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents of the family.

She is very impressed with the Kiva support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's recycling business.

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her early 70's, is married with three grown children. She has been running a food vending business famously known as "mamalishe" for thirty years. She works from 7 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the food stock for her business. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is doing great.

She used the profit to take care of her family, to repay the loan, reinvest in the business and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restore the out of stock items in her mamalishe store. She dreams of expanding her business into a restaurant.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group Ununio, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restore the out of stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a woman who known and famous as the best seller at the market. She is widowed. For 15 years, she has been working in the business sphere. She is a very kind and responsible woman as well as a successful woman in the business sphere.

Mahbuba buys women's clothes in bulk and retails them in a local market. She renews the assortment of her goods periodically. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 Somoni (TJS) with this aim and will spend the loan to buy new goods for the new season.

She awaits your mercy and help.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is aged 30, single and she has one child. She sells personal purchases such as deodorants, talc powder, body spray, perfumes, lotions, and shampoo. She also sells used clothes in their village for additional income. In these two businesses she earns a net income of PHP 4,000 every month.

Her net income on her business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. Due to lack of capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase personal use products and used clothing to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
Meralyn is 47 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Meralyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meralyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Songa Mbele Ukonga Group

texts.en:
Yoramu, who is in his early 40s, is single with one child in school. He has been running a butcher shop for 10 years. He works from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.

He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items at his butcher shop. He dreams of expanding his business to cover a wider range of customers.

Yoramu will share this loan with the other member of his loan group, Songa Mbele Ukonga Group. The two members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Ibodatkhon

texts.en:
Ibodatkhon is a capable woman. Ibodatkhon 12 years ago began her business with buying and selling shoes. She has a lot of customers. Her shop is situated at the local market.

She always tries for the well-being of her children. She has two children. One of them is married, and the second is studying at the school.

Ibodatkhon buys shoes in bulk and retails them in a local market. She finds a status among the businesswomen with her communication. She is a responsible woman.

She always renews the assortments of her goods. She wants to buy a new fashion of shoes for a new season. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni with this aim. She hopes for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the new season.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Estrella dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Larni

texts.en:
Larni is 47 years old and married with six children.

Larni works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like canned good, soft drinks and other groceries.

Larni has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Larni aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned good, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Angel Joy is 17 years old and is the younger of two children in the family. Her mother, Nelly, supports the family through her bakery business in the Philippines.

Angel Joy is studying for a bachelor of science in hospitality management and is currently in the first of this four-year course.

Nelly is borrowing PHP 22,500 to pay for tuition fees for her daughter for the second semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Angel Joy plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda is 62 years old with four children all grown up.

Before Rolanda operated her sari-sari store (small general store) while working as a laundress to be able to support her children and her family expenses.

Now that her children are all grown up and have their own families, Rolanda still lives with her husband with their sari-sari store (small general store) selling snack foods, soft drinks, candies, sugar, soap and other items and it is still their source of income. Though their children offer support, they wanted to depend on themselves to provide for their needs.

Rolanda is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to buy one box of canned goods, five boxes of biscuits, five boxes of noodles, 12 dozen shampoo and other additional items to sell in her store.

In the future, Rolanda wants to save enough money to be able to sustain their needs, for their old age and for unplanned events.

loans.use: to buy one box of canned goods, five boxes of biscuits, five boxes of noodles, 12 dozen shampoo and other additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Germains

texts.fr: Germains est propriétaire d’une petite boutique de produits alimentaires. Divorcée, elle élevé seule ses trois enfants. La petite boutique lui permet de gagner des revenus pour payer la scolarisation des enfants et donner à manger à la maison. Elle cherche un prêt pour acheter des boites de beurre et des caisses d’huile.
texts.en: Germains owns a small shop from which she sells food products. Divorced, she alone is responsible for her three children. Her small shop allows her to raise money to pay for her children's education and to feed the family. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy butter and oil.

loans.use: to buy butter and oil

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is aged 36 and married to a farmer/government employee. They're blessed with two children.

She has been managing a hog-raising business in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of 2,500 Philippines Pesos (PHP) per hog.

Due to inadequate capital, Marites would like to avail a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase a supply of hog feed. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow profitably.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of hog feed.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 46 years old. She is a widow with three children and two of them are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lorena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorena has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Nani, who is a 56-year-old married woman with one son. Nani sells fruits and vegetables and her husband has been a farmer for thirty years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a sanitation facility in their home to improve access to sanitation and water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Nani will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a sanitation facility in their home to improve access to sanitation and water for their family.

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn is 38 years old, married and with 2 children aged 17 and 13 years old.

Maylyn together with her husband operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) as it is their only source of income.

Her store has a lot of customers because it is located in front of the street and she gets a income of PHP 2,000-2,500 daily.

Maylyn works hard and opens her store by 6 am; she works up to 12 in the night to provide for her children's needs especially her eldest who is now in college.

Maylyn is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, sugar biscuits, soaps, shampoo and other items to sell in her store. She wants to take the opportunity to increase her income since it is the holiday season.

Maylyn wants to expand her business to be a wholesaler in their community in the future so she can provide for her children's education and needs.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, sugar biscuits, soaps, shampoo and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.en:
60-year-old Constantina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, eggs, assorted canned goods and toiletries. She is a widow woman and has two grown-up children. She resides in the town of Barili.

For the past five years, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store, serving neighbors and locals in her community.

At this moment, Constantina needs more funds to stock her shop in order to cater for what is missing in her inventory. Therefore, she joined Kiva's field partner CEVI to access financial services.

She wants to to purchase feeds, rice, assorted groceries and drinks. This will enable her to provide a variety of stock and attract buyers to make purchases. Thus her income will slowly improve and she will continue to manage her finances wisely.

Constantina is grateful to Kiva for the continued support and she is willing to strive hard to make it more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  feed, rice, assorted groceries and drinks

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Remelyn dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 60 years old, a widow woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nilda has a general store business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned good, noodles and school supplies to sell.

Nilda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nilda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned good, noodles and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and all four children are enrolled in school.

Mildred is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mildred has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 57 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ana has a general store business in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ana has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
Elesia is 68 years old, married with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elesia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Elesia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Elesia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Elesia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mehmooda

texts.en:
Mehmooda is a 46-year-old lady and a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Mehmooda has been running her own business by making leather bags for the past 20 years.

Mehmooda needs to purchase raw materials and accessories required for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill this need Mehmooda has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan she will buy this merchandise for her business purpose. That will be good for her to earn more income and this income will support her to fulfill her family's needs. Mehmooda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to make an investment in her leather bag making business.

loans.name: Achille Bernardin

texts.fr:
Achille a 34ans. Il est très laborieux et cela grâce à son âge encore vert. Sa femme travaille avec lui dans la vente de riz. Le couple a 2 enfants dont le seul âgé de 6ans est scolarisé.
Il est dans la vente de riz blanc depuis 2013. Il a commencé avec un seul sac de riz. Et le commerce se développe petit à petit au fil du temps. Il a déjà un local, et il est bien placé. Son problème était souvent l'insuffisance de fonds de roulement. Le prêt servira à acheter du riz blanc pour la revente.
Il a pour objectif de devenir un grossiste en riz blanc dans l’avenir.
texts.en: Achille is 34. He is very hard-working thanks to his young age. His wife works with him, selling rice. The couple have 2 children, one of which - 6 years old - receives schooling. He has been selling rice since 2013, starting off with just one sack and growing his business gradually over time. He already has a well-situated residence in which to stay. In the past he has often faced the problem of insufficient working capital. A loan will help Achille to buy white rice for resale. In the future, he aims to become a white rice wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 49-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and seven children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her son owns a scrap recycling shop and deals with the recycling of scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, and other metals. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the people in the streets and sells them to the recycling factories.

Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount needed to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap inventory for further selling to earn.

That is why Shamim requested a loan for her son, so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs of the family.

She is very much obliged to Kiva support. She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her son's recycling businesses.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.fr: Angeline, 40 ans, revend des chaussures usagées depuis une dizaine d’année. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie. Célibataire et sans enfant, elle emploie ses revenus pour agrandir le commerce et faire un peu d’économie. Elle est très dynamique. Elle prend les crédits pour investir dans son activité.
texts.en: Angeline is 40 years old, single and has no children. She has been selling used shoes for ten years and that is how she earns her living. She takes the loans to invest in her business. She is very energetic, and uses her income to expand her business and to save a little.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise inventory

loans.name: Sokkom

texts.en:
Sokkom is 48 years old and married with four children. She lives in a village in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. Sokkom earns her income from the gasoline-selling business. She has been in this business since 2014. One her four children works as worker, and three others attend school. Her husband is 47 years old and a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. Sokkom, her husband and the child can earn around USD 21 each day.

To find a way to help her husband earn more income, Sokkom would like to request a loan to buy a trailer to fix to her husband’s motorcycle to run as a Tuk Tuk taxi. This loan will help her husband earn more income. In the future, she is going to expand her husband's business, build a new proper house and support her three children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to fix to her husband’s motorcycle so it can run as a Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Delina Group

texts.en:
Mapunda, who is in his mid 50's, is married with four children. He has been running a grocery store and selling pigs for nine years now. He works from 2 pm to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase on stock of drinks and started selling pigs. He has managed to pay back all of his previous loan successfully. He is doing great with his loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is doing fine.

He used the profit to repay the loan, renovate his house, and pay the school fees of his four children. He will use this loan to buy bestselling drinks and to increase on his pig stock. He dreams of expanding his business.

Mapunda will share this loan with his loan group Delina, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bestselling drinks and to increase on his pig stock.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is a 29-year-old single mother with two children. For the past three years, she has managed a hog-raising business. Two months ago, Melecia sold her four hogs for 19,000 PHP. Usually, her business income is spent on her family’s daily expenses at home.

Melecia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase hogs to raise and hog feed. In the future, she’s hoping that her business will continue to grow profitably.

loans.use: to purchase hogs to raise and feed

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of 13 children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a blacksmith business in the Philippines and also earns income from poultry. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her blacksmith business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her blacksmith business.

loans.name: Darlen

texts.en:
Darlen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

Darlen industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like fattening pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 47 years old. She lives in the Khasuri district with her husband. Her husband works for the Georgian railway as an engine-driver and gets a monthly income.

Lela decided to start a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1,700 USD.

With the received credit, she will purchase an oven and other materials and will bake cakes to sell. She will get orders and will work hard to generate income. Lela is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and other materials to bake cakes to sell.

loans.name: Dina Esther

texts.es:
Dina, estudio hasta sexto grado de educacion basica es madre soltera tiene dos hijas que estan estudiando y que viven con ella. Tambien vive una hermana co ella pero es independiente. Solamente sus dos hijas dependen de ella.

Dina, trabaja de empleada domestica lo a hecho por mas de quince años para poder mantener a sus hijas y darles estudio tambien hace tortillas para vender antes solo se dedicaba a oficios domesticos la distancia donde trabaja esta como a una cuadra de sus casa y viaja a pie le apoyan sus hijas.

Dina, necesita el prestamo para invertir en la venta de tortillas, y obtener mayores ingresos para que sus hijas puedan terminar de estudiar este ciclo. Le mejorara su condicion de estudio y por lo tanto le mejorara su calidad de vida y se siente satisfecha porque con el prestamo puede cubrir lo que necesita para sus hijas.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando muy fuerte para que sus hijas estudien y se preparen academicamente y el prestamo le ayudara a lograr sus sueños con sus sueldo va ir pagando el prestamo porque sus objetivos tambien es responder muy bien co el compromiso del prestamo par aque le sigan prestanado mas adelante.
texts.en:
Dina studied up to Grade 6 of basic education. She is a single mother who has two children who are studying and live with her. A sister also lives there but she is independent. Only her two children are dependent on her.

Dina works as a domestic employee and has done this for more than fifteen years in order to maintain her children and provide them with their studies. She also makes tortillas to sell. Previously she only worked as a domestic. The distance to her work is about a block from her house. She walks there and her children help her.

Dina needs the loan to invest in the sale of tortillas and obtain greater revenue so that her children can finish their studies in this cycle. It will improve their study conditions and therefore improve their quality of living. She feels satisfied as the loan will cover what she needs for her children.

Her dreams are to continue to work very hard so her children study and prepare academically and the loan will help her achieve her dreams. She will pay off the loan with her salary as her objective is to also be responsible with her loan commitment so she can continue to receive loans later on.

loans.use: to invest in the sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Eben Ezer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EBEN EZER” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margot es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, venta de chompas, venta de pantalones, venta de peluches, venta de enaguas, tienda de barrio, venta de impresoras y tintas para computadora.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margot es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de impresoras y tinta para computadoras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años con la ayuda de su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de cartuchos de tinta por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La paz y posteriormente lo  comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “EBEN EZER” communal bank is starting their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional branch. It is made up of nine members lead by a board of directors with Margot as President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Amongst them are: a transport service, selling sweaters, selling pants, stuffed toy sales, the sale of petticoats, a neighborhood stor and selling printers and ink for computers.

The loan will benefit all these small micro-entrepreneurs, Margot being one of them. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling printers and ink for computers. She says that she started this business several years ago with the help of her husband.

The loan that she is now taking out will be used to increase her working capital (buying ink cartridges wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesalers of the city of La Paz and later sell in her commercial space. This manner of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the training and the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy cartridges of ink wholesale.

loans.name: Ommaya

texts.en:
Ommaya is a 47-year-old divorced mother. Ten years ago, she started preparing and selling olives and olive oil to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of three members. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is well-known in her region.

She is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary harvest and retail tools to increase her production and better serve her customers.

Ommaya hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the necessary harvest and retail tools to increase her production and better serve her customers.

loans.name: Mountaha

texts.en:
Mountaha is a 27-year-old married mother of three, who puts so much effort into raising them and providing them with the necessary living needs.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to pay her children's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you are enabling access to education for students with limited options. Mountaha hopes to both continue supporting her children's education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Neka Bua Group

texts.en:
Dorkas and Yohana are members of a loan group called Neka Bua. Dorkas, wearing a red blouse, is 46 years old and married to Benyamin, a 64-year-old farmer. She owns a business selling different kinds of vegetables and fruits at the local market. Dorkas’s business is situated about four kilometers her residence. She tries to assist her husband in managing their family’s daily needs and providing for their children’s education. 

Dorkas is requesting loan to buy coconuts to sell. She expects to generate more income if she sells coconuts. When a neighbor shared information about the TLM loan product, she thought it would be the best chance for her to improve the business. Along with group member Yohana, they are requesting a total loan of 4,000,000 IDR. Dorkas believes that her loan will benefit her business in the future. Dorkas and Yohana are happy because Kiva, through TLM, cares about their business improvement.

loans.use: to buy coconuts

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman and a mother of three children, ages 17, 10, and 9. She lives in the town of Dumanjug and earns a living through her hog-raising business. Her husband also has an income that could help cater to the needs and expenses of their household.

She would like to increase the number of her livestock, but she has encountered challenges that could hamper the progress of her livelihood. First is the high cost of livestock maintenance and the seasonality of livestock trade.

Virginia is asking for a loan to purchase pig feed and groceries for the family, and to pay for school fees. Thus, she will be able to raise quality hogs and her income will improve.

She hopes to expand her hog-raising business and to make it a success. Furthermore, she wants to save money for future use.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and groceries for the family, and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 46 years old, married and has four children; they live in Solana. She is managing a store for an income while her spouse manages a farming business.

Mely is now asking for additional capital to invest in her business. That is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and eggs.

In the future, Mely hopes to continue improving her business so she will attain good profits and save funds for the family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and eggs.

loans.name: Mindia

texts.en:
Mindia is 29 years old from Batumi district. He is married and lives with his wife and 2 daughters.

Mindia is unemployed and needs some money to start a trading business. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,300 USD.

With the received credit he will purchase a stock of hay and will start a trading business. This will give him a chance to generate a stable income and improve the living conditions for his family. Mindia awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trading business.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 25 years old and is supporting 8 people in his family. He operates a motorcycle for transport, a business he has been doing for the last 5 years and gets a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He has applied for his third loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to service his motorcycle for better efficiency and service.

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle for better efficiency and service.

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is a 23 years old and is supporting 2 people in his family.

He sells second hand clothes, a business he has been doing for the last 2 years, and gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase more stock of clothing.

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Sokny, 18, is a freshman pursuing a bachelor’s degree in engineering at a university in the city. He is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Sokny’s parents are construction workers. 

Sokny is requesting a loan to cover his tuition fees for his first through fourth years of school. His finances are short and his loan will help cover his university fees and allow him to successfully earn his degree. Sokny’s dream is to have a proper job with a decent salary, so that he will be able to save enough money to build his own house. If he ever has children, he wants them to study through college and beyond if he can support them.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees for his first to fourth years of school

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 36-year-old married mother of one, who puts so much effort into raising her child and providing it with the necessary living needs. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to pay her child's school tuition fees.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you are enabling access to education for students with limited options. Houda hopes to both continue supporting her child's education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Hawraa

texts.en:
Hawraa is a 32-year-old married mother of two, who puts so much effort into raising them and providing them with the necessary living needs.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to pay her children's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you are enabling access to education for students with limited options. Hawraa hopes to both continue supporting her children's education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a hard-working woman who earns a living through a buy-and-sell business. She sells bottled mineral water to locals in her community. She is a married woman and has two school-aged children. Her husband is a driver.

She is also seeking ways to improve her quality of life so she wants to begin selling bananas as, at the moment, banana sales are on the rise.

This is why she is asking for a loan from CEVI to have access to additional funds to finance both her sources of income. Nimfa wants to purchase stocks of bottled mineral water and additional supplies of bananas. In this way she hopes to improve her financial income.

For the future, Nimfa is hoping that with the aid of these resources, she will be able to manage things properly to make her livelihood more sustainable and be able to continue support the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of bottled mineral water and additional supplies of bananas.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a hard-working mother of five children. She is always finding ways to earn money for her family. When she got married, Vilma started a retail business. As time went on, while managing the business, she began to also offer cooked foods. Now, Vilma is managing her sari-sari store and mini restaurant business. Vilma has an increasing number of customers and is unable to provide everything they want to buy. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy groceries to sell. She will also use her loan to buy raw meat, ingredients, and vegetables for her restaurant business. Vilma believes that through the loan, she will be able to meet her customers' needs and at the same time earn more income.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
For almost four years now, Bernadette has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities ranging from noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, soap, bottled mineral water and beverages. She is a 51 year old, married woman, with five children, with one still attending school. She hails from the town of Dumanjug.

Due to the fact that demand on basic commodities is at its peak, she needs additional funds to fill the inventory which is out of stock. Bernadette is asking for a loan to purchase additional stocks of mineral water, assorted groceries and drinks. These will keep her store fully stocked and could attract potential buyers. Thus, her earnings will improve and enable her to continue to provide for the needs of her family.

In this way, Bernadette would be able to save and also be able to do some expansion. She is hoping that someday she will become a successful entrepreneur and be able to support the schooling of her youngest child too.

loans.use: to  purchase additional stocks  of mineral water, assorted groceries and drinks

loans.name: Rajan

texts.en:
Rajan is a 57-year-old married woman with seven children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

Rajan has run a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalo for milking purposes and sells the milk in her area. Rajan was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenses. Now her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to earn a good income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Antonella Group

texts.en:
Abir is the featured borrower for the Antonella group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living, at the same time.

Abir is a 38-year-old, married mother of three. She works from her house in a beauty business, specializing in tattoo work, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She has nine years of experience in this domain. She has her loyal customers and a good reputation for her professional skills. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy ink for her tattoo machine to satisfy her customers' requests. She is the second lady on the right.

With respect the other group members, Khadija is the first lady on the right, Mona is the second on the left, and Souad is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy ink for her tattoo machine to satisfy her customers' requests.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is 51 years old and widowed. She has been running a crockery sales business for many years. She offers various types of crockery, such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. She makes a sufficient income to contribute to the family income.

To improve her business, Perveen contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. With this loan she will be able to purchase more variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting to boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, who is in her early 70s, is widowed and has four children, three of whom are still in school. She has been running a pharmacy for five years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Martha's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to increase the medical stocks for her business and has paid back her loan successfully. Martha is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and to renovate her house. Martha will use this loan to increase the medical stock for her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

Martha will be accountable for paying back the loan as per schedule.

loans.use: to increase medical stock for her business.

loans.name: Las Únicas Valientes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS UNICAS VALIENTES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existe: venta de comida, venta de manteles, venta de edredones, venta de manta, tienda de barrio, venta de frescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace veintidós años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz por quintal) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La paz y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución y las reuniones de pago.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Unicas Valientes" will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Centro Focal German Busch. It is made up of new members and led by a board, with Eugenia as President. The businesses of the members are varied and include food sales, tablecloth sales, quilt sales, manta (a type of traditional shawl) sales, a bodega, and beverage sales.

The loan they are seeking will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, such as Eugenia, who was invited to join Pro Mujer by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She learned about this business from her mother 22 years ago.

This loan will be used to increase Eugenia's capital by buying a quintal of rice from wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and then preparing it and selling it afterward. This will allow her to generate the means to support her family, as she is married with three children.

Eugenia likes the training that the Pro Mujer institute offers, as well as the repayment meetings.

loans.use: buy a quintal of rice.

loans.name: Peo

texts.en:
Peo is 49 years old, and a married homemaker with two children. She resides in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. Her two children attend school. Her husband is a car mechanic, and he has been in this job since 2012. Her husband can earn approximately $10 per day.

Now she would like to apply for a loan, for her husband to buy an old machine to clean and fix, and resell. This loan will help her husband to improve the family’s finances. In the future, Peo hopes to expand her husband’s business, renovate her house, and help her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy an old machine to clean and fix, and resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old and supporting nine people in his family. He sells clothes, a business he has been doing for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He has applied for his third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase an additional stock of clothes. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gralphine

texts.en:
Gralphine is 25 years old. She is married and has two children.

She has had a dairy farming business for one year. She will be using the loan to buy more animal feed for her cows.

She will use the anticipated profit to buy clothes for her children and to repay her loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life, together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
As for many women, it was financial constraints that played a potent part in encouraging Zahida to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan.

Zahida is 43 years old, married and the mother of eight children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She owns buffalo for milking and is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She is happily supporting her family with the income she generates.

Zahida has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Las Viacheñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VIACHEÑAS” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Graciela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cerveza, venta de ropa, venta de calzados, servicio de mecánica dental, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de polleras, venta de flores.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Graciela es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años por una necesidad económica por la que atravesaba.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las reuniones de pago de su banca comunal, que se realiza en la institución.
texts.en:
The community association “LAS VIACHEÑAS” will begin its twelfth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office. It is comprised of eight members and is directed by a board of which Graciela is the secretary. The businesses carried out by the members of the community association are varied. Among them are the sale of beer, the sale of clothes, the sale of footwear, a dental technician service, the sale of food, the sale of indigenous skirts, and the sale of flowers.

The loan they will receive will benefit the small businesses of which Graciela is a member. She states that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling food. She adds that she learned this business on her own initiative several years ago due to an economic necessity she was experiencing.

The loan she will receive now will be used to increase her capital (buying groceries wholesale), that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and thereafter to make food that she will sell from her food stall. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes the payment meetings of the communal bank that the institution holds.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
A 26-year-old married mother of one, Malak started providing beauty services as a hair dresser in 2006. She is a hard-working lady, putting much effort toward developing her business and supporting her husband in covering their family's increasing needs.

Malak is well-known in her region and recommended by her customers. Her business income, combined with her husband's, is barely enough to cover their family's expenses. That's why she decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for a necessary urgent dental surgery she has to undergo.

Malak is working hard to develop her beauty salon and respond to her customers' needs.

loans.use: to pay for a necessary urgent dental surgery.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is a married woman and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Razel is 40 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Razel has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Razel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a housewife living with her family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her family consists of three children and a husband. Her husband has been working in his welding shop for 16 years. The husband and wife are working hard to make both ends meet.

As her husband is well experienced in his profession and his work is also liked by his customers, he gets enough orders in a month. Her husband has been thinking for quite a time period of making further investments into his business and increasing his profit amount. That is the reason Nasreen applied for the loan, to give her husband's business a boost and increase their monthly income. She is thankful to the Kiva team and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Famille Bawili Mutolwa Group

texts.fr: Rizicultrice depuis sa jeunesse, Mutolwa a cinquante ans d'expérience dans cette activité. Métier qu'elle a hérité de ses parents qui contribue à l'alimentation, la scolarisation et les soins de santé familiaux. La saison dernière, grâce à un capital investi de trois cents dollars, elle a réalisé trois cents autres sous forme de gain. Financièrement faible, elle souhaite continuer à être appuyée afin d'agrandir les superficies exploitées; chose qui aura une conséquence sur ses revenus à gagner ainsi que l'amélioration de ses conditions de vie. Mutolwa porte un tricot vert sur la photo.
texts.en:
Mutolwa has been a rice grower since she was young, and has 50 years experience with this activity. The business, which she inherited from her parents, contributes to the family's food, school education and health care. Mutolwa is wearing a green sweater in the photo.

Last season, thanks to a $300 investment, Mutolwa earned another $300. Because of her weak financial position, she hopes she will continue to be supported in order to expand the areas under cultivation. This will have an impact on the income she earns, and will also improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to weed and to spray weedkiller and fertilizer

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine is 19. She has been working in the beauty business since she was 16, when she decided to quit school and take the necessary vocational training to start her own beauty services business. Currently, she is running the business from her parents' house.

Sabrine is developing her skills and business at the same time. She is investing her acquired income in purchasing things for her business and personal needs, but still she needs extra financial support to diversify the services she can provide.

Thus, as a step forward, she requested a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to purchase a facial machine and newly-released cosmetics, to develop her business. She hopes that in the future she can move her beauty salon outside her parents' house and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a facial machine and newly-released cosmetics, to develop her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 53 years old. She is widowed and supporting five children. She sells vegetables and fruits, and she engages in dairy and horticultural farming. She has been in these businesses for more than five years, now, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000.

She has borrowed KES 60,000, as her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. With the loan she intends to buy vegetables and fruits, as well as a dairy cow.

From the expanded business profits, she plans to buy food, provide good shelter, save for future needs, and repay the loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell, as well as another dairy cow for her farm.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Monina dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Opipah

texts.en:
