Good day lenders! Meet Opipah, a client of KPP-UMKM Syariah. Opipah is a 55-year-old, married woman. She has been selling food, which is called “Nasi Uduk,” and her husband has been a builder for twenty-five years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,100,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build plumbing at her home, to gain access to sanitation and a safe water source for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Opipah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life, with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all her lenders.

loans.use: to build plumbing at her home, to gain access to sanitation and a safe water source for her family.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ Y VIDA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existe: venta de perfumes, venta de pan, venta de helados, venta de artesanías en madera, venta de zapatillas deportivas, venta de flores.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de perfumes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus amigas hace veinte años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de perfumes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto para  posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Luz y Vida" will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional center. It is comprised of eight members, and is directed by a board, of which Victoria is the president. The businesses carried out by the members of the communal association are varied. Among them are the sale of perfumes, the sale of bread, the sale of ice cream, the sale of wood handicrafts, the sale of athletic shoes, and the sale of flowers.

The loan they will receive will benefit the small entrepreneurs of which Victoria is a member. She states that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling perfumes. She adds that she learned this business from her friends twenty years ago. The loan she will take out now will be to increase her capital (the sale of perfumes wholesale) that she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, to later sell in her sales space. This form of work permits her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has eight children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujder, she responds that she likes the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy perfumes wholesale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 21 years old university student, he is majoring at computer science in his fourth year. To ‎be able to help in covering his university fees and his study demands he started working as a ‎delivery boy for one of the fast food restaurants, but till now his father who works as car ‎mechanic supports his and his three siblings.

Ahmad is now requesting a loan to pay for his next ‎semester fees and buy the books he needs for the semester, as he will pay back the loan from his ‎own salary from now on.‎

loans.use: to pay for his 4th year ‎semester fees in Computer Science

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 38 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a responsible mother of five children and is 61 years of age. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last ten years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Shamshad's son needs to do maintenance on his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires some money to maintain his taxi car. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do maintenance on his vehicle.

Therefore Shamshad has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Shamshad's son can afford the maintenance cost easily. In this way he can provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. She also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her son's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her son's taxi repair.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman with a child. She describes herself as energetic. She operates a retail business, in which she sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. She will use the 700 GHS loan to buy more vegetables, for customer satisfaction. Her business goal is to expand business within five years. This is her first loan with ID-Ghana. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, for customer satisfaction.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin, 52, is a resident in Tbaung Khmum province and she is married with three dependent children, one of whom is in school. She makes a living through growing rice and selling vegetables in her community. 
Channa is now asking for a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees and school supplies for her son who pursue his bachelor degree in Banking. She hopes that this loan will keep her son in school until he graduates from university so that he can have a good paid job to make a living.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and supplies for her son to pursue his bachelor degree in Banking.  She is a rice farmer.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum District, Tbaung Khmum Province

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 54-year-old, divorced mother. About nine years ago, she opened a grocery shop to cover her family's needs. She is responsible for her parents, and she is working hard to cover their needs and expenses and take a good care of them.

Majida is well-known among the people of her region and has her loyal customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with new items and offers. The loan will help her to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming Christmas season.

Majida hopes to expand her business more in the future, to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise, with new items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.name: Basimise Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis 2007 que Véronique a entamé le commerce de pains à l'initiative de son mari qui fournit les médicaments dans la périphérie de la ville. Ce qui plait à notre intéressée, c'est le fait cette activité supplée aux charges familiales; elle gagne par course d'approvisionnement un bénéfice net de plus de dix-neuf dollars. Ce qui lui réjouit énormément. Comme projet, elle compte augmenter les articles et les produits sur leur étalage pour avoir plus de bénéfices. Véronique porte sur la photo un pagne bleu.
texts.en: In 2007, Véronique started selling bread on the initiative of her husband, who provides medicines on the outskirts of town. What Véronique likes about this business is that it helps to meet the family's expenses. She earns a net income of more than $19 per supply cycle, which pleases her enormously. Her plan is to increase the items and products on display in her stall to earn more income. Véronique is wearing a blue pagne in the photo.

loans.use: to increase inventory by purchasing various items for resale

loans.name: Mubina

texts.en: Mubina is a woman with experience in cooking Sumbusa (a national pie, which consists of meat, onions, and flour). She cooks and sells Sumbusas at the central market. Her husband and son help her with this job. She wants to cook the best Sumbusas, with high quality. She intends to enlarge her business and to sell her Sumbusas in bulk and at retail. For cooking high-quality Sumbusas she needs an electric tool, which she wants to buy. She is asking for a loan of 1,600 Tajikistan Somoni with this aim. She thanks you for your help and mercy, and hopes that she will cook Sumbusas with high quality and reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy an electricity balancer for developing her food business.

loans.name: Renacer 09 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER 09” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marlene es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de carne de res, venta de comida, venta de jugo de frutas, venta de masitas, venta de chompas de lana, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marlene es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida rápida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años con el apoyo de una amiga.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por quintal) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y los créditos otorgados en la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “RENACER 09” [Be Reborn 09] will start the second cycle in "Pro Mujer" , as part of the Villa Adela regional office. It's made up of eight members and is directed by a board on which Mrs. Marlene is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them are: the sale of food, the sale of red meat, the sale of fruit juice, the sale of pastries, the sale of wool sweaters, and a neighborhood store.   

The loan they are taking out will benefit these small micro-entrepreneurs, Mrs. Marlene being one of them. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. At present she has a business that sells fast food. She says that she learned this trade several years ago with the support of a friend.  
 
The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying potatoes by the quintal) which she will acquire from the vendors in the city of El Alto and later will cook and sell in the city's fairs. This manner of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training and the loans granted by the institution.

loans.use: Buy potatoes by the quintal

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
This nice lady lives in Tsaghkunk village, of Gegharkunik region. Her name is Heghine. She has two higher educations, and her specialties are philology and pedagogy. Since 2002, she has been working at the village school, as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. Heghine is a very clever and patient pedagogue who works diligently and devotedly, in order to teach a lot. She helps all her pupils with any hardship they have in their lessons. She also gives paid private courses, for pupils who are going to take entrance exams.

Heghine is married, and she has two children. With her husband, she also manages to farm; they develop it with profit for their lovely family.

This loan of 690,000 Armenian drams Heghine asks, because she greatly needs to buy a computer, computer accessories, and professional literature for her self-development activities, which she finds very important.

loans.use: to buy a computer, computer accessories, and professional literature for her self-development activities, which she finds very important.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado MUJERES AL PODER está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edelina, quien tiene una despensa en su casa,  y comenta que hace un tiempo tiene este negocio y que gracias a el ayuda a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que pone todo de sí para poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para surtir su despensa, como ser frutas, verduras, bebidas, carnes y otros. Agradece por esta oportunidad de poder seguir con sus ventas
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres al Poder" [Women in Power] is part of the poverty elimination program, which will allow them to know each other's living conditions and to work accordingly. 

One of the members is Mrs. Edelina, who has a general store in her house, and comments that she has had the business for some time now and that thanks to it, she helps her family. She is a very hardworking person who gives her all to be able to move forward. 

She is asking for this loan so she can buy items to supply her store, like fruits, vegetables, drinks, meat, and other items. She is thankful for this opportunity to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the store, such as fruits, vegetables, beverages, meat and other items.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is 25 years old and is single. He finished his degree and was hired and worked in a company. But due to difficulty in getting regular work, Charlie decided to put up a business. Now, he is managing a computer shop business in their village. He offers computer repairing, computer rentals, and other related computer work. With his expertise in computer, sometimes they hire him to install Internet connection and install a CCTV for extra income.

Charlie wants to add computer units but he can’t make it because of not having enough budget to buy. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more computers for his business. Charlie is doing his best to succeed with the business he has now.

loans.use: to buy computers for his business.

loans.name: Bevitha

texts.en:
Bevitha is 57-year-old married woman and a mother of a twelve-year-old son. She lives in the town of Aloguinsan, in the province of Cebu.

Bevitha has been raising poultry for quite a period of time. This serves as her family's main source of income. She would like to raise more poultry, but she has very limited resources when it comes to the maintenance. That is why she join CEVI to cater to her financial needs.

Bevitha is asking for a loan to invest in feed and to purchase food for the family. In that way, in a few months to come, she will be able to sell more chickens and her earning will augment.

In the future, Bevitha hopes to expand her business and make it a success. Furthermore, she wants to save money to pay for the school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Hripsime

texts.en:
Hripsime is 32 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She has a higher pedagogical education. Already for 10 years Hripsime has worked in her specialty. At the school she is a teacher of mathematics. She also has a group of pupils whom she gives paid private courses in mathematics and prepares them for the entrance exams. She teaches very properly and explains very clearly and the majority of her pupils have great successes in their exams.

Hripsime is married and has a small child. Her husband is engaged in a trading business. This loan of 500,000 Armenian drams that Hripsime requested is for the purchase of a computer and also professional literature which she needs for her private courses and also for her self-development activities as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer and educational literature.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
This young farmer is 29 years old and his name is Mher. He lives in the frontier village Lusadzor of the Tavush region. Mher is married and he has a son and a daughter. Having no higher education Mher has hardships but manages to cover his family’s needs by farming and also by doing cargo transfers in his truck.

Mher established his farm himself and at first he had only two pigs and a small plot of land. Now he has a lot of pigs and piglets, 100 chickens and also a large plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes and tomatoes. He planted fig and persimmon trees and established a nice and colorful orchard. Mher likes to admire his farm, since each stone on it and each corner of it is the result of his and his wife’s day and night working. It is the result of their respect, care and love towards each other that each of them feel responsible to provide better living and comfort for the other.

From the farm Mher sells a lot of pork, poultry and eggs. His land’s vegetables and fruits Mher sells at the city’ wholesale market. Now with this loan of 550,000 Armenian drams Mher is going to use for the purchase of a new special sort of pigs which are more profitable for meat sale, and he will also buy fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy pigs & cattle fodder.

loans.name: Smela

texts.en:
Smela is 56 years old, and she lives in Kadjaran city, of Syunik region. Smela, who had a vocational education and graduated trading college, managed to work for several years in the trading sphere. Then she attended courses in accountancy, and for many years already she has been running the accounting of several companies. Smela is married, and she has a daughter who is already married and living with her own family in Yerevan city. Smela’s husband works at the Kadjaran combine, as a locksmith.

This woman is hopeful that her request will be accepted by the Kiva lenders. She asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams. Smela needs this loan in order to solve her health problems that she began to feel lately, and she impatiently wants to get rid of the health problems.

loans.use: to solve her health problems that she began to feel lately, and she impatiently wants to get rid of the health problems.

loans.name: Svetik

texts.en:
Svetik is 60 years old and she lives with her beloved husband in Kapan city in the Syunik region. She specializes in tailoring. For many years she worked at the city’s textile factory, but since the factory is closed now she became employed at the school canteen.

Svetik’s husband is taxi driver. Their grandchildren who are school-aged are going to live with them and Svetik with her husband are already worried about how to provide them with comfort. They managed to do some savings during several years and they hope that with the help of this Kiva loan, in the amount of 200,000 Armenian drams, they will manage to do some cosmetic repairing of their flat, making it brighter, cleaner and more pleasant for their grandchildren.

loans.use: to repair her flat to make it nicer for her grandchildren.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 44-year-old conservative mother of four sons. Her husband supports the family from ‎working as a crane driver. One of her sons is Omar, who is appearing in the photo instead of Huda. ‎He is a 21-year-old university student majoring in nursing. At the same time he works a part-time job ‎at a supermarket to make some pocket money and help his father financially whenever he can. ‎

Huda is requesting a loan to help in paying Omar’s next semester fees to continue with his studies.‎

loans.use: to help her son to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Jacinta's Group

texts.en:
Jacinta is 39 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for 10 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Jacinta is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Jacinta started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2012, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Jacinta’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice A

texts.en: Beatrice, little by little, has managed to get ahead with her store with the unconditional support of Kiva through ID-Ghana.  She is a single parent with one child.  Beatrice has had the opportunity to work with loans before, which have been a lot of help for her. For this reason, she asked for a loan to purchase more fresh tilapia for the attainment of customer demand. With this loan, she will be able to make better sales and get more earnings.

loans.use: to buy tilapia to sell.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Catherine, who as a group leader is representing her group formed by 9 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 2 children. She is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Catherine joined One Acre Fund in 2012 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Catherine plans to rent more land to cultivate.

Between the 9 farmers in Catherine's Group, a total of 6 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Doha

texts.en:
Doha is a 49-year-old Palestinian owner of a grocery store in North Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children in a Palestinian refugee camp where her husband and children also work.

Doha has been running her store since 2011 and her sister-in-law occasionally helps her during peak hours. She sells all types of food products and most importantly candies and toys, which attracts children from all over the area. Doha's prices are very competitive compared to other shops and it has been helping her improve her business.

Doha is asking for a 1,571,592 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to increase her stocks in food products and increase her sales.

Doha's ambition is to see her grocery store grow and attract more customers. The loan will allow her to do that by serving more people with her increased stocks.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Proyecto Bolivariano Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROYECTO BOLIVARIANO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Judith es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de electrodomésticos, tienda de barrio, pastelería, cerrajería, venta de miel.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Judith es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su suegra hace quince años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una carpa para su puesto, esta compra le beneficiará a ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece el señor Carlos ya que después del desembolso tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta; sin embargo, se quedo su esposa que es la señora de chompa de color lila.
texts.en:
The "Proyecto Bolivariano" Communal Bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, which is part of the Villa Adela Focal Center. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board whose president is Judith. The members of the communal bank are making progress in a variety of businesses, including food sales, the sale of home appliances, a neighborhood store, a bakery, a locksmith, and the sale of honey.

The loan that they take out will benefit small businesses including Judith's. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation an advisor from the organization. Currently, she has a business selling food, and says that she learned this business from her mother-in-law fifteen years ago. 

The loan that she takes now will be used to buy a tent for her stall. This purchase will benefit her by allowing her to offer better service to her customers in her retail space. Since she is single and has four children, this type of work allows her to generate financial resources to help her family.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health center offered by the institution.

A man named Carlos does not appear in the picture because after the disbursement, he had to go to his sales job; however, his wife stayed and is the woman in the lilac-colored sweater.

loans.use: to buy a tent for her food stall.

loans.name: Mijgonakhon

texts.en:
Mijgona has dreamed since childhood of becoming a manager and helping people. She is on the way to reaching her goal. She is studying at the Tajik State University of Law, Business and Politics (TSU LBP) as a first-year student. Her parents have little income and it’s hard for her to pay university tuition.

She is a very kind and bright girl. She is well-bred girl. She is studying very well, with excellent and good marks. She participates in a lot of circles.

Mijgona is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to pay for university tuition. She hopes with your help and mercy she will pay her tuition and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 23-year-old married lady who became a mother at a young age, but that did not stop ‎her from achieving her dreams and continuing with her educational path. She registered at the ‎university to major in accounting and she is now in her second year. Looking after her child while ‎being committed to school is a bit challenging for her, but she is managing with the help of her ‎husband to balance all of her duties.

Asmaa is requesting a loan today to help her in ‎paying her upcoming semester fees and getting the books she needs for the semester to start ‎preparing during the holidays. ‎

loans.use: to pay fees for her upcoming semester

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE ALEGRES” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, venta de mantas, venta de verduras, venta de zapatos, venta de comida, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia  es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de madera por mayor) que adquirirá de las barracas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la fabricación, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la foto también aparece la hija de la señora Basilia, que es la señorita que viste con chompa de color rojo.
texts.en:
The communal bank “SIEMPRE ALEGRES” [Always Happy] will start it's seventh cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamerican regional office. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board on which Mrs. Alicia is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them are: the sale of furniture, the sale of blankets, the sale of vegetables, the sale of shoes, the sale of food and a neighborhood store. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit these small micro-entrepreneurs, Mrs. Alicia being one of them. She indicates that she's been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  At present she has a business that makes and sells furniture. She learned this trade from her husband several years ago. 
 
The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying wood wholesale) that she will acquire from the barracks in the city of El Alto and later use to make and sell furniture in her sales stand. This manner of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and healthcare that the institution offers.

The daughter of Mrs. Basilia is also in the photo, she is the lady dressed in the red sweater.

loans.use: To buy wholesale wood

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 54-year-old divorced woman with three children who lives in one of the rural communities in southern Ghour. ‎She started a grocery business three years ago to improve her standard of living and to be a productive woman. She sells food and cleaning supplies.

Sameera says that the challenge she faces with her business is low liquidity. She requests a loan to buy more ‎products for the store. In the future, she would like to expand and improve her business. Sameera thanks you for your ‎support.‎

loans.use: to buy drinks, chips, biscuits, and kitchen supplies for her store.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 52 years old and she lives in Sevan city, in Gegharkunik region. She graduated from Yerevan State University in the faculty of Methodology and Teaching of Secondary Classes. Since 1985 she has worked at a school as a teacher of secondary classes. Hasmik mentions that she likes her pedagogical occupation and her young pupils, so nice and so innocent, who are ready to learn and to develop.

Hasmik is married and she has two sons. Her husband is taxi driver with his own car.

Hasmik is asking for this loan of 350,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a new computer. Her computer has broken down and she greatly needs it in her educational work.

loans.use: to buy a new computer to replace her broken one, which she greatly needs in her work.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is thankful for her three previous loans with Kiva and she is asking for the fourth with great hope of kindness and support from Kiva lenders.

She lives in Sevan city in Gharkunik region with her husband, daughter and son. Hermine works as a teacher at the school; she graduated from the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute history faculty. For 18 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of Armenian History. Hermine’s husband is employed. Their son is back from the army but has not yet managed to find a job.

Hermine is asking for this loan of 230,000 Armenian drams to pay her daughter's tuition fee for the first semester; she studies accounting at the Yerevan State Economic University.

loans.use: for paying to her daughter's tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Sandukht

texts.en: Sandukht lives with her husband and son in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. Her two daughters are married and they live with their families. Sandukht has repaid a previous Kiva loan that helped her to develop her family's farm and cattle-breeding business. Sandukht has cows, a bull, calves, sheep, and many chickens. She sells all the farm products herself at their village wholesale food market. Sandukht does most of the work on the farm now, because her son is employed and he returns home after work very late. Also, her husband has some health problems now. Sandukht will use this loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams not to develop the farm this time, but for a more serious purpose – to help pay for her husband's hospital treatment.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's hospital treatment.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Originally from Takeo province, Savorn, 36, is a married mother of two children who are still in school. She makes a living through growing rice, raising pigs and working for others for a fee. Lower yields and a drop of in the price of rice are challenges in the rice-growing business.

Savorn is now applying for her seventh loan from VisionFund, this one to pay for tuition fees for her son. She hopes that this loan will enable her son to study in university and she hopes to see her son have a bright future after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son to study in university.

loans.name: Panambi Rpry Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Panambi Rory está en su ciclo número 2, donde cada una se puso como meta el crecimiento de todas, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona. Todas  se han comprometido a  trabajar y a realizar actividades   para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo. 
La Sra. Gladys integra este grupo, tiene una mercería y a la vez también vende artesanías que ella misma hace. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se esmera para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y a sus demás seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos variados para su mercería, como ser prendas de vestir, calzados, y otros artículos de mercería.
texts.en:
The group "Panambi Rory" is in its second cycle. In this group each member has the goal of growth for everyone, and not only economic growth, but also personal growth. Everyone has committed to work and undertake activities to reach the group's common goals. 

Mrs. Gladys is a member of this group. She has a sewing/linen store and at the same time sells items that she herself makes. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman that hopes to be able to continue helping her family and other loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to buy various products for her store, such as clothing, shoes, and other sewing items.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and other sewing items.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira is 29 years old and she lives with her small family in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region of Armenia. Naira has a three-year-old son. Her husband does construction work. Naira graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Methodology and Teaching of Secondary Classes. For six years, she has worked in her area of specialty at one of the city’s schools. Naira mentions her great devotion to her work and she says that she is very happy about her choice of profession. Naira is a very bright young teacher who realizes that she must continually build her professional skills. With this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams, Naira will buy literature related to her field as well as a computer to help develop her knowledge of teaching.

loans.use: to buy literature and a computer to help develop her knowledge of teaching.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Luchadoras está muy entusiasmado de poder trabajar de manera unida, para que de esa forma puedan ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien vende prendas de todo tipo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que gracias a sus ventas se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Ella poco a poco está creciendo, y es por ello que decidió unirse al grupo para crecer más.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar mayor variedad de prendas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Luchadoras is very excited to be able to work in a unified manner, so that in this way they can improve the living conditions of themselves and their loved ones. One of the members is Juana who sells garments of all types. She is a very hardworking woman, who thanks to her sales is able to earn a living in a dignified and honest manner.

Little by little she is growing, and for that reason she decided to join the group, in order to grow more. She seeks this loan to be able to buy a larger variety of garments, and in this way to continue with her sales, filling the requests of her customers.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of garments to sell.

loans.name: Talleristas Del Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TALLERISTAS DEL NUEVO AMANECER” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chamarras, venta de polleras (faldas para mujer), venta de salteñas (empanada tradicional), venta de comida, venta de sombreros, venta de detergentes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras (faldas para mujer); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace diez años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de polleras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y  posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “TALLERISTAS DEL NUEVO AMANECER” will begin it's second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamerican regional office. It's made up of eight members and is directed by a board on which Mrs. Lourdes is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them include: the sale of jackets, the sale of skirts, the sale of salteñas (traditional pies), the sale of food, the sale of hats, and the sale of detergent.

The loan they are taking out will benefit these small micro-entrepreneurs, Mrs. Loardes being one of them. She indicated that she's been a member of Pro Mujer for eight months, joining at the invitation of a promotion the institution ran in her area. At present she has a business that sells skirts. She says she learned this trade from her mom and decided to start her own business ten months ago. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying skirts wholesale) which she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later sell in her sales space. This manner of working allows her to generate resources to economically support her family, since she is single.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and healthcare that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy skirts wholesale

loans.name: Ilución Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILUCION Y ESPERANZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de telas, venta de frutas, venta de edredones, venta de tostados, venta de cortinas, venta de mantas, venta de polainas, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió una amiga hace seis años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Ilución Y Esperanza" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the German Busch Regional Office.  It is made up of eight members and is directed by a governing board with Ms. Vicenta as President.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank are developing are very diverse, and include: selling fabrics, fruit, quilts, tostados, curtains, blankets, leggings, and transportation services.
 
The loan will benefit the group of small business owners that Vicenta is a part of.  She says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, which she joined by invitation from a promoter who is part of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling fruit.  She says a friend learned this business six years ago.

Her current loan will be used to increase her capital (buy fruit at wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later sell at her store.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fruits at wholesale

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak is 22 years old and he lives with his parents in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. Arshak is a son of farmers and he is also skilled farmer in his 22 years. With his father he takes care of their rich farm and cultivates vegetables and fruits on their plot of land both for sale and for their family use as well. Arshak mentions of his great love to animals and pleasure of working with land and works hard to lighten his parents’ work and little by little he takes on his duty their care and financial needs.

Arshak needs now Kiva support since he has health problems which need financial support to be basically solved. This loan of 200.000 Armenian drams Arshak asks for the solution of his health problem which causes him great discomfort and limits his ability to work especially in agriculture.

loans.use: for the solution of his health problem which causes him great discomfort and limits his ability to work especially in agriculture

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en: Saddam is a 23 years old student, he is majoring in Finance and Banking in the university. After ‎school Saddam works as a taxi driver till evening where he has to get back to home and does his ‎studies in preparation for the next day. Saddam also helps in supporting his family of 5 members. ‎Now Saddam is requesting a loan to help him in paying for his upcoming semester fees.‎

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees in Finance and Banking

loans.name: Zahira

texts.en:
Zahira is a hardworking married mother of three, she is 32, and is working hard to develop both her business and family's living.
Zahira runs a convenience store for seven years and is updating it as much as she can to make sure that through its acquired income she can increase her selling and develop her family's living.

Zahira is always seeking a better living for her family members, and she is working hard not to affect her business development for personal needs.
Since her house needs urgent maintenance especially for this winter season, to keep her family in a healthy living place; she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary needs to make the requested maintenance for her house to keep it a healthy living place especially in the winter season.
Through this loan she can provide her family a healthy living place and can make sure that she can develop her business through her selling income.

loans.use: to buy the necessary needs to make necessary maintenance for her house to keep it a healthy living place especially in winter.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en:
Khadijeh is a married woman and has three children. She is household supplies and novelties household.‎
Her husband is working as a tailor and his income is not enough for cover all the needs.‎
‎ Khadijeh wants to help her husband in the household expenses and she is working hard to provide good education for her ‎kids, therefore she is thinking to expand her business and increase her incomes.‎
She decided to apply for loan and boost her business. She wants to purchase more antiques and new household supplies ‎to sell and improve her standards of living. She is very grateful to Kiva for the support.‎

loans.use: to purchase more antiques and new household supplies ‎to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 61 years old and married with grown-up children who are taking care of themselves. She works hard to provide for herself. She runs a business selling wax print clothing and frozen food in Chorkor, Accra. She has been selling wax print clothing and frozen food for 14 years.

Mary has requested a loan of 3,500 GHS through ID Ghana to buy more wax print clothing and frozen food to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from ID Ghana before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to take care of herself.

loans.use: to buy more wax print clothing and frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Jummai

texts.en:
Jummai is a maize farmer from Galadima toka village. As a Babban Gona member, Jummai is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Jummai would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Jummai can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Jummai no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Jummai hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Katupyry se formó en la ciudad de Itá,  es un grupo muy unido que trabaja ayudándose las unas a las otras, y de esa forma quieren poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Isabel, quien por medio de la venta de frutas se esfuerza por poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que con sacrificio y trabajo duro está logrando salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder  comprar frutas frescas y de estación, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, quiere comprar manzanas, peras, sandias, piñas y otras frutas.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry group was formed in the city of Itá. It is a very unified group in which the members work helping one another. In this way they want to help their loved ones. One of the members is Isabel who, through the sale of fruits, strives to be able to make a living in a dignified and honest manner.

She is a very hardworking woman who through sacrifice and hard work is managing to get ahead. She seeks this loan to be able to buy fresh fruit in season, in order to be able to continue with her sales. She wants to buy apples, pears, watermelons, pineapples and other fruits.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell such as apples, pears, watermelons, pineapples, among others.

loans.name: Gulshoda

texts.en:
Gulshoda is a capable and responsible woman. She cares for three children. She began working in a business sphere ten years ago with buying and selling wedding clothes. She reached a lot of goals. She is successful working in a business sphere.

She wants to satisfy the demand of her customers. She wants to enlarge her business and tries to renew the assortment of her goods. She is asking for a loan of 14,000 Somoni to buy wedding dresses for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Mistica es un grupo nuevo que se formó con la unión de amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Yessica, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante. Ella vende frutas, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas de todo tipo para poder venderlo y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mistica group is a new group that was formed when friends and neighbors of the city of San Lorenzo came together. They are participants in the poverty elimination program, and are trying to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Yessica. She is the president of the group and is a very hard-working woman. She always gives 100% of herself in order to grow and get ahead. She sells fruit, and with her sales, she has the means to be able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of all kinds of fruit, so she can sell it and continue to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 30-year-old married woman who has three young children. She is from Aloguinsan, Cebu. Her eldest child is 8, and her youngest is 1 year old.

For the past six months, she has been engaged in a multi-vitamins retailing business. In addition to that, she also sells frozen goods like ham, sausages, and hotdogs, in order to have supplemental income.

She would like to acquire additional funds to improve her yield. Unfortunately, at this time she has very limited capital. That is why she decided to request a loan from CEVI. In that way, she could be able to sell more volume of multi-vitamins products; thus, it will slowly improve her present living condition and would start to expand.

Christina is requesting a loan to invest in vitamins and purchase materials for house repair. That is very helpful for her family to have a comfortable home to live in.

loans.use: to invest in vitamins and purchase materials for house repair.

loans.name: Dufashanye Group

texts.en:
Stephanie is a group leader; aged 47. She is married with 6 children aged between 7 and 24 years. The group is called DUFATANYE which means “Let's help each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses,make more profits and have a better future.

Stephanie sells local drinks made out of banana and she has been running this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for making local drinks for sell. With the profits from the business she would like to renovate her house and to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more banana for making local drinks for sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of three children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.
	

For five years now, she has operated a lessos selling business, selling door to door to neighbours and friends. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase more stock of lessos for resale.
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of lessos for resale

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is mother of two children, aged 29 and is well trained in clothes making. She belongs to a middle class family and wants to support her family through her abilities. That is the main reason she has been running a small boutique to earn more income for the family support purpose. Her husband also support and encourage her profession.

Hina sews the cloth into unique and attractive dresses. Ladies of the surrounding area likes her dress collection a lot. That’s why her business is running very well, so Hina needs to purchase more cloth and sewing materials to increase her boutique business. For that she has requested for loan from KIVA through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva platform.

loans.use: to invest in her clothing boutique shop .

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is an amazing father who wants to provide a good life for his six children. He has a big family and they have a lot of needs, ‎but he works hard to ensure these are met and that the family is not in need of anything.

Kamal started a shop for upholstering furniture in 1990. Kamal is a very ‎ambitious man and he always strives to be the best – he works all week with no days off to earn more income.‎

Because of the high cost of living, Kamal has decided to expand his business. He applied for a loan to help him ‎do the expansion, to buy new tools to do upholstery padding, and to redecorate his shop.‎
Kamal needs your support to achieve his dreams.‎

loans.use: to expand and redecorate his shop, and to buy new tools to do upholstery padding.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yohanna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yohanna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yohanna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de San Ignacio, cada una de las integrantes de este grupo se unieron para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Andrea es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a ser manicurista, es muy buena en lo que hace y gracias a su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su servicio de manicura, como ser esmaltes, alicates, acetonas, limas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of San Ignacio. Each of the members of the group joined together to be able to grow and improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. Andrea is one of the members of the group. She works as a manicurist. She's very good at what she does, and thanks to her work she has the means to be able to support and give to her family a better quality of life.

She seeks this loan to buy supplies for her manicure service, such as nail polish, clippers, acetone and files, among other things. In this manner she will be able to continue on with with the work she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a manicure service, such as nail polish, clippers, acetone, and files, among other things.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres y de la fundación paraguaya.
La Sra. Claudia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la lavandería, tiene muchas ropas que ella lava a mano y también su máquina de lavar. Tiene muchos clientes que siempre le hace pedido de sus trabajos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de jabones en polvo, suavizante de ropas, lavandina y otros productos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the city of San Ignacio. They are united and supportive to one another. They work together on activities. They state that they are satisfied with and feel the support of the women's committee program and Fundación Paraguaya.

Claudia is one of the members of this group. She makes a living in the laundry business. She has a lot of clothing that she washes by hand, and also has a washing machine. She has a lot of customers who are always putting in orders for her work.

She is requesting this loan to buy powdered soaps, fabric softener, bleach and other products in order to continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy powdered soaps, fabric softener, bleach and other products in order to continue providing good customer service.

loans.name: Señoras Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo es nuevo, se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna quien se dedica al servicio de manicura, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le piden sus servicios, y así se hace cada día más conocida. Ella quiere seguir creciendo, es por ello que decidió unirse al grupo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar esmaltes, limas, alicates, pinzas y otros insumos para poder seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is new. It was formed in the city of San Lorenzo. These women came together to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones. They are in the program for the elimination of poverty, exerting themselves to be able to grow and get ahead.

One of the members is Señora Mirna, who works giving manicure services. She comments that she has many customers who always ask her for her services, and thus she becomes better known every day. She wants to continue growing. It is for that reason that she decided to join the group.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy nail polish, emery boards, trimmers, tweezers, and other supplies to be able to continue offering good service to her customers and in this way continuing to grow.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, emery boards, trimmers, tweezers, and other supplies for use in giving manicures.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
A 31 years old divorced mother of two, Sahar has been running her home based work since 2008 to provide her children with the necessary living needs and education expenses.
Sahar works as a hair dresser, she is well known in her region with her special talents and skills in her domain, in addition to her customer service.

She is working hard to develop her business as much as she can, that's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase new released beauty products and tools to develop her business in a well managed way.
Sahar hopes that in the future she can open her separate beauty salon outside her house and provide both her children and customers the privacy they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase new released beauty products and tools to develop her business in a well managed way. .

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 28-year-old, Married man from Gaza city, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Alaa' has a laundry and dry cleaning business in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Alaa' took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new machine drying clothes with steam. He hopes that this new tool will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to open a second branch.

loans.use: to buy a new machine drying clothes with steam.

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Esperanza 3 ” está en su 6º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Miguela, quien tiene una despensa en su propia casa, ella con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido mejorando su negocio y es por medio de él que ayuda a su familia. Miguela es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y es por ello que se unió a este grupo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser: verduras, carne, panificados, bebidas, y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group "La Eperanza 3" is in its sixth loan cycle in the women's committee program, where all the women work in the program for eliminating poverty, exerting themselves to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the members is Señora Miguela, who has a grocery store in her own house. With much effort and sacrifice, she has been improving her business, and it is through it that she helps her family. Miguela is a very hard-working woman who wants to improve her living conditions, and it is for this that she joined this group.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies for her store, such as vegetables, meat, baked goods, beverages, and other products, in such a way that she will be able to continue satisfying her customers.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for her store, such as vegetables, meat, baked goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a caring mother of five children; she is 38 years old and lives in Baqaa with her family in a small house. Rania is ‎working hard to become a productive woman, but she did not find a good job opportunity because she did not complete her ‎education.

Rania decided to open her own business, and started selling computer hardware to increase her income. She ‎started with a low quantity of hardware, and now she wants to expand her business and buy more hardware such as ‎cases, mouses, keyboards and monitors to sell, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she applied for a loan to ‎help her buy what she needs and increase her income.

Rania decided to save money and open a computer hardware ‎shop in the near future.‎

loans.use: to buy more computer hardware such as mouses, cases, keyboards, and monitors to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 30 years old, he lives in a small town in Irbid northern Jordan, which affected by the Syrian conflict since where ‎they live and work is close to the Syrian border where it had a lot of refugees coming in Irbid cities and start competing with ‎the locals on jobs, for that Ahmad opened his own business to be able to cover his needs and help his father in the ‎household expenses.

He opened a shop which sells food supplies and hot drinks as Nescafe, coffee and hot chocolate. ‎Ahmad is ambitious and hard worker guy and he wants to save money and complete his education to be able find good ‎work with good salary.‎

loans.use: to expand his shop and buy food supplies and coffee to develop his business

loans.name: Hayarpi

texts.en:
Hayarpi is 34 years old and she lives with her lovely family in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region of Armenia.  She is married and has two sons.  Her husband works at the city police station. 

Hayarpi graduated from the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute with the faculty of Biochemistry.  For 10 years she has worked at the school as a biology teacher.  She is a very patient and clever pedagogue, greatly respected in the school by her colleagues as well as her pupils.  Hayarpi also gives private courses preparing the pupils for entrance exams.  

Hayarpi mentions that she feels very responsible for the achievements and hardships of her pupils, and she does her best to help and encourage them.  She requested this loan of 500,000 AMD to purchase a computer and professional literature for her pedagogical development activities.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and professional literature for her pedagogical development activities.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a first time borrower who is a resident of Gayaza. He owns a company where he builds houses and rents it to people. He has approached UGAFODE for financing to complete one of his recently built houses. He has applied for a loan of UGX3,000,000 which will help him buy construction materials to complete his house. There is no problem offering it to him, given his good character and public reputation.

loans.use: to complete his house.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bitrus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Bitrus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Bitrus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 40-year-old lady, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

She is involved in a vegetable-selling business in a small market in her locality. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock of vegetables and move her business to a better location. This will enable her to meet her customers' demands; hence increase her income. She will use the anticipated income to provide food and clothes and pay education fees for her children.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to add stock to her vegetable-selling business and meet customers' demands; hence have more income to cater for household expenses such as food, clothing, and education fees.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Some years back she was hardly managing her household activities with the small income of her husband. Then through loans from Kashf Foundation she has initiated her business of hand embroidery. Majeedan is a 60 years old, married woman. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town.

She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Majeedan closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits

loans.name: Roukaya

texts.en:
Roukaya is a 27-year-old married mother of two, who works in souvenir designs, production and sales from her house to support her husband who works as a driver.
She has four years of experience in her domain, since she used to work in a nursery and got the necessary experience.

A year ago, Roukaya decided to start her own home based business hoping that one day she can open her own separate working place in the future. Since her business is developing, Roukaya is intending to make her working place wider and easily to work in, that's why she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to enclose her balcony to make it her own workshop so that she can organize her products properly and develop her production.
She very optimistic about this loan and hopes that in the future she can open her own retail shop.

loans.use: to enclose her balcony to make it her own workshop so that she can organize her products properly and develop her production .

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman and a mother of one child not in school because he is still young, she’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
 
She owns a food cafe which she has operated for seven years, selling from home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from fellows in the same business and her aspirations are to expand her business and also open another business like a wholesale shop in the near future.

Mwanarusi is borrowing this loan to buy food stuff for her cafe during the coming festive season. She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.
She joined Yehu to have access to loans which will help in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy food stuff for her cafe during the coming festive season

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is 30 years old and a married woman. She is very kind and responsible. Mervat lives with her family in ‎Baqaa. She is a careful mother of 3 children who are all non-adults. Mervat always tries for the well-being of her ‎children. 

She began her business with the buying and selling of women's clothes and blankets because she needed the ‎money. Mervat buys women's clothes in bulk and retails in her home. She periodically renews the assortment of her goods. ‎

Now she is going to buy women's and children's clothes and blankets for the new season. Because of that, she applied for ‎a loan. She awaits your mercy.‎

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes and blankets for the new season.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
It was hard for Parveen to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Parveen is a 40 years old, married woman and mother of 4 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Parveen has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
This young, handsome man is 23 years old and his name is Narek. He graduated Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute in the faculty of Economics. Narek lives with his grandmother in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. His parents are abroad temporally. 

Narek rents a space which he properly refurnished, making it into a comfortable café. He also separated a place where people can play billiards. Narek is a beginner businessman in this sphere, but he is a very clever and resourceful young man.  He already manages to have a lot of customers, especially in the winter period, since his café is warm, comfortable and hospitable for all his customers. 

Narek also does the accounts for his café. He is asking for this loan of 250.000 Armenian drams to purchase a computer in order to do the accounts more quickly and easily.

loans.use: to purchase a computer in order to do the accounts for his café more quickly and easily.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia was not satisfied with the quality of education the schools were providing and thought that she could open a school. Sadia started her school in 2012.

Currently her school has 283 students; more than 51% female students are enrolled. Every day she would be dedicated enough to create an environment where children would learn well. With so much interest in her school, Sadia had to borrow PKR 100,000 to improve school infrastructure and enable an inclusive and comfortable environment.

She hopes that she will create a nurturing atmosphere to encourage even more students to attend.

loans.use: to improve the school infrastructure and enable an inclusive and comfortable environment.

loans.name: Rebeccah

texts.en:
Rebeccah is a woman who has been engaged in selling maize and millet for 12 years to earn a living. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children, ages 15, 13, and 5 years old. Her husband works hard as a carpenter to raise their family.

Aside from selling maize and millet, Rebeccah also sells vegetables. With this, she is in need of an amount to help her run her business continuously. She will buy food stock such as millet, maize, and vegetables to meet her buyers' expectations.

In the future, Rebeccah is aiming for business improvement to uplift their livelihood and to be able to give good education to their children.

"With loyalty and determination, I will work harder for the repayment as the term and conditions applied," she says.

loans.use: to buy food stock such as millet, maize, and vegetables to meet her buyers' expectations.

loans.name: Eteri

texts.en:
Eteri is 51 years old, and she lives with her single daughter in Stepanavan City of Lori region. Eteri graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, faculty of mathematics.

For already 20 years, she has worked at the school as a teacher of mathematics, and simultaneously at her house she gives paid private courses of the same subject, preparing the pupils for the entrance exams. Eteri’s daughter, like her mother, is a pedagogue, and she also works at the school as a teacher of English language and literature.

Eteri requests this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, as she will buy a computer and also some new professional literature. This purchase is very important for her, since she is always eager to be busy with self-development activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also some new professional literature.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Like many women, financial constraints played as a potent factor in encouraging Nasreen to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan.
