loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. Razia is a motivated mother of eight children. She is liable for providing them with good quality food, health and clothing.

For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a 42-year-old, married woman with four children. With her eagerness to help her husband, she managed to establish a small store in the city of Chorkor Chemunaa, where she sells fruits. She generates a very good income, which supports her children’s school fees and food for the household.

Matilda needs a loan to buy mangoes, bananas, apples, pineapples, oranges and other fruits to attend to buyers' demand.

Her greatest dream is to own a much bigger fruit store and sell on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, bananas, apples, pineapples, oranges and other fruits to attend to buyers' demand.

loans.name: Monariya Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de vida de cada una y de esa forma poder mejorarla.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Idalina quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, ella comenta que ya tiene mucha clientele que siempre le hace muchos pedidos, y gracias a eso tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This women's group is in their third series of the program, where they all work and help each other to be successful. They are doing a survey to aid in the elimination of poverty, as a means of knowing the situation of life of each person and in this way they can be able to improve it.

One of the members is Idalina who makes a living selling all kinds of clothing. She says that she already has many customers that always have orders to place, and thanks to this she has the means to support her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various items to sell, and in this way she can continue to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase various items to sell.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
Shaista is 27 years old, married and a mother of four children. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children.

That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shaista hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a hardworking lady. She initiated her business selling milk as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband. She is a 55-year-old married woman. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Zubaida’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Zubaida has requested 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers in order to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers in order to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen, 56 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Parveen needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 61-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their client children.

Recently, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers and generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Ravshanbek

texts.ru: Равшанбек живет в Шахритуском районе. Ему 69 лет. Работал инженером. Однако последнее 10 лет он занимается сельским хозяйством,  а именно выращиванием и сбором пшеницы.  Жена Равшанбека занимается бизнесом. Сын находится на заработках в России. Равшанбеку в его деле помогает его невестка. Равшанбек работает не покладая рук, чтобы обеспечить семью всем необходимым. В данный момент Равшанбек нуждается в Вашей помощи, так как ему не хватает средств на покупку семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива. Он очень верит, что Вы ему поможете. Спасибо.
texts.en:
Ravshanbek lives in the Shahrituz region, and is 69 years old. He worked as an engineer. However, for the last 10 years he has done agricultural work, specifically growing and harvesting wheat. Ravshanbek's wife has a business, and his son is working in the Russian Federation. Ravshanbek's daughter-in-law helps Ravshanbek with his work.

Ravshanbek works without ceasing so that he can provide his family with all the necessities. At the moment, he needs your help, as he does not have the funds to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, and fuel. He believes that you will help him. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Exequila

texts.en: Exequila  is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is in agricultural business farming rice in her community. This business help so that she will not buy rice and mainly food for her family. She also earn a profit upon her sales of rice. Close to her home is also a barn that house her pigs. This also bring in additional income for her household. This business is like a pillar for 28 years when it comes to the needs of her family. Exequila is asking for a loan to buy feed and piglets that she can add to her barn. In the future, Exequila hopes to manage and save enough to send her children to College.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 48 years old, married woman and a mother of 3 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. Sakina aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children. 

She has had a café business for 5 years. She will be using the loan to purchase food products to her cafe to be cooked in larger amount so as to increase her production, like beans, maize, vegetables, potatoes, rice and cooking materials.

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and to repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase  more food products to her cafe  to be cooked in larger amount so as to increase her production, like beans, maize, vegetables, potatoes, rice and cooking materials.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a married woman and has been running her beauty parlor for the past three years now. She does her job passionately and professionally . She knows the techniques of makeup and hair styling and is a well-known beautician in her town. Kiran is a responsible mother of three children and is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses meet. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of her husband.

Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams,investing in her parlor . The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently and effectively.She is obliged to the Kiva team and it's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her beauty parlor services business.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yusif has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Yusif would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yusif can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Yusif will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yusif is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 37 years old, married with 5 children all in schooling.

Cecilia operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) to help her husband a Jeepney driver to generate an income to provide for her family needs and her children school expenses.

Cecilia started selling groceries in front of her house with just the basic items like biscuits, sugar, coffee, candies and snack foods while taking care of her children.

Cecilia has been SEED partner for 5 years and through time and hard work her store as of today is earning PhP 2,000-2,500 daily and the income helps a lot with the schooling of all her children.

Cecilia is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 35,000 to buy 3 boxes of canned goods, 3 dozen shampoos, 30 kilos of sugar and as other items to sell in her store.

Cecilia is hoping to expand her store and hire a helper to help her operate the store as she plans on putting an eatery beside her store.

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of canned goods, 3 dozen shampoos, 30 kilos of sugar and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer from Jangefe village. As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Rabiu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rabiu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Rabiu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Hellena, who is in early 40's is single with three schooling children.She has been a food vendor since for six years. She works from mid day to 11 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Hellena requested her 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock the out-of-stock items, to buy cooking oil and to add on the sacks of charcoal. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and was able to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay loans, pay her employees who serve people, reinvest in her business, and cover household expenses. She dreams of opening another food business in a different area. 

Hellena will share this loan with her loan group EBENEZA, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 36 years old married to Anthony and blessed with three children aged between 12 and 1 years old.She has been into dairy farming business for ten years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.11,000.This being her first loan with VFK,she intends to buy materials for her dairy shed expansion as she anticipates to help her husband who is a tea farmer in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

loans.use: to expand and improve the dairy shed for her cows.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 32 years old and he lives in his native city Sevan in Gegharkunik region. Here Arman lives with his large family; he lives with his wife, two children and his parents. Arman is farming and as an additional source of income he does different hired constructional works in his city. Mainly being engaged in farming he takes care of cows, a calf, sheep and lambs in his farm. So Arman rather profitably organizes his farm’s meat sale such as beef and mutton who buy from him butchers of his city.

Arman with new plans of cattle breeding development in his farm now relies on Kiva support. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams he asks for the purchase of one more cow for his farm and also a lot of fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of one more cow for his farm and also a lot of fodder for his all farm cattle

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice is 65 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. 

Phanice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Phanice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Phanice's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Burambagira School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ezron. He is the Head Teacher of Burambagira SS School, a mixed School in the rural area of Bundibugyo in with 650 students. Burambagira SS School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining UV water and Tulip filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the schools money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV and Tulip Filtration water treatment systems with 450 litre tank and 5 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Burambagira SS School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ezron ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: For six years now Bridget is engaged in buying and selling underwear and slippers in the city of chorkor. She is a single parent with one child, She is doing this to provide the needs of her four-year-old son. Bridget’s future plan is to have clothing stall to display her underwear and slippers. In this way, she will be able to improve her sales to augment her livelihood. Now, she needs an amount for additional capital to buy more cloth to sell that will increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sell that will increase her profit.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo is a married woman with one kid, not in school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is stock purchases.

Momo operates a vegetables selling stall, she sells from home to the general public.
She faces a challenge of working capital. He dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

With the loan of Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more stock of green vegetables for resale in order to expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne is 38 years old and has 5 children. She has been a farmer for 10 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Carolyne is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Carolyne started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2012, and decided to do so because she wanted to make more farmer friends in her community. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Carolyne’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Elshadai De Silmissin Group

texts.fr: Elshadaï de Silmissin vient de finir son 2ème prêt KIVA. Les remboursements ont été fait normalement. Marthe, membre représentatif remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs de Kiva pour le soutien avec le prêt, Marthe à pu acheter les mèches, les gammes de pommades et enfin assurer les dépenses pour la coiffure. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer des habits pour ses enfants, de faire quelques dépenses de la famille, payer la scolarité des enfants et surtout d'augmenter les activités. Marthe a encore besoin d'un prêt pour continuer son activité. Contrairement aux 5 ème prêt  cette fois ci elle a diminué son prêt car elle a pu économiser un de peu de son bénéfice et veut ajouter au nouveau prêt pour continuer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité
texts.en: The Elshadaï de Silmissin Group recently finished repaying its second KIVA loan. The group had no problem paying back the loan. Marthe, the group's representative, extends her thanks to KIVA staff and lenders for supporting her with a loan, which she used to buy hair extensions and hair gels and cover her salon's other expenses. Her earnings allowed her to buy clothes for her children and send them to school, pay for her household expenses, and strengthen her business. Marthe is applying for another loan to help support her salon. This time she is requesting a smaller loan, as the previous one allowed her to save some of her earnings. The loan will help her to continue her business activities.

loans.use: to buy 10,000 CFA francs worth of hair extensions and wigs.

loans.name: Paspanga Djantoli Group

texts.fr: Paspanga de Djantoli vient de finir son 2ème prêt KIVA. Les remboursements ont été fait normalement. Fatimata, membre représentatif remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs de Kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Fatimata avait pu payer des habits d'enfants et des draps pour vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer des habits pour ses enfants, de faire quelques dépenses pour sa famille et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Fatimata a encore besoin d'un crédit pour continuer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en: The Paspanga de Djantoli Group recently completed its second KIVA loan contract, with all payments made on time. Fatima, the group's representative, extends her thanks to all the KIVA staff members and lenders for their support. The previous loan allowed her to buy clothes for her children, cover her family's expenses and grow her business. Fatimata is applying for another loan, which will help her to raise her earnings and continue strengthening her business activities.

loans.use: to buy 200,000 CFA francs worth of children's clothes and bed sheets.

loans.name: Noure Group

texts.fr: NOURE vient de finir son 1er prêt kiva. Le remboursement a été fait normalement. Alizèta, membre représentatif du groupe remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs de kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Alizèta avait pu payer du bissap, du zinzimbre et airtel monnaie pour vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer les frais de scolarité des enfants, de contribuer aux dépenses familiales et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Alizèta a encore besoin de prêt pour continuer son activité. Contrairement au 1er prêt, cette fois ci au Burkina, le prix du bissap et du zinzimbre est très moins cher après les récoltes donc Alizèta pourra en acheter pour stocker et revendre. Elle va aussi faire du airtel monnaie afin d'avoir un bénéfice. Al'issue de ses ventes on bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Noure Group has just finished its first Kiva loan, which was repaid in full. Alizèta, who is the representative of the group, thanks all the staff and Kiva lenders for their support. With the loan, Alizèta had to pay for bissap (a drink made from hibiscus flowers), ginger and Airtel currency (for cellphones) to sell. She made a profit which enabled her to pay her children's school fees, to contribute to the family's expenses and, above all, to expand her business. She still needs to borrow to continue her business. In contrast to the first loan, this time round in Burkina, the price of bissap and ginger is a lot cheaper after the harvest, and thus Alizèta can buy enough to stock up and resell. She is also going to sell Airtel currency to make a profit. The profits she makes from her sales will allow her to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy bissap (a drink made from hibiscus flowers), ginger and Airtel currency (for cellphones).

loans.name: Andrelle

texts.fr: Andrelle a 41 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère d’un enfant. Elle revend des chaussures au marché public de son quartier. Elle a déjà bénéficié de microcrédits au moyen de quoi elle a fait avancer son activité. Elle demande un nouveau prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Andrelle is 41 years old, divorced and mother to one child. She sells shoes at the public market in her district. She has already benefited from microloans, which have enabled her to develop her business, and she is asking for a new loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado mujeres solidarias está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo, integrado por 12 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
La señora Nilda se dedica a la venta de ropas que lo realiza diariamente desde muy tempranas horas casa por casa, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que por medio de su sacrificio y lucha está ayudando a sus seres queridos. Nilda comenta que se unió a este grupo para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de esa manera continuar ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans, y otras prendas y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group of dedicated women is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group made up of twelve women, all very hardworking and enterprising. They wish to improve their own and their families' standard of living.

Sra. Nilda earns her living selling clothing, a job she does daily going from house to house in the early hours of the morning. She is a very hardworking woman who, through sacrifice and struggle, is helping her loved ones. She says that she joined the group in order to have the opportunity to improve her standard of living and be able to continue helping her family.

Nilda is seeking a loan to buy more clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans etc. Then she will be able to fulfil her customers' requests.

loans.use: buy more clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans etc.

loans.name: Dieuna

texts.fr: Dieuna a 29 ans. Elle est commerçante. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques. Cela fais quatre ans qu’elle mène cette activité. Elle est à la recherche d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Dieuna is 29 years old and a trader. She sells cosmetics and has been exercising this activity for four years. She is looking for a microloan so she can increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Joanem

texts.fr: Joanem est propriétaire d’un dépôt de boissons gazeuses. Elle revend les boissons par caisses. Avec l’appui financier qu’il a déjà reçu, il a fait beaucoup de progrès dans son activité. Il veut continuer à développer son activité, et demande un crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Joanem is the owner of a store, which sells sodas. He sells the drinks by crate. With the financial aid he has already received, he has managed to make significant progress in his business. He would like to continue to develop it and is asking for a loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda.

loans.name: Claudel

texts.fr: Claudelle est pâtissier.  Il n’est pas marié et n’a pas d’enfant. Il prépare des boissons par fermentation chez lui. Ensuite, il les revend à des particuliers. C’est ainsi qu’il gagne sa vie depuis plusieurs années. Il veut augmenter son stock d’ingrédients pour augmenter sa production à l’occasion des fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en: Claudelle is a pastry chef. He is not married and does not have any children. He prepares fermented drinks at his home then sells them to private individuals. This is how he has been earning his living for several years. He would like to increase his stock of ingredients so that he can increase his production for the end of year celebrations.

loans.use: to increase his stock.

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
El Sr Wilfrido tiene 52 años, está casado con la Sra. Maria hace más de 15 años, él es una persona muy trabajadora y servicial tiene una gallinería y producción de Huevos.
Es una persona muy querida en su ciudad ya que es una persona de bien y muy servicial. Con mucho sacrificio ha salido adelante y mantiene a su familia.
Comenta que su mayor sueño es que su negocio crezca cada día más para que pueda emplear a más personas. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus gallinas y de esa forma poder seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
52-year old Sr. Wilfrido has been married to Sra. Maria for more than 15 years. He is a very hardworking and obliging person. He has a flock of chickens which produce eggs for him to sell.

Wilfrido is well-liked in the town as he is an upstanding and helpful citizen. With much effort he has managed to help his family get ahead. He says that his greatest wish is to see his business grow so that he can employ more people.

He is seeking a loan to buy nutritious feed for the chickens so that he can continue his business.

loans.use: buy nutritious feed for the chickens

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra.  Patricia tiene un hijo, desde muy joven tuvo la difícil tarea de criarlo. Primeramente se dedicó a las artesanías   y comercializaba ella misma en la zona, proveía a vendedores ambulantes.
Tiene también una despensa donde vende todo tipo de productos, es una mujer muy sacrificada que pese a las adversidades no se deja vencer.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de calzados deportivos para la venta, de manera a implementar un negocio mas.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia has a son. She was very young when he was born and it has been a difficult job to raise him. She earns her living primarily from crafts which she herself sold in the area as well as supplying street merchants. Patricia also has a small store where she sells all kinds of products. She is a hardworking person who doesn't let problems get in her way.

Patricia is seeking a loan to buy sports shoes to sell and in this way grow her business.

loans.use: buy sports shoes to sell

loans.name: Betilia

texts.fr: Betilia est âgée de 33 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants. Son activité est une petite entreprise de restauration. Elle prépare et vend de la nourriture tous les jours aux passants de son quartier.  Elle est très dévouée pour faire progresser cette activité. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des sacs de riz, de la farine et des épices.
texts.en: Betilia is 33 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. She has a small restauration company, preparing and selling food every day to passers-by in her neighborhood. She is very committed to developing this business and is requesting a loan to buy sacks of rice, flour and spices.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, flour and spices.

loans.name: Jean Fanel

texts.fr: Jean Farnel a 38 ans. Il vit en union libre et a 2 enfants qui sont scolarisés. Cela fait 10 ans depuis qu’il vend des produits divers au marché de son quartier. Jeune et dévoué commerçant, Jean Farnel ne ménage pas ses efforts pour pour gagner un maximum grâce à son activité. Son commerce lui est d’un grand soutien face aux nombreuses responsabilités de sa famille. Il est à son deuxième crédit chez Palmis. Il veut agrandir davantage son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Tenant compte des demandes de sa clientèle, il a sollicité un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Jean Farnel is 38 years old and lives in a common-law marriage; he has two children who are at school. For the past ten years he has been selling a variety of products at the market in his neighborhood. He is a young and devoted trader and makes every effort to earn as much money as he can from his activity. His business is a great support given the numerous family responsibilities he has. He is on his second loan from Palmis. He would like to expand his business and provide better living conditions for himself.  Given his customer demand, he is requesting a microloan to increase his stock of goods.

loans.use: to increase his stock.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and married with three children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Myrna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselore

texts.fr: Roselaure est une commerçante très connue dans son quartier. Cela fait plus de 15 ans depuis qu’elle vend des produits alimentaires à ses riverains. Elle vend du riz, du sucre, de la farine, des boissons gazeuses et beaucoup d’autres produits alimentaires. Grace aux revenus gagnés sur cette activité, elle a pu envoyer ses enfants à l’école et bien nourrir sa famille. Son rêve est de développer ce commerce pour en tirer plus de bénéfices. Elle compte épargner un peu d’argent pour envoyer ses enfants à l’université.
texts.en: Roselaure is a very well-known trader in her neighborhood and has been selling groceries to the locals for more than 15 years. She sells rice, sugar, flour, sodas and many other groceries. Thanks to the income she has earned from this business, she has been able to send her children to school and feed her family well. Her dream is to develop this business and make more money. She is planning to save a little money so she can send her children to university.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Marketalia Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Marketalia es un grupo unido con 19 integrantes, todas ellas demuestran interés y entusiasmo por el programa de comité de mujeres y con los trabajos que lleva a cabo con ellas la fundación paraguaya. 
Entre estas señoras trabajadoras se destaca a la Sra. Ninfa, quien es muy emprendedora y creativa, se dedica a la cría animales, fabrica y vende queso, y otras actividades variadas del campo, a través de las cuales ayuda a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Ninfa pide este préstamo para la compra de animales variados para la cría, de manera a poder seguir con su emprendimiento, y mejorando sus ingresos a la vez para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee is called Marketalia. It is a united group with 19 members. All of them show interest and enthusiasm for the women's committee program and the work Fundación Paraguaya [Paraguayan Foundation] does with them.

Among these lady workers stands out Ninfa, who is very enterprising and creative. She makes a living breeding animals, making and selling cheese, and various other field occupations through which she helps her family by giving them what they need.

Ninfa is requesting this loan for the purchase of various animals for breeding, with means to be able to continue with her endeavor and improve her revenues at the same time to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for breeding.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 59 years old, married and has five children. 

Ma. Luz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Luz has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 39 years old and married with three children.  With all three children in school, Lanie works very hard to provide for them.

Lanie has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Lanie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future Lanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Delfa

texts.en:
Ma. Delfa is 55 years old, married with seven children.  

Ma. Delfa is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Ma. Delfa requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

Ma. Delfa has been farming bananas for eleven years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Delfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Marie Adelcia

texts.fr: Marie Adelcia a 46 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a 5 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Cela fait déjà 10 ans qu’elle commercialise des produits alimentaires au marché de son quartier. Marie Adelcia désire agrandir son commerce et pouvoir investir davantage dans l’éducation de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un microcrédit afin d’augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Marie Adelcia is 46 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with five children, all of whom are at school. She has been selling groceries at the market in her neighborhood for the past ten years. Marie Adelcia would like to expand her business and invest more in her children's education. She is requesting a microloan to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis tiene 19 años y vive en San Pedro de Uraba. Tiene un centro de belleza donde realiza cortes de cabello y vende productos de belleza. Hace 4 años comenzó con su negocio con el fin de brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro. Espera que pueda mejorar sus ventas aumentando sus clientes, para así lograr más ganancias. Sueña con comprar su casa propia y pagar la educación de sus hijos. 

Pide un préstamo para comprar productos de belleza y mejorar el local donde presta su servicio.
texts.en:
Luis is nineteen years old and lives in San Pedro de Uraba. He runs a barber shop where he cuts hair and sells hair products. He started his business four years ago with the goal of providing his family with a better future. He hopes to increase his income by attracting more clients.

Luis's greatest wishes are to buy a house of his own and pay for his children's education. He is seeking a loan to buy more grooming products and improve the salon.

loans.use: buy more grooming products and improve the salon

loans.name: Claircia

texts.fr: Clairicia, 51 ans, est veuve. Elle a cinq enfants dont deux ont déjà fondé leur foyer. Elle revend des chaussures et vêtements usagés. Cela fait sept ans qu’elle mène cette activité. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Claircia is a 51-year-old widow. She has five children, two of whom have already set up their own households. She sells shoes and second-hand clothing and has been doing this for seven years. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy a stock of shoes.

loans.name: Pedro Nel

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 37 años y vive en el municipio de San Pedro de Uraba. Hace 6 años comenzó un negocio de cría de peces con el cual ha logrado sostener a su familia y salir adelante. Trabaja arduamente para que su negocio sea exitoso y poder alcanzar sus objetivos, como aumentar sus clientes y sus ganancias. Su sueño más grande es poder brindar a su familia una buena calidad de vida, y espera pronto comprar su casa propia para darle un hogar a sus hijos y su familia.

Pide un préstamo para comprar alimento para peces y mejorar los estanques dondde los cría.
texts.en:
Pedro is 37 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro de Uraba. Six years ago, he started a fish breeding business with which he has managed to sustain his family and move forward. He works hard to make his business successful and be able to achieve his objectives, such as increasing his customer base and his profits. His biggest dream is to be able to give his family a good quality of life, and hopes to buy his own house soon to give a home to his children and his family.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy food for fish and improve the ponds where he breeds them.

loans.use: to buy food for fish and improve the ponds where he breeds them.

loans.name: King Of Kings Fortportal School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jane. She is the Head Teacher of King of Kings School, a mixed school in the urban area of Fort Portal with 600 students. King of Kings School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will, therefore, save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

King of Kings School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jane ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Shalom School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Stanly. He is the Director of Shalom Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Fort Portal district with 220 students. Shalom Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will, therefore, save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a Tulip Filtration water treatment system, with 5 sets of 20 litre buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Shalom Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Stanly ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Magaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Magaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Magaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Magaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Magaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yohanna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yohanna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Yohanna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sure Gates School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Bruno. He is the Head Teacher of Sure Gates School, a mixed school in the urban area of Matugga with 300 students. Sure Gates School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Sure Gates School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Bruno ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mirembe P. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Magdalene. She is the Director of Mirembe Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Mukono with 400 students. Mirembe Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mirembe Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Magdalene ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Fortportal S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Isaac. He is the Proprietor of Fort Portal S. School, a mixed school in the urban area of Fort Portal with 1,400 students. Fort Portal S. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining UV water and Tulip filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the schools money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV and Tulip Filtration water treatment systems with a 1,000 litre tank and 5 sets of 20 litre Buckets, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Fort Portal S. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Isaac ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Deyniss

texts.es:
Deyniss continúa estudiando la carrera profesional de administración de empresas. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar una computadora portátil para seguir estudiando, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio de cotillones tuvo buenas ventas. Actualmente finalizó el primer año de sus estudios y con su nueva computadora puede conectarse a internet y realizar sus deberes sin problemas además administra su negocio de forma que no interfiera con sus actividades escolares, “mi negocio es propio y me doy tiempo para estudiar mientras atiendo las ventas…” comenta. Ambas actividades son exitosas porque aplica los conocimientos que aprende en la universidad en su pequeño negocio. La ventaja de sus actividades es que ordena el tiempo para realizar ambas, la desventaja es que tiene que viajar para comprar mercadería y muchas veces no cuenta con suficiente mercadería. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar para ejercer su profesión, ella desea comprar una impresora multifunción para imprimir sus tareas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a ambas actividades. 
Es por esos motivos que Deyniss solicita un préstamo para comprar una impresora multifunción para imprimir sus tareas finales antes de graduarse.
texts.en:
Deyniss continues studying for a professional degree in business administration. She used the loan she received to buy a laptop computer to continue studying. The payment of her fees was on time because her business selling party favors had good sales. She currently finished the first year of her studies, and with her new computer she can connect to the Internet and do her homework without any problems. She also runs her business in a way that does not interfere with her school activities. "It is my own business and I give myself time to study while I take care of sales..." she says. Both activities are successful because she applies the knowledge that she learns at university to her small business.
The advantage of her activities is that she organizes the time to do both. The disadvantage is that she has to travel to buy merchandise and many times does not have enough merchandise.
Her dream is to finish her studies to practice her profession. She wishes to buy a multi-functional printer to print her homework. In the five years she has been doing both activities, this is the second sequence of loans with the institution.
It is for these reasons that Deyniss asks for a loan to buy a multi-functional printer to print her final homework before graduating.

loans.use: to buy a multi-functional printer to print her final school homework before graduating.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jacqueline tiene 36 años de edad y en cinco años ha establecido una pulpería a base de su propio esfuerzo y deseos de superación, solamente con el apoyo de MiCrédito y Kiva.
Entre las labores que le exige su pulpería, tales como ir a comprar los productos para surtir su venta y atender a los clientes como solo ella lo sabe hacer, también es esposa y madre de dos hijos. 
Poco a poco ha logrado abastecerse de mercadería agregada como ropa, cosméticos, accesorios  y otros artículos que normalmente se comercializan en la pulpería como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, productos de higiene personal y del hogar.
Este préstamo, planea invertirlo y comprar abarrotes, enlatados para las cenas navideñas  y productos como ropa, zapatos y más cosméticos que los clientes buscan en la temporada para realizar obsequios. Jacqueline afirma que su  negocio cubre sus gastos diarios, pero que siempre es necesario invertir y eso solo le logra a través de las financieras.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 36 years old, and in five years has established a small grocery store on the basis of her own effort and desire to improve, solely with the support of MiCredito and Kiva.
Among the tasks that the store requires, she has to buy the products to stock her store, and to look after her clients in the way that only she knows how. She is also a wife and mother of two children.
Little by little she has managed to stock her store with merchandise, such as clothing, cosmetics, accessories, and other items that are normally sold in the grocery store, such as: rice, beans, oil, and personal hygiene and home products.
She plans to invest this loan and to buy groceries and canned products for Christmas dinners, and products such as clothing, shoes, and more cosmetics that clients are looking for in the season of gift-giving.
Jacqueline confirms that her business covers her daily expenses, but that it is always necessary to invest, and that she will only achieve this through financing.

loans.use: to buy groceries and canned products for Christmas dinners, and products such as clothing, shoes, and more cosmetics.

loans.name: Norah Cheptoo

texts.en:
Norah is 38 years old. She is married to Julius and blessed with three children aged between 12 and 8 years old. She has been involved in a dairy farming business for over eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 16,000.

This being her first loan with VFK, she intends to buy dairy feeds and dewormers for her animals. She anticipates helping her husband to pay school fees for their children from the expanded business profits. Her dream is to be self sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds for her cows.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old, married to Carolyne and blessed with six children aged between 13 and 4 years old.

He has been involved in a dairy farming business for twenty years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This being his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, he intends to purchase feeds for his dairy cows.

With the anticipated profits, Joseph will be able to save and pay fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Marie Erina

texts.fr: Marie Erina est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Depuis tantôt 5 ans, elle vend des légumes. Elle vient d’intégrer Palmis et s’attend à beaucoup de changements au niveau de son activité. Elle veut agrandir son commerce et pouvoir investir dans les études de son enfant. Elle demande un microcrédit chez Palmis pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Marie Erina is 57 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. For 15 years, she has sold vegetables.

Marie Erina has just joined Palmis and is hoping for many changes to the level of her business. She wants to expand and be able to invest in her child's education.

Marie Erina is seeking this micro-loan with Palmis to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village. As a Babban Gona member, Mathew is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Mathew can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mathew no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mathew hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom has successfully built her business of a small general store in her community for many years. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business.

Kalsoom makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make stock available for her customers.

In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Kalsoom wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Isiyaku can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isiyaku no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Isiyaku hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marie Yolette

texts.fr: Yolette a 35 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a cinq enfants. Elle revend des légumes et des haricots. Cette activité lui permet de gagner un peu d’argent pour prendre soin de sa famille. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Yolette is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and has five children. She works selling vegetables and beans.

This business allows her to earn a little money to take care of her family.

Yolette needs this loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy sacs of beans.

loans.name: Missoule

texts.fr: Missoule est âgée de 34 ans.  Elle vit avec son compagnon et leurs trois enfants.  Elle revend des produits alimentaires au marché public de son quartier. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des caisses de saumon et des sacs de spaghetti.
texts.en:
Missoule is 34 years old. She lives with her partner and their three children. She works selling food products at a local public market in her area.

Missoule is seeking this loan to buy cases of salmon and bags of pasta.

loans.use: to buy cases of salmon and bags of pasta.

loans.name: Marie Lynda  Desilus

texts.fr: Marie Lynda est propriétaire d’une boutique de produits alimentaires à son domicile. Elle y vend des boissons alcoolisées et non alcoolisées, du riz, de la farine, du sucre, etc. Elle cherche un prêt pour augmenter son stock afin d’accroître son chiffre  de vente pour les fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Marie Lynda is the owner of a small grocery store, that she runs from her home. She sells alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, rice, flour, sugar, etc.

Marie Lynda is seeking this loan to increase her stock, as a way to increase her sales and [to prepare] for the end of the year festivities.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Famille Muzingwa Group

texts.fr: Il y a maintenant 7 ans que Kabesha exerce la culture de tomates avec sa famille, activité qu'ils ont appris grâce à un familier. Cette activité aide beaucoup Kabesha, à l'exemple de la saison passée où ils ont réalisé un résultat de cent soixante-dix dollars malgré les difficultés liées à l'absence de l'eau, des produits phytosanitaires et des maladies de plants. Kabesha et sa famille ont comme souhait d'avoir un champ leur appartenant, ce qui leur éviterait de payer à chaque saison les frais de location. Il estime que cela aura sûrement un impact dans les revenus qu'ils obtiennent lors de la récolte.
texts.en:
It has been seven years now that Kabesha has been farming tomatoes, a skill she learned thanks to her family and that they do together. This work helps Kabesha a lot. For example, during the last season, she earned 170 dollars, despite the problems related to a lack of water, pesticides, and plant disease.

Kabesha and her family wish to have their own field, so that they can avoid paying rent for a field each season. This will surely have an impact on their earnings they get after the harvest.

loans.use: to pay for labor, planting, weeding, and to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 39-year-old housewife and a mother to four children, ages 2 to 11. Her husband is a welder.

While looking after her children, Victoria also buys and sells bananas and is engaged in farming rice to earn an income and help her husband. She is asking a loan to buy more bananas and to pay for house renovation since her home already needs repair.

Victoria is confident that with hard work and determination, she will be able to send her children to school and succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy bananas and to pay for house renovation

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma, 49, maintains two small businesses in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has done rice farming and has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years now. She and her husband have a persevering character that allows them to bear the uncertainty of farming when the weather is not good.

She is asking a loan to reestablish her store’s inventory and buy tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, and bath soap and to pay for tuition fees of her two children, ages 17 and 18.

Thelma hopes to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar,  bath soap and to pay for tuition fees of her two children.

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en:
Electrical door alarms are now in greater demand in James-Town in the greater Accra region of Ghana, and this has help boost the progress of Kwesi's business.

Kwesi is a single parent who has a child in the elementary level of education. This hardworking man works so hard to improve his standard of living, keep up with his bills and pay school fees.

Kwesi's major problem is the lack of capital to boost his business. He therefore seeks a Kiva loan through ID-Ghana to buy more door alarms to be able to meet his buyers' demands.

loans.use: to buy more door alarms to be able to meet his buyers' demands.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 50 years old. He lives with his pensioner mother in Ozurgeti district.

Davit is involved in agricultural activities and grows maize and nut trees. He works hard and sells the harvest locally.

Davit decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,100 USD. With the received credit he will purchase a minibus and will work on a minibus line to transport people and generate stable income.

Davit is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work on a minibus line to transport people and get a stable income.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bala is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Bala will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Bala now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45000 PKR to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 52 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Nasreen is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list.

Currently she needs a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Balla est le client qui tient en mains la corne du bélier.
Âgé de cinquante ans 50 ans Balla est un  embaucheur malien des ovins. Marié, père de cinq 05 enfants. Il rêve dans l’avenir de construire une maison dans une ville pour ses enfants. Balla n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais il se défend bien dans son embouche. Balla a fait recourt au RMCR pour  soutenir et renforcer ses activités. Avec son prêt, il achète des béliers et les aliments bétails dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Il engraissent les béliers et les revend dans les grandes villes. Plus de 15ans d’expérience dans l'activité il fait un bénéfice mensuel de 38 000 FCFA environ par mois.Il est client fidèle du RMCR il y a plus de deux (02) ans . Grâce au soutien  du RMCR, son activité marche  bien. Ce qui lui plait beaucoup dans son activité en est qu’il génère assez de profits ainsi que de la fumée organique pour ses champs.
texts.en:
Balla is the borrower whose hand is on the goat's horn. He is 50 years old and is a Malian livestock farmer. He is married and the father of five children. He dreams of building a house in town in the future, for his children. Balla did not have a chance to go to school, but he does well raising livestock.

Balla joined RMCR as a way to support and strengthen his work. With this loan, he is buying some rams and some feed from the weekly markets in his area. He will fatten the rams and resell them in the large towns.

With more than 15 years experience in this area, he earns an average profit of 38,000 francs CFA each month.

He has been a loyal customer with RMCR for more than two years. Thanks to RMCR's support, his work is going well. Balla is very pleased that he can earn enough with his livestock farming, as well make organic smoke for his fields.

loans.use: to buy a sheep to feed and resell.

loans.name: Ruhuha Group

texts.fr: Avec ses 30 ans d'expérience dans l'agriculture, Bugoma la pratiquait auparavant pour la subsistance. Son idéal est de quitter la subsistance pour l'agri business afin d'améliorer ses conditions de vie. Le groupe RUHUHA a huit hectares qu'ils espèrent exploiter grâce au crédit qu'ils auront à recevoir. Avec le crédit de PAIDEK, il espère améliorer les conditions de vie. Bugoma est l'homme sur la photo.
texts.en:
With 30 years' experience in agriculture, Bugoma has been subsistence farming. His goal is to quit this and start farming for business as a way to improve his living conditions. He is the man in the photo.

The Ruhuha group has 8 hectares of land that they hope to farm thanks to this loan. With this loan from PAIDEK, they hope to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to harrow the land until the harvest.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and a mother of three children of whom two are in school. The other one is still young. She’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She owns a food cafe that she has operated for the past six years, selling at home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from fellows in the same business, and her aspirations are to open another business in the near future.

Fatuma is borrowing this loan to buy more stock of food for her cafe, including maize and wheat flour. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will help her very much.

She joined Yehu to have access to loans that will help in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food for her cafe, including maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Abizeranye Masaka Group

texts.en:
Vestine is a 31-year-old married mother with five children. She has operated boutique business for the past three years. She works every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m., and currently she has one employee to help in the business.

While the work is tough and the hours are long, Vestine is committed to her business so that her children may prosper. She is a leader of the group Abizeranye Masaka, and she is the one who has a schoolbag in her hands in the photo.

Vestine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods like sugar, soap, bread, salt, etc. for sale. With this loan, she will earn more profits, which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability as well as too pay her children's school fees and medical insurance.

Vestine hopes that in five years she will be able to get a big boutique in which her community can find various and more goods.

loans.use: to purchase various goods like sugar, soap, bread, salt, etc. for sale.

loans.name: La Nueva Generación De Horacio Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LA NUEVA INTEGRACION DE HORACIO” conformada por 05 socios. Este es el caso de EUMILA de 45 años de edad SOLTERA con 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de desayuno como pan con huevo  quinua leche y muchas variedades más. Desde hace más de 1 año que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder tener local propio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de pan huevo quinua leche y aceite. El grupo “la nueva integración de HORACIO” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Eumila es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste chompa color azul oscuro.
texts.en: This is the new group "The New Horacio Integration" made up of 5 group members.  One of the members is named Eumila.  She is 45 years old, is single, and has 3 children.  She works selling breakfast foods such as bread with eggs, quinoa, and milk, among many other options.  She has been running this business for more than one year.  Her greatest desire is to be able to have her own locale.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy bread, eggs, quinoa, milk, and oil.  This group, "The New Horacio Integration" is thankful for Kiva's lenders who have made this loan possible.  It will allow group members to continue improving.  Eumila is the second person from the left.  She is wearing a dark blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, quinoa, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is a 43 year old mother with 2 lovely children and still enrolled at senior high school. Adriana and husband – Yakob, a 55 year old and retired, run a room rental business and managed by Adriana. They have constructed 7 rooms for rent. She decided to run this business as she won’t lean on Yakob’s wage as he is retired.

She has been running in this for 3 years and it is going well this far. At the moment she planned to set up downpipes as needed by the rooms in the rainy season. She was interested to the TLM loan product when a friend told her about it. She then requested a loan of IDR 2,000,000 from TLM for the materials. She really wants to get the loan from Kiva through TLM.

loans.use: to buy the material for downpipes from her building.

loans.name: Adan Orlando

texts.es:
Adán, de 50 años de edad, es bachiller, está casado, su esposa es comerciante de cerdos y también destaza, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando.

Adán, tiene un pequeño taller de estructuras metálicas y también tiene experiencia en el comercio de ganado, él hace puertas, portones y barandales. 

Adán, necesita el préstamo para comprar material para hacer un pedido de 4 puertas, específicamente comprará hierro, electrodos, discos y 4 chapas. 

Adán, sueña con ampliar su taller para tener una mejor fuente de ingresos y así poderles dar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adán is 50 years old, he completed secondary school and he is married. His wife sells pork and works as a butcher. He has three children who are studying.

Adán owns a small workshop to build metallic structures. He also has experience in selling livestock. He makes doors, gates and handrails.

Adán needs the loan to buy materials to complete an order of 4 doors; specifically, he will buy iron, electrodes, metallic discs and 4 metallic sheets.

Adán dreams of enlarging his workshop to have a better source of income and to be able to give an education to his children.

loans.use: to buy materials, specifically iron, electrodes, disc plates, and 4 metallic sheets, to complete an order of 4 doors.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a twenty six year old married woman with four children living in Masindi-Uganda. She operates a shop that sells mobile phones and their accessories. She is a hard working woman and supplements on her income through phone charging and repairs. Annet hopes to build a house so that she can stop renting. She requests for  a loan to buy more phones and alcohol for selling.

loans.use: to buy more phones and alcohol for selling.

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en:
Leatu is a maize farmer from Kargo village.
