As a Babban Gona member, Leatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Leatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Leatu can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Leatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Leatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Wendlassida Group

texts.fr: Wendlassida vient de finir son 1er prêt kiva. Le remboursement a été fait normalement. Ouinlassida, membre représentatif remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs de kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Ouinlassida avait pu payer des condiments et des céréales pour vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer des habits pour ses enfants, de payer la scolarités de ses enfants en plus de ça elle a payer un moyen de transport et aussi rénover sa maison et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Ouinlassida a encore besoin de crédit pour continuer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
The Wendlassida group has just finished their first loan with Kiva. Repayment went correctly.

Ouinlassida, the featured borrower, thanks [Kiva] staff and lenders for their support. With the [first] loan, Ouinlassida was able to pay for condiments and cereals, which she resold. She earned enough to allow her to buy clothing for her children and pay for their school fees. In addition, she was able to cover a means of transport, renovate her house, and expand her business.

Ouinlassida needs this [new] loan to continue her business. After her sales, the earnings will allow her to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, beans, corn, and millet.

loans.name: Famille Mukuninwa Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis sa jeunesse que Mwengwa a commencé la riziculture, initié suivant le contexte socio-économique de son village. Ce qui lui plait actuellement, c'est fait d'être soutenu par PAIDEK et ses réalisations. La saison dernière, il a atteint un montant de deux cent dix dollars dont cent cinquante ont constitué les charges et soixante comme gain. Mwengwa est l'homme sur la photo.
texts.en:
Mwengwa started farming rice when he was young, following the social-economics of his village. He is the man in the photo.

He is very pleased now to receive support from PAIDEK and their achievements.

During the last season, he earned 210 dollars, where 150 dollars covered expenses and 60 dollars was profit.

loans.use: to pay for labor at the harvest.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 40 years old married and supporting six children.

She sells dry groceries a business she has done for over fifteen years earning a monthly income of Kshs.15,000.

She has borrowed a loan of Kshs. 50,000 as her third loan after having cleared the previous loans successfully.

With the loan she plans to add maize, beans and millet to her stock of cereals.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to pay school fees for her children as well as repay her loan.

Her future dream is to see her children excel and educate them to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to add maize, beans and millet to her stock of cereals.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a thirty seven year old married man living in Masindi-Uganda. He does farming as his major business Salary alone was not enough thus was inspired to start the business. He has been teaching for six years in a Primary School. He is charged with a responsibility of looking after his children. His salary is delayed and this has been a great challenge to his development programms. He needs a loan to buy cement for construction.

loans.use: to buy cement for construction.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Salima owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Salima has operated a firewood and fuel selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of working capital which has made her not be able to expand her business.She also sells lessos to increase her income which has been rewarding well and hence her reason to take a loan.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of firewood and more bales of lessos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood and more bales of lessos for resale

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hajara is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Hajara will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Hajara now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nyenga Seminary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fr. Patrick. He is the head teacher of Nyenga Seminary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Buikwe with 780 students.

Nyenga Seminary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining UV water and Tulip filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase UV and Tulip Filtration water treatment systems with a 450 litre tank and five sets of 20 litre buckets, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Nyenga Seminary School will repay its loan from school fees, which they collect each term. Fr. Patrick ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice has been a farmer for 20 years and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Teso District. She is 50 years old, married and has six children.

Beatrice likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Beatrice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Beatrice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate three acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing solar lights, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Nile High Kiyunga School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Moses. He is the Bursar of Nile High School Kiyunga, a mixed school in the rural area of Kiyunga with 800 students. Nile High School Kiyunga has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 5 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Nile High School Kiyunga will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Moses ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Betty, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children. She is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Betty joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Betty plans to send her children to school.

Among the 14 farmers in Betty's Group, a total of 6.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing solar lights, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Don Rafel tiene 43 años de edad,  tiene 2 hijos y su actividad principal es la ebanistería y renta de locales, tiene varias años de tener estos negocios y le va muy bien.

Don Rafael  tiene muchos clientes que le buscan por su buen servicio y atención, es un hombre muy responsable y dedicado a su negocio, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de madera, martillos, seguetas, serruchos, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio y poder obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia.

Su sueño que es poder darle muy buena educación a sus hijos  

Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Rafael is 43 years old. He has 2 children and his main activity is cabinet making and renting premises. He has had these businesses for some years and they are doing well.
Rafael has many customers who seek him out because of his good service and attention. He is a a very responsible man and is dedicated to his business. He is requesting the loan to pay for wood, hammers, saws, hacksaws, etc so that he can keep his business going and make the income necessary to keep raising his family.
His dream is to be able to give his children a good education.
Trojes, Honduras - November 2015.

loans.use: to buy the wood, hammers, hacksaws, saws, etc for his business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 45-year-old widowed man charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children. He runs a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as sugar, soap, cooking oil, and plates among other items. Stephen has been in this business for four years. He used the accumulated savings from his fishing business to start his shop as he has the duty of paying school fees for his children. Seasonality at the lake affects Stephen’s fishing business and his shop is affected by price fluctuations. 

Stephen is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, soap, cooking oil, plates, and other items to sell. He dreams of building a permanent home as a legacy for his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil, plates, and others items

loans.name: Carlos Santos

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 10 años, y su negocio es la construcción de estructuras metálicas y plomería.
Él es emprendedor, dedicado y muy independiente. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la ciudad caracterizada por encontrarse en medio del altiplano, a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Carlos es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como cocinera y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la cerrajería, él se ocupa de fabricar armazones y estructuras metálicas de todo tipo para exteriores e interiores de casas, oficinas, parques, etc., mayormente los trabajados más demandados son, rejas para jardín, marcos para ventanas, puertas, portones y otros, “la puerta de entrada de los comercios es el acceso clave de seguridad, esta se debe abrir a diario y debe ofrecer la tranquilidad necesaria…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso debido a que cumple los plazos establecidos por sus clientes. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con gran experiencia, la desventaja es la falta de máquinas de trabajo. Su sueño es construir su casa propia, el desea comprar una máquina compresora y un arco de oxígeno. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carlos solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina compresora y un arco de oxígeno para fabricar puertas metálicas.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 43 year old man. He lives with his partner and they have a son who is 10 years old. His business in making metal structures and plumbing.
He is enterprising, dedicated, and very independent. He conducts his business around the city, which is in the middle of of the plateau at an altitude of 3,600 meters above level. The climate is cold and dry with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees centigrade.
Carlos has a brown complexion, short black hair, and is slim. His mother tongue is Aymará, and this is what he speaks with his family although he speaks Spanish in general society and for his business. He shares his life with his partner, who works as a cook, and with his son, who is in school. They live in a rented room made of wood that has drinking water, electricity, and is connected to the sewage system.
He is a locksmith and he makes frames and all types of metal structures for the exterior and interior of houses, offices, parks, etc. The jobs that are most in demand are grates for gardens, window frames, doors, gates, and other items. "The entry door of businesses is the key to security, this must open every day and must offer the necessary peace of mind..." he comments. His business is successful because he completes his orders on time. His business has the advantage of his great experience, and its disadvantage is that he lacks some machinery.
His dream is to construct his own house.
He want to buy a compressor and a welding arc. This is is first loan cycle with the institution in 10 years that he has been doing this work.
It is for these reasons that Carlos is requesting a loan to buy a compressor and a welding arc to make metal doors.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and a welding arc to make metal doors.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a hardworking married man who is a resident of the Masindi district. He is a farmer and is able to earn an income to cater for his family’s needs. Godfrey also lays brick as another source of income. He has been farming for 20 years. The goal of starting up his business was to sustain his family and ensure the education of his children. Godfrey’s major business problems are price fluctuations, pests and disease, and unpredictable weather changes.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to pay for planting and weeding and to buy chemicals to spray on his crops. He has a good customer base and they describe him as a hardworking and honest man. Godfrey’s dreams are to educate his children and expand and modernize his farm.

loans.use: to pay for planting and weeding and to buy chemicals to spray on his crops

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 32-year-old woman with one child living in Masindi, Uganda. For the past seven years, she has run a restaurant in order to earn money for her family. Jennifer has also opened up lodges to improve her income. She is blessed with good customer care skills that have attracted many customers to her businesses. Jennifer’s business challenges include the ever-changing weather and limited capital.

Jennifer is requesting a loan to buy foodstuff for her restaurant and beds, and mattresses for her lodges. She envisions that all of her children will graduate with masters degrees so as to acquire the best employment.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, beds, and mattresses, for her businesses

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a 48-year-old old widowed woman with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. For the past 20 years, she has been in the business of selling secondhand clothes. Zaina works hard to sustain her family’s needs. She has the responsibility to educate her children and provide basic needs as she is their only provider. 

Zaina is requesting a loan to buy clothing to sell. In the future, she hopes to buy land and construct a permanent house for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa de 36 años de edad, es dueña de una pulpería desde hace cinco años, cuando abrió su pulpería solo vendía  productos básicos, tales como arroz, aceite, huevos, algunas verduras y productos del hogar. 
Con el deseo de surtir su pulpería, realizó un préstamo a MiCrédito y Kiva el que utilizó para introducir en su pulpería la venta de gaseosas. Ahora pretende realizar un segundo préstamo con Kiva para introducir productos y comprar carnes rojas, blancas y los embutidos.
Elsa narra que el empeño que le dedica a su negocio se debe a que es madre de 4 hijos y aún debe hacerse cargo de la manutención de 3, esto sumado a su deseo de superación la mantienen activa en el negocio. 
Elsa afirmó que la introducción de estos productos que tanto buscan los clientes que la visitan, mejorara mucho su negocio, pues gracias a Mi Credito y Kiva su pulpería está creciendo, ella podrá obtener más ganancias y así mejorara  su entorno y la economía familiar.
Llena de entusiasmo nos contó que luego de pagar su segundo préstamo, desea pedir otro crédito para terminar de construir su casa. Entre sus futuros planes está integrar a la venta una pequeña tienda en la que pueda ofrecer ropa, zapatos, accesorios y cartera.
texts.en:
Elsa is 36 years old and has been running a grocery shop for 5 years. When she opened her store she only sold staple goods such as rice, sugar, eggs, some vegetables, and household products.
With the goal of stocking her store, she took out a loan through MiCrédito and Kiva, which she used to start selling sodas. Now she is hoping to take out another loan through Kiva to start selling red and white meat and sausages.
Elsa reports that the effort that she puts into her business comes from the fact that she is the mother of 4 children and has to take on the maintenance of 3. This has added to her desire to excel and be active in her business.
Elsa says that the introduction of these products (which her customers are seeking), will greatly improve her business. Thanks to MiCrédito and Kiva her business is growing and she will be able to make more income and so will improve her environment and the family economy.
Full of enthusiasm, she told us that, after paying back her second loan, she wants to request another loan to finish building her house. Among her future plans is to open a small store in which she will sell clothes, shoes, accessories, and bags.

loans.use: to buy red and white meat and sausages.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio, de 72 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir, actualmente está casado, su esposa  se dedica a realizar oficios domésticos y al cuidado de animales (especies menores como aves de corral y cerdos) y sus hijos ya son personas mayores de edad y viven en casas diferentes.

Rogelio, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, estas actividades las realiza desde hace muchos años pues aprendió con su padre; sus cultivos están cerca de su vivienda, por lo que no tiene que caminar mucho tiempo para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo.

Rogelio, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, pago de jornales y preparación de terreno para dicho cultivo, con el cual espera tener una buena cosecha a finales de este año.

Rogelio, lo que más desea es tener una vivienda digna, cómoda y segura para él y su esposaa.
texts.en:
Rogelio, 72, cannot read or write. He is currently married. His wife is a homemaker and also works raising animals (small barnyard animals such as poultry and pigs). His children are by now adults living in their own separate homes.

He earns a living growing basic grains, such as corn and beans. He's been doing this work for many years now, as he learned from his father. His farmed land is located near his home, so he does not have a long walk to reach his workplace.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and compost, to pay the day workers, and to prepare the land for cultivation. He is looking forward to a good harvest at the end of this year. 

Rogelio's greatest wish is for a decent home, comfortable and safe for him and his wife

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and compost, to pay the day workers and prepare the land for cultivation.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and supplements her income with earnings from selling food.

Mildred is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 34-year-old widowed woman with six children living in Masindi, Uganda. After her husband’s death, she opened up a retail shop to generate income to provide for her children. Jeniffer sells sugar, soap, toothpaste, and rice among other items. Her business challenges include inadequate capital.

Jeniffer is requesting a loan to purchase items such as biscuits, sodas, beer, rice and other products to sell in this festive season.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sodas, beer, rice and other products

loans.name: Danelia Esmelda

texts.es:
Palmeando tortillas con sus laboriosas manos se gana la vida Danelia, empezó con su negocio desde hace 8 años y con este ha sacado adelante a sus 2 hijos. A sus 29 años de edad es una mujer incansable y trabajadora.
Poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante y comprar mas leña, maíz y frijoles, gracias a eso ahora prepara más tortillas y por consecuente aumentaron sus ventas e ingresos.
Danelia, actualmente está tramitando un préstamo, el cual pretende invertir en la compra extra de maíz y leña,  pues para esta temporada en la que se celebran las  purísimas, navidad y año nuevo, sus clientes realizan encargos al por mayor y ella obtendrá mejores ganancias.
Danelia afirma que desde que empezó a hacer crecer su negocio de la mano de MiCrédito y Kiva, ha aumentado su clientela, pues ahora tiene clientes fijos quienes ordenan grandes cantidades de tortillas por encargo y también abastece a distintos comedores.
Después de concluir con los pagos del préstamo actual, Danelia desea seguir trabajando con Mi Crédito,  porque sueña con establecer su propia empresa de tortillas, contratar  trabajadores y distribuirlas en donde se solicite. 
Aunque todavía no se considera una comerciante auto suficiente, Danelia expresa que había estado mucho tiempo estancada, hasta que empezó a trabajar de la mano con MiCrédito y Kiva, ahora su negocio no volverá nunca hacia atrás.
texts.en:
Kneading the tortillas with her hard-working hands is how Daniela earns a living. She started her business eight years ago, and with this she has gotten her two children ahead. At her 29 years of age she is a relentless and hard-working woman. Little by little she has managed to get ahead and to buy more firewood, corn, and beans. Thanks to this she now prepares more tortillas, which increases her sales and earnings.

Daniela is now requesting a loan with which she plans to buy more corn and firewood. This is the season for celebrating 'Purísimas' [popular religious Nicaraguan festival], Christmas, and the New Year. Her customers place bulk orders, and she will get better earnings. Daniela states that since she started to make her business grow with a hand from MiCrédito and Kiva, she has gotten more customers. Now she has fixed customers who order large quantities of tortillas, and she also supplies different eateries.

After completing the current loan payments, Daniela wishes to continue working with Mi Crédito because she dreams of establishing her own tortilla company, hiring workers, and distributing where requested. Although she still does not consider herself to be a self-sufficient merchant, Daniela says that she had spent a lot of time being stuck until she started to work with a hand from MiCrédito and Kiva. Now her business will never turn back.

loans.use: to buy more corn and firewood.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru:
Это мужчина Абдулло. Он житель района Кубадиен. У него не большая семья. Абдулло любить свой район и свою семью. У него два сына. Жена домохозяйка и она работает на земле. Его семья занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Абдулло имеет несколько скотов. У него имеется несколько скотов. Доход от животноводческой  деятельности обеспечить его семью. Абдулло в работе помогает его сыновья. 
Абдулло хочет отремонтировать и улучшить жилищные условия семью. Скоро зима, и будет холодно, и он не сможет отремонтировать свой дом. Абдулло вместе семьей живет в старом доме. Он давно хотел отремонтировать свой дом, но у него не получилось собрать денег. Абдулло с большими надеждами обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
This man is Abdullo. He is a resident of Qubadiyon district. He has a small family. Abdullo loves his hometown and his family. He has two sons. His wife is a homemaker and she works on the land. His family works in the farming business. Abdullo has some livestock. The income from the livestock business supports his family. Abdullo's sons help him with work. 

Abdullo wants to renovate and improve his family's living conditions. Winter is coming, and when it is cold he will not be able to renovate his home. Abdullo and his family live in an old home. He has long wanted to renovate his home, but he did not manage to gather the funds. Abdullo is applying for a loan with a lot of hopes.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate his home

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a twenty-seven-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells produce that earns him income. He has been doing this business since 2011.

In his business he sells maize and soya beans so as to be able to get income to cater to his family. He desires to educate his children, though fluctuation of prices still affects his business.

Godfrey needs a loan to buy maize and soya beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and soya beans to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a sixty-nine-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He does farming as his major business, where he gets income to look after his family as a responsible man.

He desires to have a good homestead given the fact that he has worked hard for a long time. He complains about seasonality changes on top of loss of soil fertility, which leads him to have low returns.

Samuel intends to use the loan to weed and buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to weed and buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
Bonny is a thirty-three-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He runs an electronic shop that sells electronics, solar accessories, bulbs and many others things.

He has been in this business since 2011 and he has been able to cater to his family's needs using the profits. He desires to educate his children and have a stable source of income.

Inadequate capital is still a great challenge opposing his dream, but he is determined to work extra hard to fulfill his desires. Bonny needs a loan to buy solar panels and bulbs to sell.

loans.use: to buy solar panels and bulbs to sell.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
Eloina continúa con su negocio de venta de refrigerios (sentada al centro en la silla). El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó comprando harina e insumos de cocina, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque sus ventas fueron buenas. Actualmente la banca sigue trabajando unida, con el préstamo que accedieron pudieron comprar materia prima, refaccionar sus ambientes de trabajo y mejorar sus servicios. Su negocio de refrigerios tiene demanda por ser rápido, limpio y con muy buen sabor, lo más demandado son los sándwiches de pollo que se sirven fríos o se acompañan con un refresco, accesible a toda hora por ser liviano y fácil de digerir, “conocí nuevos clientes y mejoré mi comida, tengo la mejor demanda a media mañana y media tarde…” comenta. su negocio es exitoso porque entrega la comida en los lugares de trabajo de sus clientes. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende toda su producción, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es ampliar su clientela, ella desea comprar abarrotes como, harina, aceite, arroz, fideo y otros para ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eloina solicita un préstamo para comprar abarrotes para vender a sus clientes en su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en: Eloina continues with her snack business ( she is sitted in the center.) She used the last loan loan to buy flour and cooking ingredients, and her payments were good because her sales were good. Currently the group continues to work united, with the loan they obtained they bought materials, remodeled their work space and improved their services. Her snack business has a lot of demand because it is fast, clean, and with a very good flavor. The item most in demand is the chicken sandwich which is served cold or  served with a beverage, it is served at any time, because it is light and easy to digest. "I met new clients and improved my cooking, I have a lot demand at mid morning and mid afternoon.." she states. Her business is successful because she delivers at her clients workplace. The advantage of her business is that she sells everything she produces, the disadvantage is that there is competition. Her dream is to expand her client base. She wants to buy supplies such as flour, oil, rice, pasta, and others to expand her business. This is the 3rd loan with the institution in 30 years of working in this activity. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy supplies to sell to her clients at their workplace.

loans.use: To buy supplies to sell to her clients at their workplace.

loans.name: Sidfida Group

texts.fr: Sidfida vient de finir son 1er prêt Kiva. Le remboursement a été faite normalement. Ramata, membre représentatif du groupe remercie tout le personne et les prêteurs de Kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Ramata avait pu payer le riz, la farine de maïs et des condiments pour préparer et vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, contribuer aux dépenses familiale et surtout continuer son activité. Ramata a encore besoin de crédit pour continuer son activité. A l'issu de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en: Sidfida's first Kiva loan just ended, and repayment was made as agreed. Ramata, the group representative, thanks everyone at Kiva and its lenders for their support. With the loan, Ramata was able to pay for rice, cornflour and condiments to prepare and sell. She had a profit that allowed her to pay for her children's school enrollment fees, to help meet the family's expenses, and most of all to continue her business. Ramata still needs credit to keep her business going.The income from her sales will allow her to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, spaghetti and cornflour to prepare dishes for sale.

loans.name: Ida Group

texts.fr: Après la mort de son époux, Ida a décidé de se venir en aide en se lançant dans le commerce de pagnes. C'est à partir de cette activité qu'elle a pu s'acheter une maison d'habitation alors que son mari l'avait laissé  locataire; toute sa famille est prise en charge grâce à elle. Vu que cette activité nécessite un capital important pour être compétitive, elle espère que dès qu'elle en disposera, elle pourra être capable d'acheter un colis afin d'atteindre un résultat significatif. Ida est la dame qui porte un foulard sur la tête (photo).
texts.en:
After the death of her husband, Ida decided to come to her own aid by selling lengths of African print cloth (pagnes). From that business, she has been able to buy herself a house to live in although her husband had left her renting a house. She is able to come up for her whole family.

Since this business needs considerable working capital to be competitive, Ida hopes that as soon as she has enough (working capital), she will be able to buy a bundle so as to get a significant result. Ida is the woman with a scarf on her head in the photo.

loans.use: to expand her stock for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Koni est la cliente qui tient la corde du bélier,agée de trente-neuf ans (39 ans), elle est une embaucheuse malienne d'ovins. Mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants  dont deux (02) écoliers. Koni rêve dans les jours à venir d’acheter pour ses enfants des moutons et des bœufs. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais elle se bat dans ses activités. Koni a fait recourt au RMCR pour soutenir financièrement ses activités. Avec son prêt elle achète des béliers pour les engraisser et des grains de riz  dans la foire hebdomadaire de sa zone. Elle fait ses ventes  dans la même foire hebdomadaire de sa zone et dans son village. Koni fait un  bénéfice de 10 000FCFA environ par mois. Elle fait l’embouche des ovins et le commerce de riz depuis plus de quinze (15) ans. Elle est cliente du RMCR il y a plus de deux (02) ans de cela. Grâce aux prêts du RMCR, elle mène bien ses activités. Ce qui l’encourage d’avantage dans ses  activités en est qu’elle y génère assez d’intérêt. Elle ne se plaint pas pour le déroulement de ses activités.
texts.en: Koni is the group member in the photo holding the ram's rope. She is a 39-year-old Malien woman who raises sheep for a living. She is married and has seven children, two of whom are in school. Koni's hope for the near future is to buy her children sheep and oxen. She did not have the chance to go to school, but she is actively engaged in her work. Koni has used loans provided by RMCR (a Kiva Field Partner) to help finance her business. The money goes towards sheep and rice grains, which she buys from the weekly fair. She sells in the same market, as well as in her own village. Koni's monthly profit is around 10,000 CFA francs. She has been raising and fattening sheep and selling rice for the past 15 years, and a client of RMCR for the past two. Work has been going well thanks to RMCR's loans. She remains motivted to raise her earnings, and never complains about working hard.

loans.use: to buy sheep and animal feedstock.

loans.name: Irabandanya Group

texts.fr:
Grégoire  fait partie du groupe Irabandanya  et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 35 ans et est mariée à Joselyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 1 a15 ans  dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  la bière de banane et de bière industrielle dans son bistrot  depuis 10 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Grégoire is a member of the Irabandanya Group and lives in Gitega. He is 35 years old and married to Joselyn, a farmer. Together they have 4 children, aged 1 to 15 years old, 3 of whom are in school. 

He has been selling banana beer and commercial beer in his bistro for the past 10 years. 

This will be his third loan with Turame [a Kiva Field Partner]. He will use this loan to increase his capital and purchase a large supply of beer, which he will resell for a profit to raise his earnings.

loans.use: to grow his capital and buy a large supply of beer to resell and raise his earnings.

loans.name: Saymurod

texts.ru: Саймурод энергичный молодой парен в расцвете сил. Ему 35 лет, он женат и имеет двоих прекрасных детей. Живет со своей семьей в Шахритуском районе. Занимается Саймурод растениеводством.  Этому делу его научил его отец. На своем земельном участке Саймурод выращивает пшеницу. Теперь Саймурод хочет расширить свою деятельность, и для этого ему нужна материальная помощь, которую как он надеется, Вы сможете ему оказать. Саймурод хочет  на полученный кредит закупить семена пшеницы и в следующем году получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Saymurod is an energetic, young guy at his prime. He is 35 years old, married and has two great children. He lives with his family in the Shahrituz region. Saymurod works with field crop cultivation. He learnt this business from his father. Saymurod grows wheat on his land plot. 

Currently Saymurod would like to expand his business, and for this he needs financial help. He hopes you can help him with this. Saymurod would like to get a loan to purchase wheat seeds and get a good harvest next year.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine lives in Masindi-Uganda.She runs a textile shop selling material clothes as her major business. She is charged with a responsibility of looking after four children. She has been in this business since 2008 and it has helped her to cater for her family needs. Educating her children to acquire a minimum qualification is her great dream but inadequate capital  plus high license fees are a hindrance to her desire. Christine will use the loan to buy clothes to sell during the festive seasons when she will have many customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell during the festive seasons when she will have many customers.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yusufu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yusufu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yusufu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Yusufu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Razia to initiate her own business selling animals. She is a 30 year old married woman who has been doing business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.  She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Cristhim Group

texts.es: Por primera vez se encuentra solicitando  crédito el grupo Cristhim, comprometiéndose a ser responsables y cumplidas con las cuotas de sus préstamos para así poder cumplir con el desarrollo de su negocio. Quien coordina al grupo es Manuela, de 42 años, quien tiene una pulpería en su hogar y también se dedica a la venta de gaseosas. Con el dinero otorgado lo utilizara para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosa, big colas y fresquitos. Así podrá aumentar las ganancias y mejorar su economía. Las otras integrantes son Zeneyda de 19 años, se dedica a la venta calzados y sandalias. Lastenia, de 41 años quien tiene su negocio de taller de calzado y Heysell de 26 años quien de manera ambulante vende pio quinto y cajetas.
texts.en:
The Cristhim group is requesting its first loan and promises to be responsible and make loan payments on time in order to continue the development of their business.

Manuela is the coordinator of the group. She is 42 and has a small grocery store in her home where she also sells soft drinks. She would use the loan money to buy rice, sugar, oil, sodas, large sodas and soft drinks. That way she can increase earnings and improve her finances.

The other members of the group are: Zeneyda, who is 19 and sells shoes and sandals; Lastenia, who is 41 and has a shoe shop; and Heysell, who is 26 and sells pio quinto (a type of rum cake) and caramels on the street.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, sodas, large sodas and soft drinks.

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es:
Comprometiéndose a ser cumplidas y responsables y teniendo como meta un solo objetivo que es el desarrollo económico para brindarles las mejores condiciones económicas a sus familias, se encuentra el grupo las Fresitas.
Quien es la líder del grupo es Julia, unida, tiene su negocio de tapicería en su domicilio, donde se dedican a lapizados de sofá, montura, cascos y más. Requiere del préstamo para invertir en los productos que son de mayor utilización como la cuerina, espuma, tela para forrar muebles, pega e hilo. Las demás socias son doña Lilliam de 49 años dedicada a la venta de ropa nueva de manera ambulante desde hace 4 años, y Heydi de 30 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
Promising to be diligent and responsible and having their only goal their own economic development in order to provide better conditions for their families, the group Fresitas (Little Strawberries) was formed.

Julia is the leader of the group and she runs an upholstery business from her home where she upholsters sofas, along with making furniture frames and coverings. She needs a loan in order to invest in the products she uses the most such as faux leather, upholstery filling, fabric, glue and thread.

The other associates are doña Lilliam who is 49 years old and who has sold new clothing as a street vendor for 4 years and Haydi who is 30 years old and also sells clothing as a street vendor.

loans.use: purchase faux leather, upholstery filling, and fabric to upholster furniture, glue and thread.

loans.name: Burulbubu

texts.ru: Бурулбубу, 51 год, замужем, мать 4 детей, двое младших детей живут с Бурулбубу. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав больше 25 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, Бурулбубу на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 23 овцы, 2 лошади. На 1,80 Га собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает люцерну для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Бурулбубу в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком. Свои доходы Бурулбубу планирует вкладывать в развитие своего бизнеса и проведение торжества.
texts.en:
Burulbubu is 51 years old and the mother of four children. The two younget ones live ith her. Burulbubu has vocational education. As a additional income for her family, Burulbubu works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business more than 25 years ago. Thanks to persistent work, she has two cows, 23 sheep and two horses. She grows alfalfa for selling and own use on 1.8 hectares of own land and 2.0 hectares of rented land.

With an aim to further develop her business, Burulbubu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow with calf. She plans to invest the income in further developing her business and in holding a celebration.

loans.use: to purchase a cow with calf in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Piedad Del Socorro

texts.en:
Piedad is 54 years old and lives in the municipality Medellin. She has worked all her life so she can provide for her family. In 1985 she decided to start her own business; she makes clothes, and sheets and other products that she herself elaborates, something she learned by herself. This work has allowed her to give a future to her family.

The business has high competition in her location; that’s why she’s willing to improve her business by diversifying the products she’s making and offering. She’s asking for a loan so she can make a big investment in threads that she needs for a big production for this Christmas season.

Piedad expects that her business become successful and recognized so the clients prefer her. She also dreams of improving the conditions of her house. You can support Piedad’s dreams and business with just a loan.

loans.use: make a big investment in threads that she needs for a big production for this Christmas season

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and lives in the municipality Puerto Salgar. She’s the mother of 2 children, a daughter who is 12 and a son who is 10 years of age. Since they were born she has felt happy and proud, and also motivated to work hard to give them the best life she can. For that, she started a restaurant some years ago because she’s an amazing cook.

She wants to take her restaurant to the next level and she’s aware that to succeed she needs to invest in the business, but the inputs are really expensive and she doesn’t have the capital to do so. She hopes she can increase the profits, be more competitive and make the business sustainable. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy inputs like beers and snacks, and also to hire an employee for this Christmas season.

Esther dreams of watching her children become professionals, that’s why she expects that her restaurant will let her pay for an excellent education for them. You can be part of Esther’s story, loan now and support her dreams.

loans.use: to buy restaurant inputs like beers and snacks, and to hire an employee for this Christmas season.

loans.name: Yuri Andrea

texts.en:
Yuri is 32 years old and is a happily married woman. She lives with her husband in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. She has two children, a daughter who is 6 and a son who is 14. She’s a devoted mother and wife who works hard to provide for her family, that’s why, in 2006 she started a variety store where she sells many different products. There's always something new in her location.

She’s very grateful with her aunt who was the one who taught her how to manage her store. Now she wants to go further with it, so people get to know the business and appreciate the quality of the products and the good service she delivers. She hopes she can improve her sales, that’s why she’s asking for a loan so she can buy more inputs, diverse products and toys for this special Christmas season.

Yuri has a lot of needs in her house, but that’s why she works a lot. She dreams of providing a good professional education for her children. She also expects to fix some damage that her house has.

Help Yuri to improve her business and the life of her family with a loan.

loans.use: buy more inputs, diverse products and toys for this special Christmas season.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad, los deseos de trabajar y salir adelante de María, siguen en pie. Desde tempranas horas de la mañana llega al mercado de Granada a ofrecer el delicioso queso de vaca, típico del desayuno nicaragüense.  María nos cuenta que lleva tres años y seis meses comercializando este producto. 
Inicio su negocio de la mano de Mi Crédito y gracias al apoyo de la financiera ha mantenido el negocio estable y encaminado al crecimiento.
Todos los préstamos realizados los ha invertido en la compra de queso, pues en los inicios del negocio solamente vendía queso seco,  poco a poco introdujo al negocio una variedad de quesos: mozzarella, queso fresco, quesillo, queso ahumado, etc.
Actualmente está tramitando otro préstamo ahora con el apoyo de Kiva para invertir en la compra de más cantidades de queso, puesto que ahora tiene una clientela fija y  cada día se acercan más clientes al negocio.
Kiva y MiCrédito han proporcionado estabilidad en su negocio y un impacto positivo en su vida. María alega que el negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos en estos últimos años, con este sacó adelante a sus cuatro hijos y ha logrado avanzar en sus proyectos personales.
María nos cuenta que a veces en el negocio se presentan obstáculos, porque los precios cambian y solamente con suficiente dinero se puede buscar el mejor precio y el mejor producto. A pesar de estos inconvenientes asegura confiar en Kiva y MiCrédito para solucionar estos problemas.
texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and she wants to continue to work and to improve her life. In the early hours of the morning, she arrives at the Granada market in order to sell her delicious cheese made from cow's milk, a typical Nicaraguan breakfast. Maria tells us she has been selling her cheese for three and a half years.

She began her business with the help of Mi Credito and thanks to that financial support she has maintained her business and has seen it grow.

She has spent all of her previous loans purchasing cheese. She initially only sold dry cheeses but little by little she began to incorporate fresh cheeses such as mozzarella, queso fresco, cream cheese, smoked cheese, etc.

She is currently asking for another loan from Kiva in order to purchase larger quantities of cheese since she now has a loyal customer base and attracts more and more customers each day.

Kiva and MiCredito have provided stability for her business and have had a positive impact on her life. Maria states that her business is her only source of income these days. She uses her profits to help her four children and has been able to advance in her personal projects.

Maria tells us that sometimes her business can be challenging because prices change and sometimes she needs more money in order to purchase quality product. But despite these inconveniences, she trusts in Kiva and MiCredito to help her resolve her problems.

loans.use: purchase larger quantities of cheese.

loans.name: Karla Lizette

texts.es: Karla de 41 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su suegra y sus hijos, el esposo vive en estados unidos y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ella posee una pequeña farmacia ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda del esposo logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasion es para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Karla, age 41, lives in a relative's house with her mother-in-law and her children. Her husband lives in the United States and helps her with the household expenses.

She has had a small pharmacy at her house for six years. With what she gets from her sales and with help from her husband, she manages to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan now to buy more popular medicine wholesale in order to be able to continue with her sales and to get better earnings in this way.

loans.use: to buy more popular medicine wholesale.

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru: Мира, 45 лет, замужем, 2 детей. Cын-студент, дочь замужем, живет отдельно. У Миры средне-специальное медицинское образование, по характеру, спокойная, ответственная, пунктуальная и трудолюбивая. Мира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1994 года занимается сельским хозяйством, откормом скота, выращиванием сельхоз-продукций, выращивает фасоль. Начала этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Миры в хозяйстве имеется: корова и лошадь. Также имеет земельный надел в размере 1,50 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль. Ее деятельность приносит около 4,500 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Мира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и дальнейшее обучение сына.
texts.en:
Mira is 45 years old, married, and has two children. Her son is a student and her daugheter is marrid and lives separately. Mira has vocational medical education. As a person she is quiet, responsible, punctual and hardworking. As a main income for her family, Mira has worked with farming since 1994, breeding cattle, growing crops and growing haricots. She started this business with 10,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to Mira's persistent work, her farm currently has a cow and a horse. She also has a plot of land of 1.50 hectares, on which she grows haricots. Her business brings in around 4,500 som (KGS) per month. With an aim to further develop her business, Mira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and increase her herd. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her farm, and in her son's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Twizerane Ii Group

texts.fr:
Séverin  fait partie du groupe Twizerane II et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 51 ans et est marié à Matrone, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  .

Il fait le commerce du riz, du haricot,du sel,… depuis 10 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot et de riz   à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Séverin is part of the Twizerane Il Group and lives in Gitega. He is 51 years old and is married to Matrone, a farmer. Together they have 3 children. 

He has been selling rice, beans and salt for the past 10 years. 

This is Séverin's third loan with Turame (a Kiva Field Partner), which he will use to buy large quantities of beans and rice in order to resell them and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of beans and rice in order to resell them and increase his earnings.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, is aged 44, married to a farmer and blessed with five children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home.

Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase chips, beverages, shampoo, toothpaste, and beauty soap to sell.

She's hoping that her retail store will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase chips, beverages, shampoo, toothpaste, and beauty soap to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta was able to sustain her piggery through the generosity of Kiva and its lenders. She is very encouraged that her livelihood has really helped fund her daily needs.

She trusts that once again you could lend her a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to continue her business. She needs to buy more feed and medicines to raise healthy pigs. She does her best to take good care of her hogs for this is where she derives her income to feed her family.

Violeta's dream, just like any loving mom, is to assist her children who are financially hard up and also to be able to grow her pig farm. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional hogs and feed to raise and sell her hogs.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas has been involved in activities since 2008. She started her business with her own working capital of $ 300.00. Domingas has a shop as her business. 

She is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies that people like, including shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, hand and body care, milk, sardines, snacks and other things to sell. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, hand and body care, milk, sardines, snacks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lindalva

texts.en:
Lindalva is a businesswomen and she has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, card gambling supplies, hair clips, coffee, aqua, sugar, hand body, Including soft drinks and other things to sell.

Lindalva started her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $300. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She also has animals like a cow, pig, dog and goat.

loans.use: to buy slippers, noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, card gambling supplies, hair clips, coffee, aqua, sugar, hand and body lotions and soft drinks.

loans.name: Saman's Group

texts.en:
A 50-year-old married woman named Saman is a resident in Battambang province. She has a daughter in school to take care of. To make a living, she and her husband grow rice and sell grocery items. Pests seriously damage her rice crop and this is the main challenge to her.

As she is in need of working capital to save her business, she decided to lead a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund. She is going to use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crops. She hopes that she will get abundant yields to improve her living standard so as to keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase productivity of her crops.
